Reviews.Title: “Great Location Near Staples Center”
Reviews.Author: GaryBob
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights at The Standard as part of our trip to LA for the Grammy's. We did not want to rent a car and preferred walking and taxis to get us around. The Standard is only 7 blocks from The Staples Center, although they are rather long California blocks! Nevertheless, it is a nice walk, and we enjoyed being in that part of town. We felt very safe. We especially recommend a restaurant nearby that has never closed since it opened in 1924: The Pantry. Probably the best breakfast I have ever had. The hotel is a remodeled older building that has been transformed into a chic, niche hotel. The rooms are nice but adventurous. We knew ahead of time from the reviews that the shower was separated from the bed room area by a glass wall, so that was not a surprise. It did provide some opportunities for exhibitionism and laughter though. The bed was rather low as it sat on a platform. I did not mind the low bed, but the protruding platform was an obstacle. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and the in-hotel restaurant was quite good. We had breakfast there 3 mornings, and we ate dinner there one night. Good food and reasonable prices. Free wi-fi! Yea!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay :)”
Reviews.Author: Happytraveller888
Reviews.Content: This was our first staying at this hotel and WE LOVE IT from the moment we checked in till the time we checked out. Front desk staffs were friendly and helpful. We love our room (Xlarge corner unit with a nice view). We really like the soaking tub that most other hotels don't offer. We also love the Rooftop Lounge. The design was amazing, very modern and comfortable. We didn't use the the rooftop pool because it was little cold this weekend but we will use it in the summer for sure. It should be fun:) The hotel location is right in the middle of everything in downtown. Overall experience was great, we will definitely come back in the future. Thank You!

Reviews.Title: “A lot of fun!”
Reviews.Author: Liz L
Reviews.Content: This place is great! We had so much fun. We had a standard room with 2 doubles, and the room was quite spacious. Unfortunately the ipod dock and our phone weren't working. We were able to sort of Macguyver them into working, but it would've been nice if the front desk had brought replacements like we asked. The lobby is a great spot to people watch, the bier garten was fun but very empty when we were there. The rooftop is really nice before it gets crowded, and a zoo after 11. The red water bed pods should be avoided lest you want to flash some panty and look like an idiot trying to get out of them. The drinks are expensive and weak, but the party is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: LandHUk
Reviews.Content: As soon as we walked in we were swept up into a short film preview reception with appletinis on tap! A totally fabulous place - and one of the most sort after club locations in down town LA! Absolutely perfect for party people - 100% better than the west Hollywood standard unless single and cruising.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and original hotel in Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: deny67
Reviews.Content: This hotel is original (room design, roof top) if for business purpose you need to stay in Downtown LA The corporate rate is OK 170$ Pay just attention not to break your leg with the bed when you wake up : it is on a pedestal On the negative side, a little bit noisy if your room is on the street and not on the parking side The rate was excellent for LA about $160. This is a very funky hotel. Located near Staples Center and excellent restaurants with good meeting rooms. The "funk" is in the decor and rooms. The decor is almost entirely in red. Beds are on a pedestal on the floor and are quite low to the floor as is the television set. the bathroom has a glass wall looking into the bedroom area. In some rooms they have a sheer curtain too close to cover the shower from view. The bathroom also has what appears to be a large porcelain bowl that serves as the sink with no real vanity to place anything. was a long table by the windows that serves as a desk/dressing area. T

Reviews.Title: “Swanky!”
Reviews.Author: foxsteff
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the downtown Standard as I was going to a show at The Palace. The hotel is a short walk to the theater and very convenient to get to from the freeway. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the lobby is very fun with a pool table, ping-pong table, and a DJ in the evening. The lobby bar is small and cozy, and the rooftop bar/pool is simply fantastic with a great nighttime skyline view. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: dubupak
Reviews.Content: It feels like they took an old building and added modern designs. The rooms were kind of small and didnt feel clean. I didnt care for the shower window/door being so close to the bed - did not feel clean. Definitely a club scene and would recommend for people looking to party who are not looking for luxe accomodations. Good for mingling on the rooftop deck and in the lobby downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Funk in LA for a great price”
Reviews.Author: maltafaz
Reviews.Content: We held our partner retreat at The Standard. The rate was excellent for LA about $160. This is a very funky hotel. Located near Staples Center and excellent restaurants with good meeting rooms. The "funk" is in the decor and rooms. The decor is almost entirely in red. Beds are on a pedestal on the floor and are quite low to the floor as is the television set. the bathroom has a glass wall looking into the bedroom area. In some rooms they have a sheer curtain too close to cover the shower from view. The bathroom also has what appears to be a large porcelain bowl that serves as the sink with no real vanity to place anything. was a long table by the windows that serves as a desk/dressing area. There is no actual dresser. There is a closet however with the safe. it took some getting used to; however, I go to like the room. It is a bit spartan but for the price was very comfortable. the exercise room is excellent, large, and oddly decorated. it is a red plaid carpet with red baseboards and wood paneling throughout. Nevertheless, it has a charm not to mention great functionality. I found it to be one of the better exercise rooms I have been in in my recent travels

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Standard”
Reviews.Author: rjb296
Reviews.Content: Spent a night here for a work trip. The hotel is in the less desirable downtown LA area, not super close to much, but in an up and coming area that soon enough will probably be full of life. Room was nice, everything is low - bed and TV. Bathroom has a peep through glass wall that would not work if you are sharing the room with anyone other than your significant other. Shower is huge, but has a basic shower head. Was able to check in early, which was a plus on this work trip. Check-in was friendly. Food in hotel lobby restaurant was above average for hotel food. Elevators were slow. Hotel turns into a club after dark, so it could be off putting for some, but I heard no noise. Overall pretty standard stay - would stay again if work was picking up the tab.

Reviews.Title: “its just OK,... not fancy... Staff?... mmmmmm”
Reviews.Author: TravelsLisa
Reviews.Content: Its begging for a LOBBY MAKEOVER for sure! The building is beautiful OUTSIDE...white carrara marble... super nice... Rooms are cool and spacious and the tub is cool! Staff is nice EXCEPT the beyond RUDE puerto rican jersey shore looking bold bar tender at the rooftop. He totally does NOT belong working in hospitality at all! He should not have contact with people! A total disappointing experience. He got offended because he made me a WRONG gimlet! He was super rude when I mentioned to him he had made a mistake on the ingredients of my drink; He thew the drink in a terrible RUDE manner! Extremely Beyond description inappropriate! The hotel is totally different from the Standard in Miami Beach... TOTALLY.... but it is still in a great location, ok priced and the rooms are nice. Just be careful with the rude rooftop staff.

Reviews.Title: “Many a crazy night at the Standard”
Reviews.Author: OutandaboutAus
Reviews.Content: Every year we go to LA for work in May. Every year we end up visiting the Standard for at least one big night. Staying there is just as memorable. This is definitely no the place to stay for work unless you're in a crazy industry but if you're in the mood for fun in an usual environment while staying near the convention centre then GO! Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond a Standard Experience”
Reviews.Author: Social_Stardom
Reviews.Content: First thing - not for first travel experience together as a couple unless a glass-walled shower open to the bedroom works for you in the early stages - just saying! Breakfast is excellent in the 24hr restaurant, rooftop bar is somewhat overrated and past it's cool phase. Overall cool, but showing a little 'age'

Reviews.Title: “Good times”
Reviews.Author: tat2loser
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed at both of the LA Standards and this is by far the best. The minimalist layout of the rooms is great. Beds are comfortable and the see thru showers are a cool touch though you'll not have a lot of privacy in the bathroom if you're there with a guest. The rooftop pool/bar is really cool except for the crowd. Just enjoy the view and surroundings and ignore the typically douchey people all around. Try not to stay on the 12th floor as it tends to get quite noisy from the bar and from the parties. Be prepared for the parking situation, way overpriced valet and parking but in downtown LA its pretty much the norm.

Reviews.Title: “Different kind of hotel, the kind i like!”
Reviews.Author: Goviegovie
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for a couple of days while doing our tour of Cali but it was a great hub to be based from for Hollywood and downtown. You know as soon as you walk in that you are in a modern / funky / chic hotel that is anything but ordinary! The hotel feels like it was not desined to be a hotel but it still pulls it off with no problem. Our room was simple but really smart too. The bed was low (japanese style) with plenty of light and all the modern amenitieds you could want. The only bummer i could see was that the docking station was only good for USA i-pods but then i am from the UK so why shouldn't it. The best part of the hotel apart from the location was the roof top and the parties that were up there on a daily basis. It was pretty chilly when we were there (No fault of the hotel of course) which meant we weren't up there during the day much but at night we were there an awful lot! Drinks were typically LA price but that is only right. Great place / Great time!

Reviews.Title: “Much better then it's Sunset Boulevard counterpart.”
Reviews.Author: maxinegledhill
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed two nights here recently(December 2011). Very friendly reception staff and we got upgraded to a humungous room, which was fabulous. Love the decor of this hotel. The sunset standard is bleak by comparison. Really clean and nothing was too much trouble for the staff. Have stayed here twice now and would not hesitate to stay again. Much prefer downtown LA to the hype of West Hollywood etc......

Reviews.Title: “Very Hip”
Reviews.Author: DominicParamore
Reviews.Content: One of the most modernly stylish hotels I have ever visited. Loved all the little details from the printed graphics to the furniture -- not always the most comfortable, but very cool. The staff is first rate, Dominic at the front desk was a absolute pleasure and made our stay that much more enchanting with his warm friendly personality. The entire staff: security guard, valet and the housekeepers were a delight and always greeted us with a smile and hearty hello. For the price this hotel is a definite must stay in Los Angeles, truly a great place to see and be seen. Geared more towards a younger party crowd, not really the hotel for a family visit, unless grandma is a gangster rapper. One thing outside of their control is the noise, the floors creak badly, you can hear your upstairs neighbors easily as the walls and floors are paper thin.

Reviews.Title: “They aren't kidding, this is a party hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SydCityBoy
Reviews.Content: We arrived directly into beautiful LA gridlock. An accident on the highway meant it took over an hour to get from LAX to Downtown... and that was after sleepless 14 hours flight from Sydney, and the marathon just to get through the airport checks. It was POURING with rain when we pulled up. We walked through the rear entrance to reception. The courtyard and foyer were vibrant and hip, yet surprisingly unpretentious. Although it was merely 10am, some 5 hours before regular check-in, we were greeted with a smile. As it was early, and I suspect because I had already booked a higher level room, I was upgraded to the top floor suite. (The rooms are so affordable, that's why the higher room was booked originally.) I will say, I have never seen an elevator with such character. I vaguely remember a bank's insignia somewhere, which would explain it's 'rich' history. Up we hummed to the 12th floor, and entered the room. It was very... designed. Maybe a little over-designed? The bed was on a platform, which looked cool, but was totally impractical. The bathtub was in the centre of the room, that to was impractical, but so very very awesome. It was huge. Easily fit two (...or three!) in there, and having a bath with all the windows open at midnight with jazz playing, one of the highlights. The minibar was stacked with goodies, and at fairly reasonable prices. It had an excellent range, and even included medicinal products. Room service was high quality, reasonably priced, and very prompt. As the room was on the top floor, right under the roof-top bar, yes, it is a little noisy. Only with the window open though, if you had the TV on or were having a conversation, you could hardly notice it when closed. Anyway, the noise stopped between 1-2am... and if you're going to bed before then while on holidays in LA, read the title, you're in the wrong hotel. This is not for peace and quiet. The hotel is in a good location for buzzing around town, the Staples Centre must be seen to be believed, but it's in a poor location for the "glitz and glamour" of Hollywood. A taxi is $40 one-way, and that's without traffic. The subway is a couple of bucks, but, a whole lot more confronting. Staff were helpful, I never had any trouble with the roof-top bar, and the stay was all-round fun. Hot Tips: 1 - Don't forget to get your ticket to get to the Rooftop on a Saturday night, so busy! 2 - Make sure to stop off at the Standard Shop... browse the shelves, see if you saw what I saw! hahaha 3 - Dinner out one night? Head to 'Bottega Louie', it's two blocks away, great food, service and atmosphere. 700 South Grand Ave All in all, I'd go back for a hot weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Tacky and poorly designed room”
Reviews.Author: huajules
Reviews.Content: For a place that tries to stand out as being hip and different, they really should have given more thought to whether the changes are positive/functional improvements to a standard hotel. I'm only going to review the room because that's where I spent most of my time. Our room felt cold, uninviting and modern (in a bad way)--which is the opposite of how you want to feel when you're away from home. I likened it to a college dorm room with random, poor quality Ikea-like furnishings and cheap carpeting. All the furniture was low and seemed kind of ghetto. T.V. is tiny. Mattress was on a built-in platform and was asymmetrically placed, so that one side can use the platform as a semi-bedside table but the other side had nothing. I had to resort to putting my glasses, water, chapstick etc on the ground next to my side of the bed. Sleep quality was very poor--the mattress was soft and sagged towards the middle. There's only one chair in the room (the desk chair), so when my husband was using it, I literally had no where to sit except the bed. I've never stayed in a hotel before where there wasn't an arm chair. The bathroom had small white tiles with dirty gray grout--it felt like a hospital bathroom. The shower was a large stand-up shower (no tub)--which made it feel like a handicapped bathroom There is a clear window on the other side of the shower, so definitely do not share a room with someone who hasn't already seen you nude. We had to close all the curtains while showering because the building across the street would have gotten a direct view into our bathing activities. To top it off, the switch for the bed lights was by the front door, so we had to walk to the bed in the dark. What poor designs....I'll never consider staying here again. The room irritated me so much that I changed hotels after one night.

Reviews.Title: “Cool place with a unique vibe”
Reviews.Author: Henrik E
Reviews.Content: First, this is not a family hotel. The hotel has a unique party vibe and rooms with a special touch. Comfy bed (you basically sleep on the floor), a well-stocked mini bar and free wifi. The roof terrace is great for a couple of drinks but I guess the hip factor was higher a few years ago. Surrounding nothing special since the hotel is located in downtown but if you're in the right mood this hotel will give you a fantastic LA experience.

Reviews.Title: “I'm over it!”
Reviews.Author: MissTiffany412
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at this location 9 years ago. It was new and the staff was still happy to have you there. After a few occasions of hanging with friend for cocktails on the roof this hotel became my favorite in L.A. I recently moved across the country and wanted that "feeling" that I missed. So I stayed at the downtown location to bring back that old feeling of LA liveliness. The hotel seems the same. After almost 10 years I expected upgrades to match the rise in room prices. Everything was "standard" to say the least. Housekeeping wouldn't even bring a set of eating utensils to room because I brought in outside food. I use to Love this place. Needless to say, I'm over it now.

Reviews.Title: “The Standard is standard”
Reviews.Author: LANinaK
Reviews.Content: I had the exact same experience as outlined in hollibird's review. The single uncomfortable chair, the low platform for the bed that you had to remember not to trip over, the curtained off closet, the super low bathroom counter with tile that felt grimy even if it wasn't - all those things made the Standard of lesser quality than other hipster hotels I've stayed at. Unlike hollibird, I liked the idea of the bathroom's glass walls (I got some great photos of my boyfriend taking a shower) but because we were on the third floor and across from a tall office building and an uphill street, I had to close all the window curtains which, in my opinion is a big design flaw. I liked the kitsch of the building itself which was clearly a re-purposed office building of another era. And the restaurant was fun with its mod bright yellow decor. I loved that there's a pool table in the lobby. But it all lacked charm and comfort. The staff, for instance was pleasant but didn't match the level of professionalism that I'm used to. I've stayed at too many hotels that are trendy AND high quality. The Standard doesn't make the grade.

Reviews.Title: “I expected more”
Reviews.Author: Tom180
Reviews.Content: The Hotel strives to be hip and young. So maybe I am none of those things. The room was large and there was a bathtub in the middle of it - nice touch. But the mattress was as low as I would have expected in some parts of Japan. The room felt like Ikea on sale. The service was attentive and the staff friendly (Except parking) Overall, even with GPS, it was hard for me to find the entrance

Reviews.Title: “This chick isn't hip enough for The Standard”
Reviews.Author: hollibird
Reviews.Content: So - staying at the Standard was an experience. I was traveling on business and found this to hotel to feel more like a dormitory than a hotel. The good: - Staff was polite; guys working in valet were particularly courteous and helpful - I liked the lotion they provided. - The restaurant had great breakfast. Okay, let me preface this by saying I'm almost 40...and this hotel was not my scene. The night prior to my stay at hte Standard was at the Intercontinental. Some folks love this place, but I'm apparently not hip enough to appreciate it. Here's my take. The bad: - The desk was basically a bar that ran from wall to wall. - I had one chair in my room. It was a not very comfortable hard resin chair. If anyone came to visit, seating options were limited. However, if you left the shower curtain open, someone could sit on the toilet and still see everything in the room. - The bed was placed on a raised platform on the floor...careful at night or you might trip on the platform as it extends beyond the size of the mattress. - The TV (decent sized flat panel) sat on a cube only about 12 inches off the ground. - The small 1" x 1" tiles int he bathroom never felt clean to me...grout jsut didn't look right and was unsettling. - The counter in the bathroom is exceptionally low...very awkward. - The closet was "concealed" behind a curtain. Honestly - the place felt like a hodge podge of cheap furniture items thrown together. It simply wasn't the place for me. And, the glass shower will not allow you any privacy if you're traveling with a companion.

Reviews.Title: “The Scene for Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: kmichael30
Reviews.Content: A good location to access Koreatown, Chinatown, Staples Center and other neighborhoods surrounding downtown LA. The outdoor bar scene is a bit showy for me on business, but did offer something to do in close proximity, as there isn't much going on downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay...”
Reviews.Author: Oakchick77
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business and while it was clean and the rooftop terrace is lovely, that was about it. Here are the pros and cons: Pros: Downtown location, clean, the bed was comfortable for me, but it is very soft and is practically on the floor (no box spring). My colleague's back hurt after a couple nights. The rooftop terrace was really nice with a pool, dance floor and beer garden. The view from the terrace was also really nice, but you do need to be 21 to get up there so it's not kid-friendly. Cons: Room: Ultra-modern decor felt like I was back in the 60's-70's in a bad way, felt very cold and not overly functional. We also had a conference on site and the wallpaper in the room was drawings of naked ladies, very strange. The TV was not easy to see from the bed since they were both so low to the ground and at an odd angle. The cold-water knob on the bathroom faucet wouldn't turn easily and except for a pocket door to the toilet, there were only curtains separating the room from the bathroom (not much privacy). The hotel is also on a busy corner right on a bus line so it is extremely noisy during the day. Don't expect to sleep past 6 a.m. as the buses will wake you right up especially if you are a light sleeper. Service: The service was hit or miss. The internet went out during my stay there one day (it happens so that's forgivable), but one evening I asked for a wake up call but never got one (thank goodness for cell phone alarms). When I received my bill, I was charged for using the minibar that I didn't touch during my entire stay. Overall I was disappointed with what I got for the price and would definitely look somewhere else first if I stayed downtown again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Spidertravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and it was all worth it. The hotel had everything you needed and the staff was very friendly. The Rooftop Bar at this hotel is a must see! The views are stunning and we spent some time here every evening. There are also some very good restaurants in the area and the lounge at the Westin Bonaventure probably has some of the best views of LA from the 35th floor - the lounge rotates and the view changes constantly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good club and conference services.”
Reviews.Author: atrd86
Reviews.Content: I came here for a weekend conference, it was a nice unique room but they were out of double rooms and had to get a cot... it was reeeeally small but I still got a good sleep. The conference rooms where great and always had snack, coffee and water ready. The lunches where VERY good as well as every other menu item I had for dinner. The rooftop patio was very packed Friday night but I only went up for a bit, I went saturday during the time change thinking they'd stay open an extra hour but they actually closed at 0130am which was disappointing, but still fun. They say you get entrance to the club if you have a room but since I was sharing a room they said only one person gets entrance and the other has to be a guest. All in all it was a nice Hotel and I got it at a decent price and would stay there again if I was in the area. Some of my friends stayed at the Wilshire just a block away and there rooms were very dated and seemed cramped, so I'm happy I got in where I did.

Reviews.Title: “Got a cheap deal so okay, not worth what the hotel regularly charges”
Reviews.Author: LittleMissAverage
Reviews.Content: Very basic hotel, somewhere to sleep and that is it. The "frosted" glass between the bedroom and shower is not frosted, so if you do not know your room mate intimately you will after this trip. If you are planning on going to the night club, staying at the hotel is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Gross flies in our room!”
Reviews.Author: bulldog524
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not what I'd expected of The Standard. We were in LA for a show @ Nokia Live, and unfortunately other hotels we preferred were sold out. The reception staff was polite enough, but pretentious, much? The room was mediocre to downright depressing in decor; modern does not mean spartan. The TV stand is a cheap roller thing that lies so close to the floor that watching from bed is not ideal. The bed linens were cheap, and my husband's pillow had lipstick stains on it. WORST OF ALL: in the span of 30 minutes we killed 5, yes 5, juicy flies/gnats (not sure exactly what they were except that they were gross) in our restroom. That is just disgusting. The shower wall next to the bed was all glass, allowing whoever's in the bedroom to see you in all your glory. Strange....Also, what the ($@# is up with the toiletries? They smell like crap. Also, the walls are so thin we could hear the pretentious wannabe hipsters next door staying up all night. Luckily we had earplugs! I will never stay here again. Location wise, it's decent. It's downtown LA so use common sense when going out late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Price”
Reviews.Author: pasta-carbonara
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a night during october 2011. We chose this hotel due to its proximity to the Nokia Theater/LA Live. My wife and I were looking for closer hotels such as JW Marriott, Ritz-Carlton, Mardarin Oriental which were right there by the theater but they was no room available. Pros: --walking distance: 0.8 mile....about 15 min walk. --the rooftop lounge is a nice place to drink and hang out Cons: --Cheap bedding material/Rather utilitarian-looking room --Valet parking $30/night --Poor housekeeping service: I asked for a toothbrush and took 30 minutes and 2 phone calls. --We killed 5 flies/gnats in the room. I don't know where they came from but this certainly makes a bad impression for sure. --There's really nothing around there except for the LA Live/Nokia theater/Staples center. --I would not venture out too far in that area at night, especially if you are a single female traveler. --We could hear the next door guests talking all night....so glad that we brought our ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “If you have back problems, be careful”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoHappyhiker
Reviews.Content: The people checking me in and out were very nice and efficient. The room service was quick and the food quite good. I thought that the room decor was odd - it looks like they are going for ultra-modern and minimalistic, but the bed is a single mattress on a 6" carpeted platform (see photo). I had back surgery a month ago and I found it difficult to get in and out of bed, even though I am very active in general. If you have back or knee problems, you may want to stay someplace else. Related to that - they have a rooftop bar and sitting area which would be very nice, except that most of the "chairs" are impossible to sit in with any kind of back support. They are more like upholstered single beds with a small cushion at the back. Again, the staff on the rooftop were very nice. I saw a report of bedbugs in the bedbug registry, but I didn't see any evidence of bedbugs. In general the room (and the hotel in general) looked clean, aside from a little mold in the shower grout. I smelled cigarette smoke and was told that the security personnel are allowed to smoke in the hallways.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Style”
Reviews.Author: Derwood35
Reviews.Content: The front desk people were very friendly and helpfull. You cannot watch t.v. from bed as it is sitting on the floor (both the bed and the t.v.! Very uncomfortable. After waiting 20 minutes in the restaurant couldn't get a coffee in the morning. On the second day they closed the pool, bar and roof for a private party. Guess what.....screw you guests. This hotel is more oriented for teenagers to young adults. When things are not shut down for private parties the place must really rock. It is really a shame because the potential is there. Management needs a lesson is customer relations.

Reviews.Title: “fun place”
Reviews.Author: DeltaGolf17
Reviews.Content: Last week I was there from Sunday through Thursday, I usually stay at the Checkers Inn by Hilton. It is a little stuffy and i wanted a younger crowd (late 20's early 30's criowd) The atmosphere was great every night they had a dj in the lobby along with foosball, pool and table tennis. The decor was was great, and different. Really overal everythign worked really well. A few negatives to the place. This might be my own personal experience but $30.00 a day for valet parking is a little high. especially when in the same parking lot they are only charging $15.00. Also the first night there i requested a roll away upon checking in that was $50.00, and i had to request it 3 times. At the bar i ordered my usual captain and coke, except this time it was a 6oz. glass packed full of ice, so i got a shot basically and it was $8.00 and I was told that i couldnt get a double unless i tipped the bar tender and extra amount. (on a side note I feel I am a really fair tipper I usually start at 20% and if you go above and beyond I will certainly compensate you for that.) So this extra grease money to get a double drink which now costs $16.00, that is a little ridiculous. Maybe its because we are in downtown L.A. oh wait except the bar across the street is half the price for twice the drink. Any rate Overall the staff was very friendly and the valet guys did bring my girlfriends cell phone to her room out of her car when she asked. Also the drink girls at the bar did hustle around to keep my drinks filled for me. and the roooftop bar was one of the coolest places I had seen in awhile. Are room was also awesome, It looked like a 70's pimp palace. I would stay there again, and park my car across the street, and drink across the street.

Reviews.Title: “More personality than your regular chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: Magdaneagu
Reviews.Content: Very nice design to the room, and you could see that they put some though into it. All the cosmetics in the bathroom were natural, and they were very careful with their selection. On the other hand due to the location the room can get quite noisy at times, especially in the morning when people drive in to all the office buildings around. Good location if you have a conference at the LA convention center. It is about 15 minutes walk. They have a terrific bar on top of the hotel, which can be an up side if you want a nice place to have a drink, but a down side on the evenings when they have parties in there and the hotel gets filled up with a lot of people queuing in for the rooftop bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great rock n roll experience”
Reviews.Author: jazk
Reviews.Content: Get the real LA downtown experience in this hip and happening hotel. Fab-u-lous design, with a great diner and an even better rooftop bar. Loved it. Will stay for pleasure not business next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy and ultra modern! Me Like-y!”
Reviews.Author: Kimba_Kutie
Reviews.Content: A group of us gals went to LA for a weekend of shopping and art openings. My friend had stayed at The Standard many times and highly recommended it. Boy, this place is NICE! Swanky digs, unusual beautiful ultra-modern rooms, and excellent service! Everything was great about the hotel. Only drawback is that it's in the heart of downtown, so be prepared to hear the traffic below. Parking can get price-y because of constantly having to tip valets. But everything else was awesome! Delicious breakfast in the little restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Treat yourself to this design hotel”
Reviews.Author: s_scarnera
Reviews.Content: As a couple who loves modern style and design, this place was great for us. If you're not then I wouldn't recommend it. Rooftop pool and bar are fantastic and we utilised them both. A morning swim on the top of the Standard truly was an experience. They upgraded our room as we were on our honeymoon. Room was well-designed and felt luxurious. The wifi didn't work in our room which was hugely frustrating. Receptionist didn't seem to care when we reported it so we spent a lot of time at the rooftop bar where the wifi did work. Maybe that's what they want you to do. We found parking a few blocks from the hotel for $15 per night which is better than $30 at the Standard. The location's not great for going out. Downtown more-or-less shuts down at night so we ended up paying a lot for parking as we were taking the car in and out of parking to go out in other parts of LA.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you're "RICH" can you stay here.”
Reviews.Author: 334travel
Reviews.Content: Upon checking in the concierge was helpful and friendly. We were looking forward to staying here. We booked a single room- without knowing that the bathroom had glass walls- the shower was totally see through next to the bed. We were unaware of this and had I not been with a friend this would have been totally inappropriate. We later went up to the pool- ordered "duck nachos" minus the duck. The server told us no one had ever ordered them that way and would find out if that was possible. We waited for 20 minutes with no response and finally she brought them out without confirming the order. "Nachos" at this hotel consist of 4 chips with cheese for $11! Totally dissatisfied I gave her a $20 and asked for the change, which she pocketed. She told us she would be back with the change- ironic since she had a change pouch on her! We waited another 20 minutes then proceeded to the bar to see if they could give us change- which they could not. Without apology, she finally gave us our change. This was an awful experience, we felt totally ignored and not at all like guests. When we got back to our room we called the front desk to speak with management- they said no problem and hung up on us? No one called us back. When checking out I asked if there were any charges on my credit card (we had not ordered any room service or used the mini bar), to which they replied no. Since being home I've noticed I WAS charged $100 and can only speak to answering machines at this hotel. Very unhappy, will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: Gothampanda
Reviews.Content: This hotel will appeal to those who have a sense of humor, like modern design, and place a premium on being part of a scene (for 20 and 30-somethings). Staff are nice enough, but do not go expecting a level of luxury or business-friendly service. We stayed in a "Gigantic" room. It had the aura of a hip dorm room converted from office space- spartan furnishings leavened with modest custom design touches and fixtures. PROS: well-stocked mini-bar, very soft beds (if you like that), convenient Downtown location, fast valet service CONS: they missed our wake-up call (good thing we didn't miss our plane), the free wi-fi did not work, not enough lighting if you wanted to do work at the desk, poor sound isolation (we could hear the conversationsand partying in adjoining rooms and in the hallways), terrible smelling slimy soap/lotion/shampoo/conditioner, strange smelling hallways. Maybe we are at a stage of life (late 40's) where the positive features of the Standard don't outweigh the negatives anymore. Others may love the scene, but we'll stay elsewhere next time we go to L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Not Your Father's Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheOaksCostaRica
Reviews.Content: The Standard is a conversion of the old Standard Oil office building, something you would not guess from the common areas, but makes perfect sense when you are in your room. We stayed in the HUGE room, which is kind of like ordering a grande nonfat latte at Starbucks, spacious, but HUGE? Not. Since I am in the hospitality business, I noted the small cost saving measures like curtains covering the closet and bath, not doors, and a mattress sitting on a low built-in platform, not a bed. Very basic retro furnishings, but then again, you are not paying for the luxury you are not getting, so good value for money. This is not your father's hotel. (The Four Seasons, or the Beverly Hills Hotel, is.) The WOW comes from the rooftop bar and pool, where if you do see your father he may be holding court with a Cohiba. The views are spectacular and the night life lively without being aggressive, a place to see and be seen. The restaurant is first rate, a little bit of a diner feel to me, but to die for asparagus tips and sweet potato fries. Great front desk, and the usual laid back valet service. If I needed to stay downtown again, I would come back. If downtown was not vital to my plans, then the Four Seasons Beverly Hills, which also has a lively bar, but is more your father's hotel. Or, the Beverly Hills Hotel for genuine retro.

Reviews.Title: “the standard isn't standard”
Reviews.Author: bdicke
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Los Angeles for the wedding of our son. Many of the wedding party stayed at the Standard. What a fun place. It isn't for families and be aware that the king room has a glass wall shower that allows viewing from the bedroom. The two bed rooms have two shower curtains so view is covered.The staff was wonderful to us in every way, from the quick service valet, personable waiters in the cafe, and professional staffing at the reception desk. Great downtown location made it perfect for us. Thanks Standard!

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in LA!”
Reviews.Author: Lelya_RU
Reviews.Content: 1) Great location 2) Amazing rooftop pool and bar - makes you stay in the hotel for whole day and night 3) Surprising rooms 4) Ping-pong table at the lobby 5) Great breakfasts in yellow sunny restaurant downstairs - BALT (A- for avocado) sandwich is served with organic french fries - mmm, delicious and have i already mentioned the ROOF TOP POOL and BAR??!)))

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel For Young Adults (Or the Young At Heart)”
Reviews.Author: DebraKriz
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a weekend trip to the Standard to celebrate our anniversary and we were absolutely enthralled. The property definitely leans to the younger crowd but even as 50 + we felt welcome and were infatuated with this hotel. The sense of humor in everything associated with the Standard is terrific, we were constantly smiling, yet the attention to the important details never suffered. I've rarely been at a more attentive hotel where even the smallest detail was handled. The rooftop deck is a lovely spot any time of the day although the evening crowd isn't over 35. We went to our room after an hour or two on Friday evening as we were beginning to feel like we were chaperoning our adult daughter's party. But that was quite fine as our room was beautifully appointed and so comfortable. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Best downtown LA hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: AGMathis
Reviews.Content: OK, not really a standard business hotel, but I loved it even though I was traveling on business. When I arrived the lobby was full, music was playing, people were mingling and the place has a pretty tight vibe. Some won't like that type atmosphere, but it works for me. They upgraded me to a very large corner room. It was gigantic. Although the decor is minimalstic, it was also very comfortable. The bar was great. The 24 hour diner/restaurant was excellent and convenient. There is a first rate barber shop in the lobby -- didn't use but was tempted. The staff were relaxed and friendly. You can play foosball or table tennis while killing time waiting for your car or your room respectively. If you like things quiet and predictable you might not enjoy as I did but it's a winner for the young at heart.

Reviews.Title: “Rooftop bar/pool surreal!”
Reviews.Author: LoliB818
Reviews.Content: Okay.... I stayed here for a different experience from my usual Beach experience. The Hotel is ultra modern. It's a retro theme and that is not my style at all. Plastic chairs red white color theme, abstract wall decor... I like luxury, this them isn't my style at all. But here's the plus's: Fast check in, amazing rooftop bar. pool, music, vibe super kewl, great service! when I checked into my room I was MORTIFIED, I almost started to cry.. I Immediately wanted to leave.. it resembled a DORM! so small, no balcony, no view the windows faced buildings, just recalling it as I write this makes me feel sick. The basic room is ridiculously small. There is a bed and an open shower toilet totally exposed , with clear resin walls. weird. I IMMEDIATELY asked if I could upgrade to a larger room but there was no availability so the first night I sucked it up and stayed in that crappy lil dorm room, with air conditioning that didn't work! I woke up in a pool of sweat... :( thirsty and tired. Back to the roof~ super kewl vibe great service... very surreal sitting up there in this oasis looking out onto all these buildings... but what a different experience! So next day...I managed to upgrade to the HUMONGOUS room and the desk girl ( Jessica) kindly gave me a better rate,, it was room 803 a corner suite wayyyy bigger and a really decent view.. trees included. The shower area and sink is private and completely done in white tile... it's so awesome and clean, and makes you want to redo your bathroom immediately !who needs a shower curtain and rug? I slept so well... the BEST sleep ever the MOST comfortable bed ever The most comfortable linens ever the cool air conditioning oh my.. I could have slept there forever!! The staff are top shelf. everyone from the valet guys to the doormen, the waiters, they are all friendly, kind, accommodating, the food is ok, nothing stellar,repeat NOTHING worth talking about.. room service expensive. But the whole rooftop vibe is intoxicating... so you just remember that! The one observation I made is the extreme darkness on the escalators going up to the roof and the elevator area as well. seriously I'm no old lady and I couldn't see a thing! ARE they looking for a lawsuit here when someone breaks their neck ? or saving on electricity? or is this the new "mod" thing? DARKNESS? haha~ So I check out... "Jessica "Kindly gives me a map and directions...last day so I left drove out to Santa Monica got to the pier... enjoying my last hours before I flew home.. horrified I realized I left my wallet and passport in the SAFE! I phoned the hotel asked for Jessica the lovely girl who I upgraded me and helped me alot... she ended up arranging a courier to bring me my wallet and passport to the police station on the pier in an hour! amazing service!! Consensus: Jessica is the best Hotel employee I have ever witnessed. She is a gem! she consistently greets every traveler with the same warm greeting and info, very professional, and I see great things for this young woman.. she could manage the whole property with ease! She is a valuable employee for the Standard.She never gets flustered, just makes you feel like everything is going to be great! Consensus: stay here but ONLY the HUMONGOUS ROOM nothing less. The rooftop party is an experience so worth it, and I really enjoyed my stay here! do it! 2 nights totally worth it.. and ask for Jessica this girl will take care of you!!

Reviews.Title: “Will I stay or will I go?”
Reviews.Author: Givin2fly_11
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Downtown Standard for an entire week. I'm on the fence about returning when business brings be back to LA in a few weeks. Why? Pro's: Cute touches, everywhere. The phone buttons are hilarious as are the garbage can liners and the Mini Bar items. Loved the glass shower. Rooms decor is modern and sleek. The Mini Bar is very well stocked, but appears to not have been changed out in some time. Room Service food was delicious. Incredibly soft beds & pillows and no bed bugs (at least in my room) Everything you could possibly want, a phone call away. 24hrs I asked for a quiet room, and i have to admit, it was quiet. It also faced an alley so there was no view. But it was very quiet. Centrally located Great gift shop Cons: NO soda machines, no fridge in the room, no coffee maker. Nothing but the hotel restaurant (or the minibar) for food or drinks - and it's expensive. $7.50 for morning coffee. But if you don't mind the $$, this may be ok with you. Dont even think about toddling down to the uber hip cafe for coffee in no makeup & sweats. I did that once and it took the servers absolutely for-ev-er to take my order of a coffee, even though there was maybe two other customers and I was standing at the counter. Plumbing problems. First room had a toilet that ran constantly, the engineer they called said it was broken. I asked to be moved as I was going to be there all week, and they did. To a room with a toilet that gurgles and literally sprayed out the top intermittently. I draped a towel over the thing to keep the seat dry. It actually got me once, it was "bidet-like"(without going into details) being sprayed unexpectedly with cold toilet water and wholly unpleasant. The floor and seat were constantly wet, and the noise woke me several times during the night. The Mgr. said it was probably because it was the third floor (!?!) where the plumbing intersected. He seemed nonplussed and I wonder if he knew already. Parking. Darn, had to get up a half hour earlier just so the valets would have time to get the car out. They had great attitudes, as long as you tip. There was never any available spaces in the "cheap" self parking lot. At 30 a night for what boils down to mandatory valet, it adds up. Bathroom sink was stained and looked like it could use replacing. Missing room amenities. Missing Ice buckets, ashtrays, glasses, washcloths/towels (maids kept taking them and not replacing them), no robe. To make matters worse the ice bucket they brought me was dirty, like fingerprints and smears dirty. I sent it back. They were annoyed, and I did...not...care. Will I go again? Would you?

Reviews.Title: “Been here a million times...and will keep coming back!”
Reviews.Author: erikasaw13
Reviews.Content: Exceptional service...attention to detail and RADICAL rooms. I've stayed here with my honey a bunch of times and we ALWAYS have the time of our lives. Great place to party...not for the quiet crowd. The rooftop is great and we always have a memorable time up there...day or night. I got engaged int he WOW room and this hotel will have a special place in my heart forever!!

Reviews.Title: “The WOW room was....WOW”
Reviews.Author: Frank Z
Reviews.Content: We were very fortunate to get our rooms upgraded from the Huge to Wow and it was a great treat. The bathtub alone was worth it- we had just come from a 5 day dive trip and were pretty worn out. At 6' 2" it is awesome to be able to finally stretch out full length in a tub. This is just the kind of whimsical (giant foam foot dominates the bathroom like an artifact from Lost) place where you and your partner will not want to get out of bed and rely instead on their great room service. Who CARES what there is to do in LA!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: twentysixpoint2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I flew from Florida to stay one night. We actually booked the wrong location. We meant to book the one in Hollywood. Once we realized it, we tried to call the one in Hollywood but they had no available rooms so we had no choice. No problem, we thought. We drove up to the hotel valet and they told us to wait a minute. 20 minutes later, no help. We finally had to go ask for help. Girl who checked us in was very nice. Hotel has some chic, unique decor however, rooms were alright. No coffee machine, no hair dryer..hallways smelled like smoke and evlevators were old. Checked out roof top bar, pool is cool but bartender wasnt friendly at all. Checked out at 7 am, we booked a deal for free gas card and parking. Once we inquired about the deal.. The gentleman at the desk said he could not give us the gas card, we would have to wait 15-20 minutes or he could send it to us. We asked if he could just take it off our room. He said no and quoted, he had no way of compensating us, "I mean, it AIN'T comin outta my pocket." Really? We smiled politely and said send the card, that will be fine. Who knows if we'll ever get it Whole experience was terrible and hotel is totally over priced. Will never go back! We drove up to the hotel valet and were asked to wait a minute. 20 minutes go by, sitting in our car.. no help. My husband went and found someone finally. They parked

Reviews.Title: “Not all that”
Reviews.Author: ATLHotelLuva
Reviews.Content: Visited the Standard Downtown LA for a stay during the X Games. Had heard a number of great things about the hotel from friends. Can honestly say...ehhh. I stayed in a room that was actually quite large. The overall design aesthetic was great. However...it seemed like they focused so much on the design, they failed to focus on simple things like CLEANING and MAINTENANCE. My room was simply rough around the edges. All of the white furniture was dirty and scuffed. The desk wasn't cleaned well, nor was the floor in the shower. Also, given the size of my room, the distance from the bed to the TV warranted a larger TV screen than I had. Main lobby and roof bar were a scene. Had a great time and descent drinks. I only had breakfast in the restaurant downstairs. It was fine. Like that overall old school diner vibe. Overall, this hotel was "whatever" there are several others in the area at which I'd rather stay.

Reviews.Title: “A new Standard”
Reviews.Author: RuPa40
Reviews.Content: The Standard is a ironic funny hotel, that dare to do things a bitt different and it works. To convert an old office building to a 4-star hotel downtown LA can be challenging, but I think The Standard suceed. Service is good, rooms are odd but nice, rooftop bar and pool is a killer and the food is good. We`ll be back and most certainly try the other sister hotels in NY and Miami when the opportunity comes.

Reviews.Title: “Good for what it is”
Reviews.Author: bccorb
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at plenty of what some call boutique hotels and what I call design hotels including the Bleibtreu Hotel in Berlin, Clift in San Francisco, Arena Hotel in Amsterdam and a few others so like this type of hotel. Price was reasonable for this hotel as booked early and as part of travelocity deal so came to under 600 dollars for 4 nights over a summer weekend. The location in downtown in Los Angeles is both nice and a hindrance as downtown LA during the weekend is a dead zone other than this hotel. Was able to get nice breakfast at the Nickel Cafe and also a good brunch at Bottega Louie. I got a standard/Medium room which was plenty big enough for myself and the room came with free wi-fi though it was a bit slow as got around 11mbps. The bed was comfortable though only one side had place for clocks. Service was good though did have issue as first room smelled of recent smoking and my keycard kept failing so had to go to front desk multiple times to reswipe. This hotel is for couples and young people as do not bring kids or a friend unless you like the idea of watching your friend shower in the completely open shower(glass with no way to hide view from bed.). Did not check out fitness center. The rooftop is happening with many 20 somethings and the people they attract. I am from New York so prices were reasonable. Being hotel guest gets your priority access though they still require you to get a wristband from bouncer out front. Did not check out 24 hour diner but menu looked nice though a bit overpriced. There is no complementary breakfast as judge many people in hotel do not wake up before 10am anyway. If bring car park at self parking lot with entrance on hope st instead using valet on flower st. If looking for place to party in LA for weekend or a business man who wants to be trendy this hotel is a good option in downtown LA but just remember leave the kids at home and make sure friends get separate rooms.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I was in my twenties...”
Reviews.Author: BozzyNY
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that it was an awesome hotel when I first stayed there in 2004. It is getting older so am I... I stay there almost every year and I don't see any improvement and/or addition they did in seven years. Also I have to say it is pretty hard to keep up with the partying crowd every night. Even when the rooftop club is shut down at 1AM people continue to party in their rooms and it might get pretty obnoxious. If you are in your twenties and want to stay in a party house don't think twice...

Reviews.Title: “Loved the style and uniqueness of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: drohecker
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Standard for a few nights on business, and I have to say that I thought it was GREAT -- from the yellow fifties-style diner on the ground floor, to the funky animal-shaped bushes on the pool deck, to the glass-walled bathroom in my hotel room... this place just made me smile at every turn. I can see how it wouldn't be for everyone. This is not your neighborhood Marriott. Food at the yellow diner was delicious. Great service, espresso, omelets. Great drinks, too. I will say that one night we brought business associates to the ground-floor lounge for drinks after an event, and it took forever to get our order. I had to ask 2 times about our drinks. But that could have just been a bad night. I didn't get a chance to actually use the pool, or hang out at one of the bars on the pool deck, but I went up, looked around and snapped some pics. I just loved how they put it all together. Kitschy in a good way, fun, fifties-inspired furniture and lighting, cool lounge areas. Not sure what age group frequents the place on the weekends, but I bet it would be a great place to people-watch. I also thought it was a great value. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the Ruff”
Reviews.Author: debra100555
Reviews.Content: I only experienced check in and out service which was great. I stayed one night as I was attending a concert at the Nokia Theatre, walking distance to L>A>LIVE only 18 minute walk or a ten dollar taxi ride. Safe area if walking at night.. Very retro and hip and relaxing, staff young and very helpful.I noticed alot of families as well as singles.The room was a medium size for two people very clean and bed on pastel way cool.The Hotel used to be an office building pretty cool. I would stay again if need be.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool”
Reviews.Author: brendonaustin
Reviews.Content: Massive room with great decor and bathroom.Massive super king bed,free wireless.Great rooftop bar and pool.Location downtown so bit isolated but hotel is great.Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel, not for families”
Reviews.Author: yen-chi
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights and wasn't very impressed. Firstly, there is no concierge to help with baggage and the hotel wasn't aimed at families. Downtown LA is not suitable if you are tourist as it is in the financial district and LA public transport is virtually non-existent. Taxi's are also hard to get hold of in the area around the hotel so luckily we had relatives there to drive us around. Rooms were large and the decor was very modern minimalist. Had an hotel evening meal on the 1st night and it was ok but nothing that special. Hotel gave impression of having guests who were young wannabes waiting for their chance of stardom so wasn't ideal for us as a family. Better to book in Hollywood if you want to do more touristy activities. Food is generally good in LA, went to The Grove & Santa Monica and both times had good quality food. Once was Italian and the latter was Mexican food(steak is really good). The worst thing about LA, so much traffic and you tend to have to drive everywhere. Without a car is impossible in LA, so either rent one or have very kind relatives that reside there! Overall, I loved LA and will definitely be back, just not at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “HAVE TO SEE,LIVE IT..”
Reviews.Author: doğaduru
Reviews.Content: very ınterestıng hotel..lovely and frıendly stuff,large and desıgn rooms,heart of the cıty,prıce normal,we loved ıt and we'll be back...

Reviews.Title: “Not for families with young children!”
Reviews.Author: The_Milburns
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after the hotel we wanted to stay at in LA was fully booked. We had seen the good reviews for the hotel online and thought it would be a great place to stay. The selling point for us was the roof top bar and pool with fantastic views. Unfortunatley we were not allowed to access the rooftop with our 8 year old after 7pm due to it being a bar and therefore only accessible to over 21's. This was disappointing for us as it was the only reason we chose to stay there. The room was great with a comfortable king size bed and huge space. We were surprised that there were no free tea or coffee facilities in the room which you would expect at even the most basic of motels. Also, breakfast was not included in the price and is very expensive. Personally we would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A noisy hotel for party-goers - Think twice before booking”
Reviews.Author: vv0rk_T0_Travel
Reviews.Content: After reading this hotel reviews posted by other Tripadvisors we thought we have a good idea of what to expect and are going to enjoy our stay at The Standards with our eyes open. Sure, we like modern, boutique-like hotels. The minimal, cold and sterile design is also acceptable and having the bed placed so close to the ground is not a big deal in our eyes either. What really killed the experience for us is the noise from the endless partying all night long from adjacent rooms. We are awoken every night between 3-4am and we complained every single night. Other than sending the security to do noise control there is not much the hotel can do. Apparently the rooftop bar/lounge heavily leverages the promoters to bring the parties in and depending on the type of deals the promoter put together, there are "after parties" in the rooms after the rooftop lounge closes at 2am. (According to the front desk). Learn from our experience. Do not stay here if you are intending to sleep or get some R&R. You will be very disappointed and MAD by all the banging, music, and drunk guest running up and down the corridors.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL SERVICE EVER”
Reviews.Author: leilevi
Reviews.Content: do not stay here. everyone is so not helpful it makes you wish you had never booked a stay at the standard in the first place. the bar is atrocious. and the service is very very bad! do not waste your money.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: ak4d7
Reviews.Content: Well, for starters, I think it's funny how almost everyone that wrote a review stated that management never contacted them again after reporting an issue. Same happened to me! Where do I start? I have never stayed in downtown LA. Call me stupid but I had no idea that everywhere you went, you were charged for parking. I'm from Vegas...parking here is free, including valet, and you tip IF you feel it's appropriate. My bf and I pulled into the hotel valet and a gentleman told us it would be $15 for overnight parking for guests. I said okay - $15, not bad. I gave him the money and I parked my car. I had paid for a specific room and my agent got me a GUARANTEED upgrade (it was confirmed on an email) but then we ended up getting a DOWNGRADE...a cheaper room than what I had originally paid for. When I told the lady at the front desk she said "there really are no downgrades here...all the rooms are great." We got up to our room. The room was fine to me - except there were items already opened on the mini bar, there were BROWN stains on our sheets, the soap bar in our bathroom was already opened, there was a chunk of hair in our sink, and wtf is up with the TV placement?? I called down the to front desk, asked them for new sheets and also asked if there were any restaurants around that we could eat at. They named plenty of them. We left and everywhere we went was CLOSED. We ended up having to eat at the diner located within the hotel which SUCKED. When I went to the front desk and asked why they didnt advise that all the restaurants are closed, they apparently "forgot." We went upstairs, I showered...with my own soap. We left for a baseball game and when we got back, valet told us the lot was full and we had nowhere to park. I was mad. I paid $15! We had to wait 45 mins to get parking. When we went up to the room, the same dirty sheets were on the bed. We slept with no blankets. When we left the next day, I took a look at my folio and was charged an extra $35 for overnight parking. When I called the hotel to question it they said they'd get back to me and never did. I called three times and even emailed. And even had my travel agent call and email. Nothing. I will never go back to this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Bizzare, cosy for young people only”
Reviews.Author: Gadgetakias
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the hotel for three nights. The location is on LA downtown, the atmosphere a bit indie and hype. Rooms are clean but the bathroom has see-through glasses instead of walls, and you can see the other naked taking his bath! Excellent roof garden bar, not to be missed! Average wifi coverage. Expensive parking. They allow smoking, some rooms are smelling like hell! Caution, they charge you on check-out stuff you haven't taken from the mini bar.

Reviews.Title: “Why would you put the TV there????”
Reviews.Author: sarahmarieb2005
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a get away weekend to LA. Place was pretty much what I expected, overall I like it. The TV was put in the most awkward place since you are essentially laying on the ground. The cord was not long enough to put it in a comfortable place to watch.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Leave Mini Bar Key In Room”
Reviews.Author: abhakta
Reviews.Content: We were charged for items from the Mini Bar that we never opened/touched. We left the Mini Bar key at checkout in the room and were subsequently charged for items missing out of the Mini Bar which we did not take. I have reach out to hotel management three times and have not received a call back. I recommend refusing the Mini Bar key at check-in or returning the key to the front desk at check out to avoid Mini Bar discrepancies.

Reviews.Title: “Too hip for comfort”
Reviews.Author: FCLymond
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business for 2 nights--definitely would not return. Rooms cramped, sparse and uncomfortable. Terrible bed. Poorly appointed bathroom. Just not good. I get it: it's a hip, scenester spot. Doesn't make it a good hotel--look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not my cup of tea--will never return”
Reviews.Author: jesmsu
Reviews.Content: I hated this hotel. The bed is on a carpeted platform, the closet is a curtain partition, there is nowhere to sit except the bed and a molded plastic chair, no where to open up your suitcase except your bed, the floor, or a long skinny plastic "desk". The room is all white with some gray and a few yellow accents - trying to be modern, but achieving dreary (especially with the pilled, shabby looking blanket on the bed). The bathroom has a WC with a flickering fluorescent light, it's all cold white tile - again with very little comfortable space to put out your toiletries. Not to mention the giant floor to ceiling glass window separating my shower stall from my bed. Not necessarily a problem if you are alone--a serious issue if room service comes while someone is in the shower. Overall the room and hallways felt dirty and lonely to me. We went up to the roof for a drink and a snack around 6pm and were stopped by a bouncer with very serious attitude. Apparently this is quite a hotspot for the in crowd of LA. That's lovely, but he made us feel extremely unwelcome as paying guests of the hotel. The cocktails were fine, the food was terrible. I will say that the staff at the hotel were quite nice overall (excepting said bouncer). When I ordered room service the waiter asked me how my stay was, I said "I'm not hip enough to stay here" and he replied with "well, you can chalk it up to an experience"--indeed, and one I never hope to repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Robbery”
Reviews.Author: Squiggybeans
Reviews.Content: My collegues and I stayed at the Standard Hotel (Dowtown LA) while there for a trade show and it was the worst experience I had ever had. Sure the hotel looks neat when you first arrive but the longer you stay the weirder and more tiresome it gets. Oh and let's not forget the more the cleaning staff steals from you! Yes, while I was there not only did the cleaning staff take medications that were vitial for me but they also stole some jewelry from me as well. When bringing this up to the front desk and to hotel management they never did a thing. The people at the front desk accused me of lying about the incident and called me crazy. Even after leaving the hotel and trying to talk to management over the phone about the inccident they brushed me aside and told me they'd look into it and call me back - which they never did. As for the hotel itself, it was weird and not suitable if you are staying with work collegues or with your family. Everywhere you go there are sexual innuendos, from the bedroom to the gym. Yes the gym! Be prepared to workout with naked women on bikes displayed as a mural on the backwall of the carido area! The room is more than MINIMALISTIC it's CHEAP! The shower is all glass which means you are totally exposed to anyone else in the room, besides feeling like you are in a fish bowl. The bed, which sits on a low platform is way too low for my preference and forget being able to watch any TV while in bed - it's too low. The swimming pool and bar are on the rooftop but since it stays open till 2am, you'll want to make sure you don't get a room too high up or you will be kept awake till late with the noise. Also, the halls echo so when rowdy young grils go screaming down the halls or go giggling by with their lovers your bound to hear them. Overall, I'd suggest staying elsewhere. I definitely won't be coming back here.

Reviews.Title: “The Standard: Same As It Ever Was”
Reviews.Author: BoxingJohn
Reviews.Content: First off, don't complain about parking fees and bottle service prices in LA. It is after all, LA. Not sure what kind of expectations would have free parking and cheap bottles. The Standard is what it is: a funky hotel in a convenient downtown location with a great party vibe. For a 3 star property, it exceeds what a reasonable person would expect. We arrived Friday afternoon, check in was smooth and courteous. Went straight to the pool for some cocktails and sun. Service was perfect. After dinner we retreated back to the rooftop for more cocktails. Again, great service. Saturday was spent by the pool all day, once again nothing was missed. Lunch was had at the downstairs restaurant and was as good as it's always been. Cab was easily arranged to attend the event at the Staples Center that we came to see. Back to the roof, and back to the fun. I like everything about this hotel. I also like that some people don't like it. To them I say, stay somewhere else and leave the cheap rates at The Standard for me.

Reviews.Title: “not your average hotel”
Reviews.Author: packupupandaway
Reviews.Content: When pulling up to hotel.. the sign is upside down.. so you think hmmm whats up with that. If your looking for a regular hotel this is not for you. If your looking for fun hip and happening place this is it.. For example the shower is in the middle of the room, its just works for this place. Roof top bar is nice. We sat by fireplace as it was a cool evening in LA that night. We did use the valet parking they couldn't be any faster... nice to just go and have your car waiting in seconds. We did notice many people were locals so this tells me this is a cool place. Drinks at bar on roof top are not cheap but with the view I guess its not such a bad deal.

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel !”
Reviews.Author: HurdinT
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a trendy and unique hotel, you should stay here. The staff is very friendly. Great service !

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Sanni-mari
Reviews.Content: We stayed here late May 2011 for one night while visiting LA. On paper this sounded like a fab hotel but they just get it wrong. We love boutique hotels and as me and my husband both come from Scandinavia (home of amazing furniture design and cool minimalism) and work in a creative field I do feel at ease passing judgement on this. At first the plusses: The actual original building is cool, and the rooftop bar has stunning views. And they had a really comfortable bed in my opinion, though too soft for my husband. The minuses: $30/day valet parking is ridiculous. The room is trying to be quirky and minimalistic... unfortunately it ends up looking a cheap, not so very well designed and just a bit too try-hard. If you're doing minimalistic, you need to do it right and the furniture and fittings need to be of certain caliber. The lamps over the bed looked like they had come from Home depot. The room just ends up looking more a like a hostel. The stripey mural that was repeating the stripes from the curtains looked like an art school dropout had decided to try and be 'fun' and 'unexpected'. The shower is in full view behind a glass wall. Odd choice.... cool on paper, not so cool when you use it. Awful smelling shampoos, conditioners etc. And a weird smell in the room. I found long black hairs in the white, tiled bathroom. Disgusting. At the rooftop bar we tried to order caipirinhas (surely it should be a basic in any decent bar?)... they could not do it and instead we got the worst mojitos of our lives. Seriously BAD. I get it if it isn't the drink of the moment but these are pretty much classic drinks that any cocktail waiter should be able to produce. We didn't get a bad attitude from the front desk as some other reviewers have described, but the staff we're not knowledgeable. Don't waste your money, I certainly won't be trying this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Cool & Funky”
Reviews.Author: emzz82
Reviews.Content: Cool & Trendy Hotel. Decent size room(large room),comfy bed. Staff were helpful and nice. Rooftop area was really cool. A great hotel with that something different. Location was good,in the bussiness area,a block away from the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Interesting Atmosphere, Sound Value”
Reviews.Author: FBarillas
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay someplace that speaks "Los Angeles" the Standard Down is the place to be. In our week stay we saw many of Hollywood stars partake of a lazy lunch or dinner at the hotel. The top floor is a must-see place that turns into a great outdoor bar and dance salon during the weekend nights. A warning regarding the shower situation: if you are sharing your room with a colleague be aware that the shower has glass walls and the show can be seen from the bed. Two bed suites have a shower curtain inside the glass for privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Great for partying, not so great for sleeping”
Reviews.Author: BayArea4Life
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a few friends for another pal's wedding. It'd been a while since we'd seen each other so our LA buddy recommended the Standard a great place to have drinks, people watch, and then retire to our rooms. So firstly, I must say the scene was very touristy (even though we were tourists) we didn't want to feel like we were just as out of place as everyone else. I think the good company really made a difference. If this place opened in SF I think I'd go all the time, because I had a feeling if it had the right crowd it'd be a really great place. That being said, the service and bartenders were very good and we still managed to meet some new and interesting people. All in all, I can say it was a good night. We retired to my room, a suite, the other guys shared a double. I really liked the design and layout, I think though this room was designed for partying and not sleeping. We had a few more drinks and then they were off to their rooms. As I got ready to sleep though all I hear was the deep bass of house music. Very faint, but it was just enough for me not to get sound sleep. The bed itself is really cool looking, but not very comfortable. When I woke up, I was sore and just cranky. So in summary, I would still recommend this place, but you gotta know what you're getting yourself into. Want good rest, not the place for you. Looking for a fun place where you have drinks and just stumble back to the room? This is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Plastic, not fantastic”
Reviews.Author: TaxiCat86
Reviews.Content: Stay at the Standard if you're looking for an LA Scene type place. The hotel feels pretentious from the get go. $30/day valet parking, beautiful lounge area no one actual uses, beautiful pool area that you better have a smoking body to compare with. The only time we felt comfortable in the hotel was in our room, which was beautiful. the huge tub is amazing! We heard alot about the poolside parties but it wasn't our kind of thing, so we gave it a miss. the problem is, if you want a drink by the pool after 7, you have to get fully dressed up and look the part. breakfast not included and a simple breakfast for 2 at the restaurant came to about $40 before tips. The location is also not great if you are exploring LA. For the price, find somewhere a little closer to Earth. All in all, it looks really nice, but it wasn't our type of "scene". We would have preferred a place with a genuine and relaxed vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Funky and a bit quirky”
Reviews.Author: 88KW
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Standard hotel for 3 days and whilst I found the location quite convenient to restaurants, public transport and the tour bus stop, I didnt really liked the room configuration. The shower is fully visible from the room, which means you are totally exposed to anyone else in the room. It was weird and not suitable if you are staying with a friend and not a spouse/partner. Also the vanity in the bathroom is too low, and so is the bed, which sits on a low platform. I think the hotelier is aiming for a funky look. The swimming pool on the rooftop is pretty cool, but as the bar there opens till 2am, make sure you dont get a room too high up or you will be kept awake till late with the noise.

Reviews.Title: “It's aRave”
Reviews.Author: Don420
Reviews.Content: WOW, if your up for a party, enjoy the pool at the Standard, I rented the Penthouse VERY inexpencive and a very modern room, for friends to hang out. The roof deck has a full bar food..Guest D.J.'S like 12th planet D.J. Samantha, Danceing, pool pods that are waterbeds the pool is lit at nite very sexy blue and they show Gigantic movies on the building across the street...everybodys dressed for fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room but a little too hip and trendy for us!”
Reviews.Author: fullygr0wnlady
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights as part of our honeymoon tour of the west coast. The hotel is in a great location in down town LA and has an impressive lobby and entrance. The style is cool and chic and the room was huge. It had a yellow and grey theme and had a huge bed. The bath was gigantic and in the middle of the room which was very entertaining! We went up to the roof one night to check out the pool etc but found it to be a bit intimidating. The waitress seemed to ignore us so we left and went back to our room. Despite saying in the room booklet that there was a safe in our room, there was no safe to be found. As travellers we needed one for our cash etc so we rang down to the front desk. It took a while for the handyman to arrive and when he did he said there was nothing he could do as the room's safe was missing (a bit worrying!). After a bit of pushing he said he'd see if we could change rooms. Then he came back a bit later and installed a new safe. Overall, it was a great hotel for a short trip to LA but not a longer, relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “So Much Fun!”
Reviews.Author: ChristyJ123
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, the room was wonderful, the staff were very friendly and helpful, and we loved the rooftop bar. Just in town for the night for dinner and a play with friends, the two of us had a great time after returning to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Uber Hip - Not for Families”
Reviews.Author: lulu63
Reviews.Content: We went LA to show the kids downtown - a part of LA they had yet to see. Museums, Art Walk, Architecture, etc. The Standard provided an excellent location to see all of this by foot. They also had a very cool pool, games in the various lobbies, cocktails for the grown ups and a great reputation. Here's why we won't go back: Rooms are not family friendly (girls freaked about having to shower in a bathroom open to the entire room). Pool only open to kids in the AM (and no one bothered to point that out when we made reservations). Our kids have stayed in trendy boutique hotels before and there many small children staying the weekend we were there. First night we weren't able to sleep due to an all night party in the room below us (2AM - 8AM), or maybe next door....or maybe both. It was LOUD and the front desk was not impressed by our call at 6AM to please do something. Breakfast was good at the cafe. Starbucks was walkable. We enjoyed the various bars inside the hotel, the ping pong table and the very helpful staff throughout the hotel (except, surprisingly, for the front desk.....hmmmmmm.) We were there on a weekend and downtown was very empty but we saw some great sights. It has a super location for exploring downtown. At night the roof top pool lounge fills with locals in the 20 - 30 yrs range, not the rich and famous just the local and drunk. Great people watching.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby Sheik...more like SHABBY”
