Reviews.Author: vro921
Reviews.Content: Had been looking forward to staying at this hotel from all the things I'd heard about it being a trendy hotel and it being a hotspot to party. First off....be prepared to spend $33/night on valet parking if you need to overnight your car. There is NO self-parking. We arrived Sat. night around 11. There were lots of people milling around ready to party. Without sounding arrogant, the crowd just didn't seem like anyone I'd like to party with. Not the L.A. crowd I thought I'd see. The lobby looked cheaply decorated. Elevators were run down. As for the room, I was VERY disappointed to find a low bed (it was on an elevated platform), which in istelf is not bad; however, when the TV is not elevated high enough to even see from the bed, that becomes a MAJOR problem for me. If you like the MINIMALISTIC look, this is the room for you...sparsely furnished, and again...CHEAP looking!!! I felt like I was in college on my futon bed with my room all decked out in IKEA furniture. Took me until the next day to finally figure out a room temp that was comfortable. The iron couldn't be used because it had stuff burned onto it. I couldn't even use the MINIATURE (were they trying to be cute? Get a real one!) ironing board because it was broken. The PLUSES...fairly quiet considering you're in Downtown; floor to celing see-through shower (if you're into this); and a 24 hour restaurant. Overall, I'd suggest staying elsewhere. I definitely won't be coming back here. I had a better stay at Kyoto (also in Downtown L.A.).

Reviews.Title: “Expected More”
Reviews.Author: sweedeedee
Reviews.Content: I was not impressed with The Standard. Although the room did not cost much it was very sparse and service was sub-par. Room service forgot our order, maids did not clean, and at least in some rooms expect to shower on display (the shower has a glass wall that faces most of the room) . It was too cold to hang out at the highlight of the hotel, the pool rooftop, so I cannot comment on that. Location and parking was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home...and so funky and fun!”
Reviews.Author: Tilly_May_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at The Standard and cannot think of enough superlatives for it. Friendly, warm and efficient reception staff, stunning rooms and common areas, wonderful food, amazing service everywhere, a rooftop view I'll always remember. The Standard knows how to be cool, but not aloof. An added bonus was that in the hotel. or nearby, there were film and TV shoots almost every day. So LA! Great location, felt very safe and walking/metro distance to so many downtown treasures. If you haven't discovered the Metro, which is just a few blocks from the hotel...you must. It is such an easy and green way to get around. We went to Pasadena, Little Tokyo, Hollywood and Chinatown on the Metro. So easy. Plus, Rudy's Barbershop does fantastic (and cheap) women's haircuts and blow-outs...an unexpected bonus. And the gift shop is full of things to want and need. You will have so much fun staying here!!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay at at Great DT LA Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CARLSBADtraveler59
Reviews.Content: I was in DT LA for the Lady Gaga concert and lucked out with a great rate at the Standard. It was my first stay there, and I will definitely stay with them again as I am a frequent visitor to the area. I have stayed with most of all the other "competing" hotels in DT LA, and the Standard is one of my favorites, maybe even on the top of that list. I was lucky to have snagged a great rate, plus got a great, complimentary upgrade from a "HUGE" room to a "HUMONGOUS" room...what a room! Extremely roomy, great view with 5 huge window in a corner location, very clean, and most of all, QUIET...all attributes which are important to me. I didn't find any of the "attitude" or "tired, worn-out facilities" at all, as other posts claimed. Overall, I had a great stay & I look forward to my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: VandD_wimbledon
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying in this hotel. Front desk is friendly and helpful. Rooms are basic but functional. Convenient location. Rooftop Bar is fantastic! you dont really have to go out anymore since it's a party scene upstairs. Great music too. Rooftop can be busy which means its good rather than quiet area. Its a pretty exciting and intresting hotel. Its not your typical boring or grand hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and comfy”
Reviews.Author: Domesticatn_nprogrss
Reviews.Content: The rooms are fun with an ipod doc radio and a decadently large bath (Wow suite), and the rooftop bar has a great view. It's a shame it was raining when I stayed, but we still made the most of it. The beds are also very comfy, with down pillows and duvet, and the curtains are thick enough to make the room pitch black on a sunny morning. Showers had great water pressure, and the water came out boiling (you can turn it cooler if hot showers aren't your thing). Definitely a perfect hotel for a romantic night and a lazy morning.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and comfort in a dull area”
Reviews.Author: JimmehJim
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights on our arrival in the US to recover from jet lag. It was a great place to do so with a welcoming, friendly lobby/lounge with pool/table tennis tables and nice restaurant. Our room itself was spacious and interestingly designed with a glass bathroom. Best of all was the rooftop bar which very large and cool (swimming pool, astroturf, lounges everywhere), and offered 360 degree views of the city lights. Overall the hotel was very self contained which was just as well since when wandering around the immediate area we didn't find much of interest. There was a subway station one block away and LA Live a 20 min walk away though.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: shepherdieu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Standard downtown for 7 nights late Jan/early Feb and it was a pleasure. I was on the 11th floor in a 'humongous' room - decor was sparse but the room was comfortable, well lit, good mini bar, good bathroom and large. Location was great - we had meetings downtown which were all walkable. The rooftop bar is lovely, especially at sunset ... it can get a bit loud Fri/Sat night but we were aware of this when we booked so a bit of noise til 2am wasn't a big issue. The cafe downstairs is good for breakfast and lunch, gym was adequate. Staff were friendly and accommodating when asked - we got to the hotel 6 hours before check in and they fast tracked our checkin from 3pm to 11am which was great. Staff gave us dining recommendations too and helped with cabs etc. My only complaint was I never received a statement upon check out and despite 2 emails to the hotel they have never emailed me a statement/bill. Would definitely recommend. For downtown area it's the best of the bunch (decor, aesthetic, rooms) aside the Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Fun,Fun,Fun”
Reviews.Author: dkj160
Reviews.Content: Very reasonably priced rooms with ultra modern design. Great bed and huge bath. Very comfortable. The highlight of the hotel is the rooftop lounge. The hotel is in the financial district and the rooftop lounge is on the 12th floor. They have an excellent sound system, small dance floor, heat lamps and a fireplace, and pool. The building is encircled by towering skyscrapers which glow and twinkle in the night. This is a beautiful place anyone could enjoy. You don't have to be a "hipster" for this hip hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, fun and trendy. Love it or hate it.”
Reviews.Author: Foreign_Sun
Reviews.Content: As a former resident of LA, I had visited The Standard rooftop many times before, but never before stayed there as a guest. Several of my favorite bars are in the area, and I chose to stay here knowing I would be having a late night nearby. Check in was easy, though I do wish parking pricing was a bit clearer. I tried to self-park as I had done when visiting the hotel in the past. The attendant directed us upstairs to the valet parking offered to hotel guests instead. The way in which he said it made me think that it might be included in the room rate, though I probably should have known better (it was $33 for a little less than 24 hours). I was pleasantly surprised by the size of the room, which did in fact live up to it's "Huge" title. It was spotless and had a fully stocked mini-bar, snacks etc. We made good use of the oversized bath tub which amazingly fit us both comfortably, my boyfriend at 6'4" and myself at 5'10". The bathtub is open to the room save for a curtain, while the toilet is behind a closed door, so if you are concerned with privacy while showering/bathing, this might not be the best choice for you. Tongue-in-cheek humour abounds, like buttons on the phone for not just the standard "room service" or "front desk", but also "motivational speaker", "alibi" and "fluffer". Being a guest of the hotel gets you priority access and no cover for the always popping rooftop bar in the hotel, a bonus. Keeping this in mind, our location on the 12th floor also meant we could hear muffled music from upstairs (the bar usually closes around 1:30am). Because we weren't planning to go to bed early, nor are we light sleepers, this was not a problem, but I can see how it might be for some. We grabbed a late night bite at the diner in the lobby before heading out for the night, and though the food was great, the service was very slow and inattentive. Because we arrived later in the evening we called down to the front desk in the morning to see about late check-out, and they happily accommodated us an extra hour so we could make good use of the sun while lounging in the rooftop pool. This is based on availability though, so when the hotel is near capacity it may not be possible. We did have to wait a bit at the rooftop pool while some hotel staff took measurements and talked, I assume for a possible future redesigning. Once they were done we also had to wait for staff to bring up towels in spite of the fact that it was several hours after the pool usually opens. For those who have never visited LA before, don't be deceived into thinking this hotel's "downtown" location places you in the heart of everything as it would in New York, Chicago or Toronto. LA is really a massive sprawling suburb with islands of interest scattered all about. Staying at The Standard won't place you next to the beach or the Hollywood strip. It is however really a destination in itself with an amazing lobby lounge, rooftop bar and pool, 24 hour diner and very spacious rooms. The downtown area, although it can seem quiet after office hours, has many fantastic restaurants and bars tucked away and is ideal if you happen to be in town on the second Thursday of the month for the Downtown LA Art Walk when the streets become flooded with people visiting area galleries. The Staples Center and Convention Center are both nearby and the property is also conveniently located near the 110 and 10 freeways, and so relatively easy to get to other parts of the city. Overall we were thrilled with our stay, the only fault we could find was with service, which in some areas could have been better. Know that the hotel is young and trendy, if this is what you want....you'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “wow!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jozobami
Reviews.Content: this was my first trip to LA and my boyfriend booked this hotel as a surprise, and it was all i wanted from a hotel in LA. nice breakfast, valet parking, big (!!) room with great view of down town skyline, bed, tv, decoration/desig- lovely, huge nice bathroom.... i really loved it. one night we invited friends over to join us at the roof top bar, which we all enjoyed. the crowd at th eroof top did seem like pepole i woul dnot usually talk to, but we didnt care and enjoyed our group. staff was nice and the restaurant/ bar / pool areas were beautiful. its very close to the high way exit, but it takes about 30-40 min to get to the beach (rush hour much more) so i would consider staying at a hotel closer to the beach next time, but besides that i loved every minute here.

Reviews.Title: “The Standard has evolved into something special”
Reviews.Author: CocoFranco
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Standard for years but I have never been compelled to write a review because of inconsistencies in service, room quality, and stays. However, I think they are either trying to ramp up their quality or I was there over a slow weekend. Nonetheless, aside from the super stylish rooms and ambiance, the hotel was "on" this past weekend. Room service took less than 15 minutes and other services were excellent and timely. Every inch of the hotel was clean and tidy and the rooftop pool was fantastic. No complaints this time around. The Standard has definitely made its mark in downtown LA as the stylish business hotel of the moment.

Reviews.Title: “The Standard provides good value”
Reviews.Author: mrbehar
Reviews.Content: Good location, clean, neat and orderly rooms. Easy walk to convention center or Staples Center. Good food options close. Would have liked a conventional closet, but not a big deal to me.

Reviews.Title: “Too retro/modern for my tastes”
Reviews.Author: atlanta14
Reviews.Content: This hotel made me feel like an old geezer who isn't in on the joke. It's too trendy/retro to be comfortable. The lobby is very dark and not laid out easily so it's a semi-maze. The service is fine, but the rooms are not very comfortable. The bathrooms are tiled on the floor and part of the walls, and it has the feel of a spa locker room. The shower has a glass wall so people in the bedroom (and those in the building across the way, if you don't draw the curtains of the windows) can see you showering. The "bed" is basically a mattress on a raised platform - and is very soft. The TV is also close to the ground. The gym was great - decently sized space and new equipment. Also, apparently trendy hipsters don't need to work out because it was empty both times I went in. It has red walls and a retro theme of 70s superheroes (Wonder Woman, Incredible Hulk) on the walls. The only complaint I have is that it's located on a smoking floor so you have to hold your breath walking to and from the gym from the elevator. It wasn't terrible. Just not really what I wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Party there but don't sleep there”
Reviews.Author: DPhung
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with my stay due to the fact that I was on the 12th floor in a WOW suite which is right below the rooftop bar and Management failed to notify me that each morning at 6:00 am they were going to be doing a film shoot so they had to move lawn furniture back and forth and needless to say it was loud as HELL so I basically had a free alarm clock every morning at 6:00 that lasted for about 20 minutes. At checkout, I explained that to the front desk and the girl said that she would have the manager call me in the next couple of hours and that call never came so what they did was comp me a movie and a bottle of water for me getting 4 hours of sleep per day.

Reviews.Title: “it could be alot better”
Reviews.Author: foordo
Reviews.Content: well the room was very dirty, i found half smoked joints beside the bed. the atmosphere is really good and most of the staff was friendly. i liked that the restaurant was open all day. there was not plastic bottled water to take with me when i left, just glass bottles that wouldnt close and gross tasting water in a box( the stuff is terrible), i would still stay again though the roof top veiw is to die for

Reviews.Title: “Wintertime Sun and Fun at the Standard”
Reviews.Author: windycitywoman
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Standard for a weekend girls getaway. From the arrival in the fab lobby to settling in to the super mod room to lounging on the rooftop deck with amazing happy hour deals, the experience was nothing short of perfection. This is the spot to be sceney, modern, and comfortable all at the same time. Hoping to come back very soon!!

Reviews.Title: “A great Staycation!”
Reviews.Author: mrsdrdahl
Reviews.Content: Wonderful way to get away from it all! so lovely and so vastly different from my usual life...that I felt as if I was in a whole different city for the weekend! a real treat. stylish and swank. hip and groovy. and CLEAN. (which hip doesn't always equal). with nice folks working there too (also hip doesn't usually equal...) Great sun on the rooftop pool deck. the rooms were sparse and well designed with all the amenities needed but simplicity that was refreshing & with a good sense of humor. perfect for the birthday weekend event celebration! thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Modern chic smack-dab in the middle of it all!”
Reviews.Author: rissadee
Reviews.Content: Location - excellent! Service - superb! Rooms - wonderful, chic, comfortable. Rooftop bar has that laid back atmosphere. The only negative? The furniture (bed, chairs, loungers, etc) were very low. Standing 6'2"...I was thisclose to sleeping on the ground. Other than that, stay here. Worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Standard Downtown--Go for the Rooftop Pool and Lounge, Trendy Scene and Cool Design”
Reviews.Author: lanuchan
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay at The Standard Downtown LA--scored a $155 rate via Hotels.com. Loved the rooftop lounge and pool--have a glass of champagne on the roof as the sun sets, you won't regret it. Rooms are funky and cool. I like the pattern that continues across the wall from the curtains, and the see-through shower is cheeky and fun. As long as you have a car, you can valet it for $30/night (decent since you have in and out privileges) and you're not too far from West Hollywood if you want to go out. Dip in the pool if it's warm out, the scene is incredible. Cheeky design throughout the hotel too, loved the clever, fun furniture and accessories. Check out Bottega Louie nearby for brunch or lunch--you won't be disappointed! I wanted to check out the shop but didn't have time, I've heard its cool though. Overall, great stay and was very happy with what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Hip and cool in downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: Barry0007
Reviews.Content: Stayed last week for three nights with several colleages on a biz trip. As we were all staying solo the bathroom quirks were really non-issues. I found the staff totally pleasant and professional from the valet to the front desk to the wait staff in the restaurant. No complaints there and the food for breakfast and dinner was delicious. We spent an extended period of time over three days at the rooftop bar and it was a blast. Great views and happy hour prices for food made for a pleasant experience. I had no issue with noise in my room and experienced a restful sleep the entire time. The bed was comfortable although it was on a raised platform on the floor. Toiletries were refreshed each day. Other than my room key becoming non-functioning each day ( I was warned by the front desk to keep it away from my wallet) I had no complaints. I also received a great recommendation for dinner from the hotel mgr to go to Drago Centro (directly across the street) and it was great as well. Looking forward to coming back with my wife next time.

Reviews.Title: “Just stay away!”
Reviews.Author: Eliot22
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the standard for two nights because an acquaintance recommended this place. We should have read the reviews first because this place is a) nothing special and b) just not a good hotel. Having read some of the answers provided by management on this Website, I understand that this hotel wants to be just a little bit different from the others. This, I would wager, they have achieved but at what cost? The staff are different from other hotels but only in the sense that they are not customer-service oriented in a sort of Abercrombie & Fitch way, i.e. I was recruited for my good looks but don't know what the word 'denim' means. The man at check-in did not look at us, did not smile, did not say much and actually tossed me a piece of paper to sign without even providing a pen. The rooms are a completely style-over-substance nightmare. If you take the few 'arty' elements out of it, you're left with nothing more than a youth hostel interior and, let's be honest, its design isn't that hot either (but then I suppose I didn't stay in the room with the big black foot in the bathroom). I mean, every hotel has one or two pictures on the wall you know. You can literally count how many drops of water reluctantly make their way out of the shower head, the bed is too low and too soft and just not comfortable in any way, and the television is too low to be seen from the bed (and we didn't have a sofa either). The noise coming from upstairs and the other rooms were just too loud to be acceptable. I understand the idea of having the quirky bar and party-people audience but then do what other hotels do: Soundproof the walls with something other than cling film. I stay at hotels more than four months every year and have seen many rooftop bars. The main thing to address here is that you are not a nightclub; you are a hotel. If you wish to add one, make sure it's not at the expense of the other. By the way, the bar on top is mediocre at best. The staff upstairs seem to have been infected by the same disease as the ones downstairs. If the cocktail you ordered isn't hip enough, they treat you with the same disdain as they would someone who ordered a glass of milk (and I was tempted to check this out). In conclusion, of all the boxes that a hotel should tick, you really don't tick the ones that matter. It's really as simple as that. Is it comfortable? No. Did I sleep particularly well? No. Was it pleasant? No. Was I made to feel welcome? No. Of the things you pretend to be - something beyond the standard - you only rarely come close. It's pretentious, yes, but never gets close to the coolness factor that ought to go along with it.

Reviews.Title: “Too cool for its own good”
Reviews.Author: jilebee
Reviews.Content: I don't need to repeat what other reviewers point out about decor being very hit or miss because I would only say the same thing. Note to management: it's not just a matter of "Oh you don't have the right taste to appreciate our design." If so many people find your mod aesthetic somehow ill designed, there must be something wrong with it. Can someone explain to me why this hotel is so cool that it doesn't believe in towel rods or hooks? Other stupid design features: closet and shelves in the (damp) bathroom; no coffee maker or tea ("We don't provide coffee in our hotel; you can call for room service instead." Translation: we're too cheap to provide something that even the cheapest motel will); cheap, dirty plastic wash basin; no replenishing of toiletries when the room is cleaned; no glasses for water; no tissues; no extra toilet paper; no side table next to bed; and finally, the ridiculous bathroom with no doors! Don't ever plan on any business meetings in this hotel. Then there's the usual ridiculous prices in the restaurant and rooftop bar.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant”
Reviews.Author: copan28
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights and it was very pleasant. The hotel is situated in a better part of downtown and has easy access to major bus routes and metro stations. But at night, the area is really dark and there is barely anyone walking on the streets except for homeless people and beggars. Even though it used to be an office building, the conversion to hotel seems well planned. The people at the front desk were attentive and friendly. The elevators were fast but there is a ping pong table on the ground floor that kind of obstructs the access to the elevators. The room I stayed in was bright and airy. It had a minimalist décor but not high-end stylish furnishings. The flat screen TV sits on a low small plywood stand. There is also only one chair but a long work desk. The platform bed (or just the mattress) was very comfortable but it was covered with a flat sheet that was tucked in a way that exposes a third of the mattress. So when you lay down to sleep, your feet touch the bare mattress. Did not hear noise from the roof or street. I had no problems with the wi-fi. All in all, it was very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Just a "hip" youth hostel”
Reviews.Author: olleee
Reviews.Content: The hotel's roof top bar is terrific. That's why I always wanted to stay in the hotel, hoping that the quality of the rooms would match the great bar experience. I must say that I was more than disappointed. I understand that the hotel wants to be different and hip, but the hotel's hallways and rooms essentially look like a European youth hostel. Especially the bed is super annoying (see the other reviews for more details). So I strongly recommend staying at the Marriott or the Westin and walking a couple of blocks to the Standard, having a drink at the rooftop bar, and then returning to a much more comfortable hotel room. At least that's what I'll do next time I stay in L.A. downtown...

Reviews.Title: “the joy is in the details...”
Reviews.Author: neilsonparc
Reviews.Content: ...and there are so many great details at this hotel. The retro musical organ underneath a chandelier, the waterbed pods on the roof, the interesting restroom decor..once you've finished admiring the details hop in your room's huge bath with all of the new friends you've made at the rooftop pool party. The Standard thoroughly deserves its Hot Pink rating on the neilsonparc Lust List.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but location is crappy”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_travellers201
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the nicer part of LA although there really isn't anything to do. You walk a few blocks away and there are homeless people everywhere asking for things and you get in to the lower grade of downtown LA. The metro is close by on 7th street so we utilised this alot. You can catch the metro to Hollywood which is a much nicer area, but coming back to the hotel at night time was scary and I would not recommend going around by yourself at night as there were a lot of gangs around along with homeless people. We would never stay in downtown LA again. I would recommend paying the extra money and staying near Hollywood - Universal studios is only 1 stop away on the metro and you can easily get transport to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Pure fun, from the see through bathrooms to the roof top bar”
Reviews.Author: cowgirl2010
Reviews.Content: Just loved this hotel. Perfect end to a road trip. It is Downtown however loads of great restaurants like Katsuya nearby and locals very friendly.Very near freeway so handy for travel and airport. The decor made us laugh- a delight around every corner from the toilets, the lounge to the roof top bar. If you want fun, great roof top bar with views and sunset you'll remember forever come here. If I lived there I would be there every week. The staff were so accomodating and constantly checked if we needed anything- they even offered us extra shower gels- it smells amazing. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment”
Reviews.Author: StlTeraGram
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Standard and was excited for a mod hotel experience, but was quite disappointed. I have enjoyed staying in W hotels, and am not at all opposed to a modern decor. However the Standard failed to deliver. While the decor was technically modern, it was not very appealing and took "form over function" too far. The bed is on the floor. Everyone in our block of rooms tripped over it in the middle of the night and fell. Ouch! Also, the front desk was not very helpful or welcoming. Our room was not ready upon arrival--which happens--but the staff refused to provide any estimate of when it would be ready and was completely unapologetic. Room service, although delicious, brought us something other than what we had ordered. The room design was also inconvenient: two desks in a double room--but only one chair. The sink and bathroom counter are so low to the ground that anyone taller than 3' will have significant difficulty doing any task (i.e. applying makeup) that requires a mirror. The final inexplicable detail that added inconvenience was the bill itemization--which was completely different in our room (via the tv bill access) and at the concierge desk. Our bill showed "mini bar" charges (which we had not incurred). When I asked, the concierge said "oh those aren't mini bar charges." The Standard could be a fun place to experience the rooftop bar or the outdoor patio for a meal, but not for an enjoyable night's stay.

Reviews.Title: “trendy...maybe too much!”
Reviews.Author: federsigno
Reviews.Content: Standard is a design hotel, very cool but people working there is not very nice. They feel like they are very cool and they make you a pleasure to stay there! Anyway the place is very nice

Reviews.Title: “The Standard...LITERALLY! dont stay here!”
Reviews.Author: monte1166
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for business and was very disappointed. This hotel has an old musty smell throughout all hallways and rooms. Generally just found this hotel is not worth the rates charged. I understand minimal design with modern/retro feel is the look however was done poorly was below standard for us. Front desk employees do not know much about anything. Most questions we had were answered with a simple "I dont know"...." i really dont know" or "couldnt help you" there was no attempt to even try to get us an answer. I just found the general attitude of employees to be very bad and not helpful. As a business owner myself I know how crucial good customer service is and how a bad experience can travel fast. Hopefully this comment will be helpful in the overall improvment of this hotel. Also the managers repsonses to many of the comments are so general and meaningless/ insincere. You need to take these comments and use them to improve your hotel, not to defend your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Experience”
Reviews.Author: jamaicanmecrazy910
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I (25 year olds) went to the Standard Hotel for my birthday last year. The room size is quite standard, but the features (ie open shower) was unique. It was an affordable place to stay in downtown LA, but we did not love the location as it's far from the Hollywood scene. The only reason why we stayed was the lounge/bar on rooftop, where my friends joined us at night. Now THAT was pretty amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Good Rooms for Solo Travelers or Intimate Couples NOT Friends or Families”
Reviews.Author: akidcagal
Reviews.Content: The check in was friendly & professional enough but not entirely accurate. I asked that the mini-bar be taken out because I did not want to have to worry about my 13 year old munching on stuff. The clerk told me to not worry as he would simply just not give me the key. However, when I arrived in the room, the fridge was locked but there was still a big box of snacks and such. I was running so late for my engagement that I did not want to bother calling down to desk to request that it be removed. The room was very bare-bones. There was a king bed on a platform on the floor (we wanted two beds but they were sold out), a wall-length table/desk that was attached to the wall under the wall sized window, ONE chair and a tv. There were also two phones; one by the bed and one on the desk, which was nice. I can't recall much more in the room. It was a very large room, or maybe it just seemed that way because of the lack of furniture. There was no dresser with drawers however the closet has some shelves in it that one could put clothes on. However, one side of shelves was taken up by the snack box, a big pile of magazines, and iron, extra pillow/blanket and so on. The A/C did not work well at all so the room was rather warm. Again, we were running late for our engagement and did not even realize it was not working until we got back late and went to bed. Not the time to call maintenance. The thing I hated the most was that anyone using the shower had NO PRIVACY. Right next to the bed was a huge, glass wall that was also the wall for the shower. There was a shower curtain on the other side so if someone was brushing their teeth at the sink or something then they would not see the person showering. However, if another person was anywhere in the room, they totally see the person showering. Luckily I had some packaging tape so we taped up some newspaper on the glass wall to give us some privacy. Otherwise it would have been very awkward for both me and my 13 year old son to be in the room while the other showered. Even if I was on a romantic getaway I would still want a privacy curtain or something for when I showered. At least there was a door to where the toilet was! Another thing was that I was with a convention group and the hotel was booked solid, but not just by our group. Apparently we were supposed to have two entire floors. I was on the floor where we had rented out the "Blonde Room" for a party type of gathering. We partied until 5am. However, the hotel booked 2 rooms on the floor to people who were not with our group so they did not like the noise and kept complaining about us. I can understand that but it was the hotels fault for booking anyone else on that floor when we were promised to have the floor to ourselves. So we had to keep it down and keep the doors closed to the room. Again, the AC did not work in there either so it was very hot. We were there during the record-breaking heat wave at the end of September, 2010 so the lack of good A/C in the hotel was a drawback. Now I will have to say that the room was clean but it hardly made up for the bad A/C and lack of privacy in the shower in the room. The Standard is an OK hotel and I hear they have a good nightclub and nice roof-top pool but we did not go to either so I can't say for sure. So, if you are traveling solo or with someone you have an open relationship with, they I'd recommend it. I personally will not stay there again if I can help it.

Reviews.Title: “A great find...”
Reviews.Author: AlyP
Reviews.Content: What this hotel lacks in location in more than makes up for in style and service. Very good value for money, great roof top bar/pool. Food in the hotel was above average. Room (as is Hotel) was urban/industrial retro chic so did lack a little in comfort however was large with decent TV/Mini Bar. Great front desk and valet service. Small gripes, we were located on 11th Floor so if you want to sleep its tough before 2am+ as the roof top bar/club is in full swing. Plumbing was a bit poor with blocked loo (quickly resolved by staff). Cocktails very dubious. We experienced some poor service outside in the terrace restaurant front of hotel but received profuse apologies and a drink on the house. Would stay again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!,Great Value and Service!”
Reviews.Author: elmonte1
Reviews.Content: Awesome place, and especially the staff - very helpful and attentive. A bit crowed but nice ambience at night. Love it and will be back!! Cool like any other Hotel, hip and slick.

Reviews.Title: “The Standart style.design.location.location.location.”
Reviews.Author: mariecathrin
Reviews.Content: By the time we stayed at this amazingly hotel, we didn't even now about "the hype" going on about it in magazines around the world.We arrived quite late but the staff was very helpfull and friendly.Our Room was just amazing and we were thrilled by the architecture and interior design.It's very minimalistic but this is exactly what it should be just not too much but still very futuristic in it self.Later in the evening we asked the stuff for some recommendations to go out and have a drink.They gave us some good venues and places "to be".The Bar on the top of the building is just brilliant..a view all over L.A. and especially by night worth a visit.The next morning we checked out the pool also located on the rooftop.There was no one there and we enjoyed swimming between all the very huge towers.We will definitely be back next time.This Place is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “....Ahhh....the smell of disinfectant in the air.......”
Reviews.Author: Travel222Much
Reviews.Content: I was greeted by the familiar smell of cleaning sollution when walking into the room. Couple that with a freezing cold room & you have the recipe for missing home..... The staff was beyond friendly. The common areas were...a little tired & dated. The room was probably pretty hip & cool about 10 years ago. No art, very minimal, but in a dorm-room kinda way. Got room service 2 nights - food was fine, service was quick - was expensive. Parking was fine - valet - they were quick enough. Location was perfect for me - Starbucks & 24 hour fitness across the street. Overall, I would stay somewhere else next time. The room was harsh & cold & felt like I was in my dorm room all over again.

Reviews.Title: “a huge disapointment”
Reviews.Author: puppy123_10
Reviews.Content: the staff was very rude. Took almost 2 hrs. to check in. No free parking, each time you left the parking lot it cost $15.00 to park again. I was told by the staff i could park on the street, but i would probably get a ticket. The staff needed a credit card to hold, just in case i stoled pillows or brought a chainsaw to my room? Lobby music was so loud you hear and feel the vibrations in my room on the third floor. The staff made my visit horrible because they were so snooty and rude.

Reviews.Title: “Not really pet friendly, sewage odor, and loud entrance!”
Reviews.Author: percysmom
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a room facing the front entrance, ok the music is LOUD from 9 to about 2 in the morning, even if you close the window. Every time you turn the hot water on, it immediately smells like SEWAGE! gross! Plus at 2 in the morning the toilet started bubbling over and there was foam about a foot high above the toilet seat and it spilled onto the floor. I stayed with my dog, but the guest next door complained about the barking and we were asked to leave immediately. Good thing there was a female manager who handled the situation appropriately because the woman at the front desk who called me initially lacked total customer service. Nicole, who checked me in, was a sweetheart, however the male manager who worked the shift with her was a total douche. He could not be bothered at all to look in your direction or say anything to you. The rooms are clean overall, the sheets were really comfortable. I would not recommend the room service, it was pretty gross and overpriced! The location is great, valet is $33 a night, if I weren't stressed out I would've found another place to park, there are lots of locations nearby. The free wifi was a perk I appreciated, it worked pretty quickly.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!!”
Reviews.Author: WorldJetSetter26
Reviews.Content: This hotel is was the best Ive ever stayed at! The location is in the financial district. Bus stop to Santa Monica is opposite taking around 30 mins and the metro train is under a 2min walk taking under 20 mins max to Hollywood. The lobby - Chic with a DJ playing great music welcoming guests on a night. The restaurant - Value for money and great food, the breakfast is delicious, open early til 2pm. The reception - The staff are very friendly with lots of information. There is also a hair salon and shop. The rooms - Very spacious, comfortable and clean. Towels and bedding changed everyday. The best thing about this hotel is the ROOF TOP BAR and POOL. Very fun, trendy hot spot for professional people having after work drinks during the week and weekends great pool parties and great atmosphere on a night. The people who visit are very friendly of all ages, single and couples. I met some great people here. I would definitely stay here again, infact I would not stay anywhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “What a Nightmare!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mpmark
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Standard for three nights over the weekend and really wanted to check out as soon as I entered the room but decided to give it a chance. The lobby was definitely a party scene with a long line outside for the rooftop bar and techno/house music poured through the lobby and restaurant. The room had an institutional feel, like the waiting room of a 1970s doctor's office. It reminded me of the movie "A Clockwork Orange" but not in a good way. There was a mattress on the floor with average bedding, a L shaped couch covered in some orange synthetic fabric and the walls were all white with a hideous striped wallpaper print over one wall. The bathroom felt like a high school locker room but with a large foam black foot in the middle and the toliet paper and tissues were poor quality. The first night's stay was tolerable, but the next two nights were hell as the hotel turned into party central and there was a birthday party in the room next to us and the music literally pounded through the walls all night. I had to call security 3 times to quiet them down, but they barely turned the music down. Finally it stopped at 3am, but the walls were very thin and I could hear everything. It was hell and even though the next night I was assured the birthday party guests checked out somone equally obnoxious checked in sunday night who had the same taste in music. The rooms were all sold out and we had no choice but to stay. There ar even more odd things that happened with our room but all I will say is if you are not coming here to party and have any real standards then avoid this hotel. The only positive was that the staff tried to be helpful and the restaurant was pretty good and stayed open 24/7.

Reviews.Title: “pretentious rubbish”
Reviews.Author: charlie1973
Reviews.Content: All hype and no substance, for people who have no soul or depth, dont be buy into this nonsense. The hotel is fine but staff ruin it. Only appear to work there until they can get another job. Message to staff... you are there to serve, you are not more important that customers!

Reviews.Title: “What a great atmosphere (only 1 complaint!)”
Reviews.Author: ukv
Reviews.Content: I was in LA on business for 2 weeks moving from area to area, and had the weekend free so wanted to party some! I read some of the reviews on TA and was reticent, but also have partied at locations like this in Europe so had no missconception of what i was getting myself into. Check in and Valet was smooth and quick - despite me arriving at 9pm when it was busy with revellers. The staff at the doors/elevators/roof top access were funny, amicable and approachable; i was laughing with one of the lower escatlor door man about how i kept going up and down while waiting for some friends. There was a noise complaint from one of the rooms on my floor, so we had a knock on the door by some hotel staff - despite being surprised that they knocked on our door first!!! - we pointed them in the right direction of where we heard some noise from. The roof top bar was just AWESOME the view of downtown at night just made the atmosphere, total QUALITY - i loved it. It would be nice to have a party night up there, where you can stay beyond 0130, but i understand there a license issues. You have to come here with the mind set that there will be parties it is a party hotel up to a degree, but i love it! One complaint the shower head needed descalling, honestly its the basic of housekeeping things....... all in all, i would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: GabrielaR7
Reviews.Content: Hotel nice! Place cool and modern! Excellent location! Well worth a visit to a nightclub on the roof!

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay in LA! valet parking needs to be improved”
Reviews.Author: travelbackwards
Reviews.Content: Great place. very trendy. Valet guys need to hurry up a bit..... it gets crowed and pulling into the place is hard when its full. Otherwise a cool place filled with friendly LA type of people. The bar and seating is very art deco. Rooms are very modern and fun. pool is small but thats LA. its near a ton of fun places and bars. My girlfriend enjoys the nightlife so this was perfect for her. I like a good beer and seeing her have fun. I suggest heading to The Griddle for breakfast. There giant pancakes are amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Just Standard...”
Reviews.Author: kazaa82
Reviews.Content: My experience was also consistent with the other reviewer's comments. I stayed in the WOW room for 4 nights on business and expected WOW for $320US / night. Although the room was large, it lacked charm and creature comforts and felt too cool and forbidding. Room was very minimalist without usual comforts you would usually expect- toothpaste, shower cap etc. The wireless is intermittent and unreliable, given there is no business centre. The staff are unhelpful, indifferent, and often borderline rude. My partner was attempting to call the hotel from overseas with no answer on the phones for 2 days at front desk. The rooftop bar is probably it's only redeeming quality as unless you are staying downtown for a reason, there is nothing much happening closer than a $45US cab and 40mins traffic on the freeway. The food in the restaurant is hit and miss as is the service.

Reviews.Title: “The Name says it all:Standard is right on the money, but very trendy/cool if your 20 something”
Reviews.Author: married∈love
Reviews.Content: My husband & I booked this hotel in conjunction with spending the day at the LA Film Fest which was very close by. First of all we could not find this hotel easily since its in an office building that looks like just that-an old, bland office building. After finally finding it, we were told they were farther away from the Staples Center than we thought. Valet is $30.00, plus we would have to take a cab or drive & pay for parking as well unless you take a shuttle, which we never saw. That is downtown LA: Parking costs are HIGH. After spending the day at the Film Fest we went back to The Standard, looked around & then went to our room. We found a ping pong table in the lobby next to the elevators & a lobby that is truly (not made to look it) from the 60-70''s & obviously is in an office building that was never updated. A fuze ball table + firepit are in the frontage area/parking lot. Bright pink modern furnishings light up a nearly totally dark lobby & an empty, but cool looking bar finishes it off. There was some cool stuff there & I had hopes for a nice room to match. There is an escalator that leads up from there, but we never checked it out since young people were sort of running around the area on top. The rooftop pool area sounds like its a happening p,lace, but we were very tired from the Fest. So, we ordered very late night room service which was good & not crazy expensive. One BIG gripe I have is after my husband asked for ice with our meal, so we could have ice water, the person taking orders told him its down the hall & in essence to get it himself with the ice bucket from our room. Before calling him back myself we looked for an ice bucket. Finding none & being outraged that Room Service, at any hotel, would basicly say "get it yourself" I called to give the kitchen a piece of my mind. I got a nervous response after saying "do you mean to tell me you don't have ice in your big kitchen down there??" that they do but "do not have ice buckets to bring it in." I told him to bring 2 glasses full of ice & hung up. Thats all we wanted & what he should have asked about when it was requested. I guess 20 somethings are willing to put up with allot of BS from hotel staff, but trust me when I say that 40 somethings spending their $$$$ do not & know paying to get food delivered to you whenever, getting a comfortable, clean & hopefully plush feeling & clean feeling atmosphere in which to spend their 24 short hours (its acutually less when you add up the hours you pay for) is what we are paying for and expect. without any excuses. If there are issues in the hotel...take it up with the boss, otherwise I don't want to hear excuses. When you check in, the face that checks you in & welcomes you should reflect joy that you picked his or her employers hotel for your expensive night away from home. We didn't get that & when we don't get that we don't go back & we spread the word...period. What happend to high standards in the U.S.?? The rooms: are sort of Star Trekky. Walls are bright white with a mod vibe. The bed is on a platform & the blanket smelled very, very strongly of smoke. Without it I would have been cold or I would have removed it abonded it to the furthest point away from us. In fact, the whole hotel smells of smoke & after complaining about it the next day were told their clientele is mainly European & they have only partially non-smoking floors, which to me is sort of point less since smoke travels. So, this place is no good for those who want smoke free environments in which to breath in:( No msoking laws don't apply to hotel rooms...I learned something new. There is a 70's feel here, especially in the breakfast room that is BRIGHT yellow & screams WAKE-Up! I expected Doris Day to be sitting around the corner. We were curious about this place because we saw "Get Him To The Greek" & it was near our key location. My curiousity is over & I we were happy to leave. In fact, I entertained the idea of leaving & not sleeping there at all, even if we were charged for the night. The smoke smell is gross, the cleaning solution the maids use is really strong & really bad-like oven cleaner that you smell when walking down the halls. They are definaltey not using eco-friendly products here, which I sincerely wish they would change. The street noise of buses goes on all night. I didn't even shower (a first for me) before leaving this hotel in the AM, since the bathroom seem like the rest of the hotel...which is don't look too closely, you may not like what you find.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there”
Reviews.Author: BritPaul
Reviews.Content: The Standard is a "hip" hotel in downtown LA, convenient if you are there on business - but that's where the good part ends. The staff are completely disinterested - fail to make eye contact and offer zero service. The car valet said that my cases would be sent to my room. Half an hour later I had to go down to retrieve them. When I did so, there were three people at the front desk - one was busy, the others totally ignored me, and when I caught their attention just indicated to the busy staffer. Then, when trying to sleep, the room reverbrated with the bass sounds coming from a nightclub. The rooms try far too hard to be "cool" but are uncomfortable - hard chairs, low beds on a silly platform. The bathroom has no facecloths so how on earth can you shower properly? The internet is supposed to be free - if you can get it to work (I managed to do this just once). The room is supposed to have a safe, but I couldn't find one. Don't go there - I will never return.

Reviews.Title: “Below "Standard" is a better description”
Reviews.Author: hrman007
Reviews.Content: OK, I know it's supposed to be a "hip, trendy" place downtown. But it lacks in many basic amenities! The first thing I noticed is the main front doors are only a few steps away from the elevators. There is no security, the front desk is far away, and the elevators are accessible by anyone from the street. (When I was in St. Louis last month at a Hilton, you had to use your room key to access the elevators after walking past the front desk.) And then into the room.... Only one chair in the room? Bed is on a plywood platform without a box spring? WiFi is almost as slow as dial-up. A/C took at least 90 minutes to cool down the room. Nothing in the room about local restaurants, hours, and who delivers? And when I called the front desk for advice on Chinese delivery one night, none of the three places delivered downtown. And on another night, my pizza craving kicked in and two of the three places the front desk recommended didn't deliver downtown! (I stayed seven nights.) There was no business center, so I couldn't print out my boarding passes for my flight the next day either. I was there because others in our organization wanted to stay there, but if they recommend it next time, I'll be staying someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy trendy and trendy”
Reviews.Author: trick15
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really not what i expected but it was still a great week stay. The front desk has a few snippy people but the rest were great. The rooms were really nice..Because of the fact that the shower has a glass wall into the room, you may want to consider who you are staying with, but i still loved it. Loved the roof top bar, got packed several nights and the 24 hour restaurant. Like i said it is filled with trendy people from all over...Artsy people, hipsters and such...Not sure where i fall into but i felt comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Tries too hard. . .”
Reviews.Author: LetsGo0508
Reviews.Content: The Standard Downtown is a decent hotel but they try way too hard to be cool, sexy, and edgy. It's too much. We stayed there since we were seeing Ricky Gervais at the Nokia Theater, and we got a good deal on the room on Jetsetter.com. We stayed in the HUGE Room. It's cool to look at but doesn't offer much functionality. My husband didn't like that the bed was on the floor and the bathroom was awkwardly layed out. It was a bit too modern and ended up feeling very cold. It also wasn't very clean. There was hair in the shower, and I'm pretty sure there was blood on some of the bathroom walls We were on the 12th floor right across from the elevator which sucked, b/c all night you heard the elevator ding and drunk people go back and forth from the roof top. We checked out the Roof Top "Club/Lounge" and it's sort of a joke. It was great that you didn't have to buy a bottle to sit down, but there seemed to be no dress code and they were telling people that there was a 30 minute wait. However, when we got up there, (you don't have to wait in line if you're staying at the hotel) there was hardly anyone up there. I might be bias since I'm from Vegas, but I wasn't impressed at all. San Diego's roof tops are much better. The staff was friendly and helpful though. Jessica was able to check us in at 11:30 am, since our flight got in at 7:00 am. This would be a great hotel for a bachelor/bachelorette party, but that's really it. I'd recommend the W instead.

Reviews.Title: “Business Traveler flees in minutes....”
Reviews.Author: crucker
Reviews.Content: Tired, stressed business travleer? The Stardard is NOT for you. Although the front desk staff were all cute, and accommadating they seemed all under the age 15 and couldn't wait to tell me the roof top bar was open EVERY night until 130am with a DJ. Whoopie. The hotel claims to be "super green" even serving bottled water in cartons in the in-room mini sex bar that also stocks Mr. Bubble-there is not bath tub. However, my room, as well as the entire hotel, was infested with cigarette smoke and my bathroom smelled of party urine. There were two LA magazines, but no hotel information guide, menu-nothing. Look, I am a very well traveled hip individual up for any fun environment-even while on business travel-however, this was unbearable and I fled with in minutes. The front desk staff was kind enough to cancel and refund my entire reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Party hotel but ok for quick stays”
Reviews.Author: hwalk
Reviews.Content: Ok, the reviews are definitely right - this is a party hotel. On a saturday night the hallways smell like pot and the pre-parties are happening in the hall. The ratio of me:drunk girls would have been excited 15 years ago but now i'm old and boring. But contrary to some of the other reviews i found the staff to be helpful and as requested they put me in a quiet room. The room itself had its wear marks but overall was well appointed and easy to live in.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, pity about the front desk staff...”
Reviews.Author: TheWandererReturns7
Reviews.Content: The Standard is a GREAT hotel... it has such a cool atmosphere, all the design quirks are brilliant, and it is really comfortable and clean. My room was beautiful - light and bright, quiet, private, large and so well designed. There was even an ipod dock in my room! The bed, sheets and pillows were unbelievably comfy. And the rooftop bar is fantastic! I would love to give this place 5 stars. But sadly, I found the front desk staff really unhelpful and rude. They really try to be cool hipsters but while this might add to the hotel's trendy atmosphere, it doesn't work when it comes to good customer service. They were very rude when I was checking in. For the duration of my stay there was a problem with the phone in my room and I could not access my voicemail messages or receive any phone calls. Although I asked them repeatedly to fix this for me, they seemed uninterested and the problem was never resolved. Having said that, the hotel was so gorgeous that I would love to stay there again! If you can deal with the too-cool-for-school staff, definitely go for the Standard!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, no frills, close to multiple forms of public transportation”
Reviews.Author: Cyanicdelphis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. We were a little worried because neither of us are the partying type and this hotel is apparently known for it's rooftop bar. We were on the 4th floor, so at night you could hear the traffic noises (the high fan setting on the A/C took care of that) but we didn't hear any music, partying or next door neighbors. The rooms are very clean and "modern", with white walls, tiles, sheets, etc. Some people called it sterile but it makes any stains or dirt stand out, which I didn't find. The room we stayed in had a bathroom with a glass walled shower, so a person sitting on the bed could see into the shower. Obviously not recommended for friends traveling together or modest people. The hotel is 2 blocks away from the subway and a block away from all the major bus stops. If you're looking for a decently-priced hotel in the heart of downtown close to multiple forms of transportation and you're not looking for all the frills, this hotel is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Does not deserve the previous bad reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: km59257
Reviews.Content: Booked a room at the Standard before i read the reviews, and then i was really nervous about our stay. Our expectations of a hotel are different than other travellers, i guess, becuase we were thrilled with the Standard. It was easy to get to from LAX, and the parking was great. Justin checked us in, and was super friendly. The hotel is beautiful, but my taste is different than the average person. I loved the sleek lines and modern look. Our room was super clean, with lots of cool extras. As said before, the bathroom is unconventional, but i am fine with being naked in full view so it worked out just fine :) i can see how a more modest person would not be thrilled though. I must point out that the grout is obviously meant to be grey in the bathrooms, NOT white and dirty as reported by others. SOmeone who knows nothing about and does not appreciate mdern design should not stay here. the lack of tacky art and nasty patterns was truly refreshing. If this is what dorm rooms really look like, you must have gone to a pretty nice school!

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here if you HAVE to be downtown”
Reviews.Author: BaronessEast
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a few blocks away from Skid Row in downtown LA. The hotel itself tries to be very 'LA hip'. There is a salon, a bar, a restaurant, a rooftop pool. It might be a nice place to stay if you want to take someone for an authentic "LA hipster night out". I would recommend this hotel to someone IF they HAD to be downtown for some reason or they wanted a hotel where they could party with wanna be socialites. The beds are super comfy, the TV works and the bathrooms and big and clean. But the decor is kinda gross and it has an IKEA feel to it. PROS: - Comfy beds - Good food at the restaurant - Nightlife hot spot for LA Hipsters CONS: - Location is horrible - You have to valet your car - Room decor needs an upgrade - Expensive

Reviews.Title: “travel alone or with love”
Reviews.Author: bapstar
Reviews.Content: Simply put, perfect stay for 2 days, comfortable quiet, great bed and view, just nothing but good as I subsequently flew off to Central America and needed time to gather thoughts. Found good food in the neighborhood, and interesting areas like MSNBC 8 blocks away, and Macy's for light pants and shorts. Even had a haircut with lobby barber, that's trusting nature, huh! The roof top pool, no I went in, and did the porpoise thing for 30 minutes, while wind swept across the water, a good stiff breeze, delighting the sun, and a beautiful woman lounged on one of three water mattress spaceships...what more? I ain't saying.. See my video on Youtube, The Standard Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Meh - nothing special, nothing awful”
Reviews.Author: CMcBuck
Reviews.Content: I went to LA for business, and my husband tagged along so we booked a couple extra days. We booked at the Standard because the rooftop bar was appealing. Unfortunately, it rained the whole time so we didn't go, but that obviously isn't the hotel's fault. We had a King room (not sure what that is - I think Large?) and the huge bathtub was amazing. However, the bath area decor doesn't do much for the room. I get that they are going for the "locker room" style look, but the tiny tiles did nothing for the illusion of cleanliness of the room. It made it look dirtier than it probably was, and the huge, room-long ledge to put your toiletries on caused me concern, because I simply couldn't imagine that they regularly cleaned all the cracks in between the tiny tiles. I wouldn't put anything there without putting a towel down first. The actual bathroom was very weird. It was a fully tiled "room" with a sliding door, with nothing but the toilet and toilet paper inside. It was oddly large, and when you turned the light on, an unflattering and unrelaxing fluorescent light flickered on. I was not happy when this happened at 4 am when I just wanted to use the bathroom quickly. I think some reviews touched upon the noise factor. It's very true - the walls are thin and you will hear everything. We were on the 9th floor and as I was going to sleep I faintly heard the music from the rooftop lounge. Not much, though. However, the group of guys who came back around 2:30 am were a totally different story. We had just gone to bed when they arrived, and for an hour I heard every bit of their conversation, as if they were in the room. Ladies, you know how we come home after a girls' night out and analyze every guy who spoke to us throughout the night? You'll be happy to hear guys do it, too. Dude, that Jenny girl was probably just not into you. Get over it. The valet guys and the room service people were very prompt and friendly (unlike the front desk employees.) Room service was fast, too. Like the title of this review says, the hotel was fine, but nothing extraordinary. I would stay again if I got a good deal, but keep in mind the noise level if you consider this place, and the fact that things like the paint job and the cleanliness could use some touching up. I can't totally shake that I felt constantly unsure of the cleanliness of our room, kind of like I was in a 2 star European "hotel" that should really be considered a hostel. I don't mean to make it sound wretched, just be aware of what you'll be getting, and don't pay top dollar for it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, magical, stylish, clean!”
Reviews.Author: DoctorBenway
Reviews.Content: What a treat! It's a fusion of mid-century + mod + hip. The staff was warm, welcoming, and competent. The rooftop lounge is amazing with heated pool is the coolest place to have a drink and a snack or hang out all day. The rooms are clean & edgy. Beds are are on a low platform but comfortable. Bathrooms are not for the shy. This is no ordinary hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't like it”
Reviews.Author: PapioMaster
Reviews.Content: This hotel tries to be "hip" and "modern", and probably it would be a good option for those in the party scene. But for us who travel on business, it isn't the best place to stay. Rooms are kind of uncomfortable, the mattress is on the floor, and the chair for the desk is cheap hard plastic, not suitable for working long hours. On my stay, I had problems with the toilet. Unexpectedly it started to "bubble" and it released a nasty gas with the stench of sewage. And also, the safe had a very unreliable locking system. I was keeping there my important travel documents, but one day when I tried to open it up, the display showed "Err" and it couldn't be opened. I had to call the front desk, luckily the technician was able to open it with his special PDA. After that, I better kept my documents in my luggage with a lock. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for business travelers, but if you are a young partying animal, this is not a bad place, although a little expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Some Good, Some Bad, but I would stay again”
Reviews.Author: ellasoup
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location. It's right in the middle of downtown which means there are plenty of restaurants, bars, etc within walking distance which is a rarity in LA. And if you have to be downtown for business in my opinion you can't do much better. It's also very convenient to the East Side (Silverlake, Echo Park) which is where I prefer to spend time while in LA, so for me that's a plus. If you're a tourist coming to see Hollywood this probably would not be the hotel for you. I had no problem with noise, I found it to be very quiet and slept quite well on the mattress. The rooftop pool/bar is really beautiful although probably something you want to avoid on a Friday/Saturday night. It is a little strange that the hotel lobby seems to turn into a club on weekend nights, but also funny and unique. The service is very hit or miss. There aren't coffee makers in the rooms or complimentary coffee downstairs which I found irritating, but you can buy it at the bar and there's a starbucks across the street. Wi-Fi is free for hotel guests which is a nice amenity. I would recommend this hotel for everyone, my parents even stayed here once for the weekend and thought it was a lot of fun, but you should know what to expect. It's certainly not for the conservative or for those who are expecting the five star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Too hip to function - but I loved it.”
Reviews.Author: TerinaSydney
Reviews.Content: I find this hotel confusing. On one hand the retro look is amazing. The commitment to the theme is all encompassing. The roof top bar is spectacular and if I hadn't spent so much time trying to roll out of the onion shaped water beds, I might have seen the view that my friends said was amazing. The downstairs bar/restaurant has a fabulous yellow colour scheme that shouldn't work but somehow does and some shag carpeting with cynical quotes scrolling up on an LED display. The barber and shop in the lobby are gorgeous and we couldn't walk past without checking them out. On the other hand the basics I expect of a hotel weren't always up to par. The pillows were small and uncomfortable. The toiletries in our rooms were half used and we had to ask several times for new ones. In fact, that was a recurring theme, the staff were most willing to help but the communication between staff was so poor that we almost always had to ask twice. The bathrooms were big but the big glass window between the shower and the rest of the room made me anxious despite the sheer modesty curtain we could pull across it. Some of the staff didn't seem to have a great knowledge of the area but made an attempt to help us anyway. Overall, the theme saved the day. Was it the best hotel service I've ever enjoyed? Of course not. But it was an experience and when you travel, sometimes that makes up for whatever shortcomings a hotel might have. I wouldn't recommend this to my parents because the beds would be too low and they always say that when you've lived retro, it doesn't appeal as much; but to my friends who appreciate commitment to a theme, or who are experimenting with the hipster lifestyle, I would definitely recommend giving it a go.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest.”
Reviews.Author: karawebster
Reviews.Content: The Standard is a fun and hip hotel. The rooms are spacious and clean. The service at the hotel is very poor. The people at the front desk are not helpful, curt and very rushed. We we arrived at 8:00 at night our rooms still wasn't ready. Room service arrived with only half our order. The tray was still sitting in our room two days later. Our room was not cleaned by 6:00 in the afternoon, so we had to ask for service, and they still didn't remove the dirty dishes? Our room faced Flower Street and it was VERY noisey! Ask for a quiet room. On the bright side, the restaurant is great, and the help friendly and attentive!

Reviews.Title: “Very poor Standard”
Reviews.Author: ptiv
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awful. It was decorated poorly (cheap), the room was so sterile. The bed was only a mattress set on a home-made, carpet-covered platform on the floor, there were no counters in the bathroom, just cold tile to set your things on, and the tv was set on what should be in a dorm room. It was so loud from the club that we could not sleep. When we asked for earplugs, someone came to our door to tell us they did not have any. I will NEVER go back to this poor Standard hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A very low standard indeed ...”
Reviews.Author: ctia
Reviews.Content: The problem with hotels that try to be trendy is that the trend inevitably passes. Then you are left with staff wearing uniforms that look more at home in a cheap and cheerful burger joint, kitschy decor, unhappy staff providing bad customer service and the occasional mention by tour guides of what once was. Apart from the convenient location of the hotel, I can't say it has much to offer. Yes, it has a see-through bath room and a rooftop bar ... these however hardly makes up for the run-down feel of the place and poor service levels.

Reviews.Title: “A definitive boutique hotel. For the young and style-oriented who savor the scene.”
Reviews.Author: washbrol
Reviews.Content: My favorite hotel in L.A. While this city abounds with boutique hotels, creative concepts and flashy scenes, I love the Standard Downtown Hotel. Here's why: 1. A touch of history, in history-sparse L.A. (the former headquarters of the Standard Oil Company, a corporate titan of days-past that is probably lost on the younger patrons that stay and party at this hotel. The lobby still has the original old clocks with the time in cities around the world.) 2. Location amidst the soaring glass skyscrapers of downtown L.A. is an urban flavor of the city that is often overlooked for the more obvious draws of the touristy Sunset Strip. Dancing on the rooftop to the beats of an edgy top DJ, martini in hand, surrounded by beautiful women of the world... 3. Boutique basics done marvelously well. The Standard pulls together quality standards of the boutique hotel offering, I would almost say "defining" what so many other boutique properties in the world aim for, yet remaining on the minimalist side of luxury. Low-slung beds set on a platform instead of bed frame. Mixing bar for your cocktails in room. Plasma tv. Big spacious bathroom with glass-walled walk-in showers built for 2... or 3. Spacious sliding closets. Plush toileteries. Modern lobby with DJ-driven action in the evenings, complete with billiard table, lounging area, restaurant on the terrace outside amidst candlelight and palm trees with smart cocktails and well-constructed food. 4. Price. You can pay a lot more for a boutique hotel in L.A. At the Standard Downtown, at the right price, you get a lot of "L.A." and "boutique experience" bang for your buck. Have stayed 2 or 3 times. Can't wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay there again-not kept up at all”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkCityGirl19
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed in The Standard Downtown. It may only be 6 years old, but feels about 12 years old, run-down. Rooms are not clean or comfortable. Upon arrival, the trash was dirty, the iron broken, no ice bucket, other people's toiletries left behind. The walls are paper thin-raging parties at 4AM reverberated down the hall. No security around to stop it. Tiny trashcan by elevator didn't hold all trash, so people started leaving trash on the floor by the trashcan, it was never cleaned up. Elevators all banged up inside. No service elevator, so you could be sharing your elevator with stacks of dirty dishes. Terrible speakers in the lobby-all music muffled. Tons of teenagers loitering in lobby. Ability to have a drink on the roof is a production for hotel guests. Positives: early check-in accommodated, reasonable rates, 24-hour restaurant, good products in bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel, tries to be modern and hip but it's just old and rundown.”
Reviews.Author: jmtaggie05
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Standard for 2 nights for a business trip. The hotel is really old but they have tried to make it really modern and hip but it still looks crappy. The incredibly uncomfortable bed is just a mattress on a platform on the floor. No box spring, no headboard...nothing! The walls are paper thin and since it's apparently the place to be in LA, there are constant parties in the rooms. I heard the party next to me until 4 am. My colleague and I both requested non smoking rooms when we booked about 2 months back. She received a smoking room and when she complained, all they said was "sorry hotel is booked." The carpet was really old and dingy and the shower was disgusting, good thing I brought my flip flops. I've stayed at nicer Holiday Inns. The only fun things was watching all the "walk of shames" leave the hotel at 6:30 am in the same clothes and makeup from the night before!

Reviews.Title: “Fun”
Reviews.Author: FunNomad
Reviews.Content: The Standard put boutique hotels on the map for me. Not your cookie cutter environment. Cool, hip, and artsy with a rooftop bar like no other. I return to The Standard time and again, not just to stay, but sometimes to have a cocktail with a beautiful view of the LA skyline.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hotel - Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: GMontague
Reviews.Content: Since staying at this hotel we've noticed it in many movies and tv shows. Love the chair swings in the lobby. Great location, but rooms are pretty basic. Pool was great and had an awesome view. Drinks at the pool were very expensive - but I guess that is to be expected. Overall we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “I don't know why there is so many bad reviews! Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Amazingjess
Reviews.Content: My gf and I are from Vancouver and were in LA to buy for my store. We read all the reviews on this site before booking, but thought we would take our chances anyways as the price was right as was the location and it had a great price range for food as well. Upon arrival we were almost 4 hours early for check-in and they had a room ready for us. The room was super cute, there is a see through shower so obviously if you aren't a couple it might not be the best room for you, but it's easy for someone to turn the other way while showering. There was free wi-fi in the room and the room was clean and housekeeping did a great job everyday. As for people complaining about noise, we never had any issues of loud partying noise and we stayed there all weekend. On Monday night we did have a lady who was banging on the door next to us for about an hour at which time we did call the front desk and security came up right away and escorted her off the floor, so it was handled in a very prompt manner. I do agree with the front desk staff, they aren't rude but they don't go over the top. They just do the minimum of their job, which is fine- I can't really complain as they helped us with a car rental and whatever other questions we had. They were to the point and got the job done. The food at the 24/7 restaurant is amazing, we enjoyed all our meals and we ate sometimes two meals a day at the hotel!!! Breakfast was amazing and the restaurant staff were great- so was the room service. No complaints. Valet was AMAZING!!!!! After a HUGE buying day we had a whole trunk and car seat of bags they carried them all up to the room for us, and always got our car and were really friendly. Great service We had a great time at the roof top bar on Saturday night and celebrities were even at the bar. The drinks were a little pricy but if you are used to city living - really it wasn't nothing that you are not already used to. Rite-Aid is one block away so if you want to get some drinks to drink in your room, that is a cheaper route than ordering from the hotel. Overall, WONDERFUL stay! I really have no idea why everyone has been leaving such bad reviews. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: onelilmouse
Reviews.Content: I don't know why the other travel websites list this as a four-star hotel. The rooms may be kitschy/trendy, but cleanliness is questionable when your bed is on a low carpeted platform practically on the floor, there is an open food package in the wet bar, and the bottle of shower gel appeared to have been used. I booked my room through Hotwire expecting a four-star hotel; understandably, that is always a gamble, but this was very disappointing. Took a while to figure out that the valet parking was at the rear of the building, since they share a driveway with an independent parking lot next door. Valet parking is $28. If you don't need in-and-out parking privileges and plan to be out by 10AM the next day, it's only $10 flat rate to self park in the underground garage (I believe this is the same garage where the cars are valet parked)

Reviews.Title: “ENjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: kooltraveler84
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Standard for my b-day. About 30+ of my friends came to the rooftop bar with me & celebrated my b-day. It was on a Monday night and the Rooftop bar was not crowded. It was undergoing a remodeling but it didnt deter us from having fun. I enjoyed my stay actually and I dont see why people give it such bad remarks. The rooftop bar is one of the coolest bars. The space is modern & cool and the views are amazing. PROS- -Space is cool, funky and the decor is also cool & funky and even humorous -HOUSEKEEPING!!! I requested toothpaste and later I requested more lotion,soap etc, and both times housekeeping arrived within 3minutes. The gentleman was very nice also. -The rooms were comfortable (although the see-through showers are clearly only good for couples) everything was easily accessible -The Orange juice at the restaurant is the bomb, I had two -Valet- The valet staff was cheerful and they knew my rate and the fact that my parking was included even before I checked in. The morning guy even helped me move stuff from my trunk so the luggage could fit. -I took some things from the mini bar but they were never charged...I think thats a pro! CONS- -The Rooftop bar staff - The staff was ok, most are cold and not friendly. Some of the bartenders were a lil "too cool for school" or so they thought. They could be borderline rude and brash.
