Also my cousin snuck in a bottle of vodka, and while I understand he broke the rules(which he didnt know), They did not have to be as rude as they were, even though we ALL bought so many drinks there. It was a gift for me, and the manager through the ENTIRE bottle of SKYY Vodka away. Im glad we drank most of it. -There is only one elevator that takes people to the rooftop bar. Time consuming -The music - It was a Monday but still, why was the music so WACK? the DJ played too many different styles and one moment everyone went to the dance floor, then he suddenly played a slower song and everyone walked out of the dancefloor. Only I and a few other drunk people remained. It was just bad music. Music I never heard of before. NEUTRAL - -The Front desk staff - They were neither rude, nor really nice. They were just there and they did their jobs so I cant really. complain. The girl upon check out was the nicest one + she is from El Salvador like my family so I was happy -Location - Its downtown & I love downtown but still, its kinda out of the way from Hollywood and stuff. There is a cool club across the street and a Ralphs about 3 blocks down which is open really late. I enjoyed my stay, mostly cuz it was my birthday and all my friends were there. Everyone admitted that the music sucked and the drinks were expensive but everyone loved the decor and the big red water bed thing. The prices are similiar to other cool bars so ultimatley that wasnt a downer. Everyone was happy and we took many pictures. But the bartenders could be a little nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Contrary to all other negative reviews, I enjoyed my stay.”
Reviews.Author: knsaber
Reviews.Content: I read many negative reviews on this site, but they were all about the rooftop party and noise level. I came for a different purpose, and I found myself enjoying my stay very much. I booked the WOW room from their website and paid only 66% of their own advertised pricing. My stay was from Thursday to Saturday. There was no noise on my floor as other reviews have mentioned, in fact I didn't see any other guests at all. It's difficult to find public overnight garage parking unless you want to drive 30 extra minutes around one-way streets looking for one, you'll just have to pay the $28 valet fee for the hotel. Living by NYC, that's not that much. Check-in was easy and they had my luggage in my room within 10 minutes. The elevator is sometimes really fast, sometimes ridiculously slow. There are 4 elevator shafts but it seems like they only operate one at a time. The room was GINORMOUS for the price I paid, and it was very clean. Just don't expect to shower when you have guests over. Even though the toilet is private, the shower is only covered by a sheer curtain halfway into the room, anybody could accidentally go through the curtains and see your naked self! The platform bed is fine, some people complain about kicking it, that's your own fault. The bath tub is ridiculously large, you could fit 5 people in there, and the same with the emperor bed! Free wifi provided too! Outside the hotel, there are enough snacks, deli, and shopping plaza to keep you busy and well fed, even a few 24/7 restaurants including IHOP just walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Way too much...”
Reviews.Author: chefvanessa
Reviews.Content: I am a 22 years old that lives in New York City. I am use to all the party in LES and the Meatpacking district, however, it was a little too much to have to go across the young hollywood crowd to go to the front desk. I was unable to hear the front desk agent because there was a DJ in the lobby. Yes, its my fault for not checking trip advisor first. I am a concierge in NYC I should have known better. The rooftop closes at 2 am as every single place in LA... meaning: people continue partying in the hallway and smoking in the hallways as well. I saw people leaving the hotel cause they couldnt stand it. I thought of doing it too. At the restaurant I have to say that Pete was exceptionally friendly and at least we had a good experience there. Valet Parking... Sunday morning over 100 rooms checking out and just 2 guys to bring cars up. I do not know who was the manager who didnt schedule more people for the morning shift. I waited 45 minutes for my car to come up. On Monday the guys were less busy and they were really nice. Either way Saturday incident was not their fault either they were literally running, it was the management fault. This place is just to stay one night during a weekend if you do not plan on sleeping and you just want to have fun and party.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the worst run door in LA!”
Reviews.Author: tspriggs
Reviews.Content: I recently went there for my girlfriend's birthday. They have a package where you can purchase the Penthouse and get so many wristbands for the Bar/Club upstairs... Money was not an object so I said great lets do that. He then informs me that the Penthouse is occupied but you can still do the "party in a box" in a smaller room for the same price! O so let me get this straight...same price for a smaller room, where do I sign up? Despite hearing this I still decide to take the group to the standard roof top because I have had a good time in the past. WE DON'T GET IN. I am not one to complain..but the group was 5 guys and 10 girls. Figure out how to run a door! I am a former GM of a club and this is just bad business for any club/bar. It would be one thing if they were not allowing anyone in but I watched them allow 10-20 class acts (males) decked out in their Ed Hardy up top. Congrats to this establishment for ruining the ratio, the vibe and overall atmosphere. Take a tip from the other downtown establishment who had no problem letting us in that night; and abnormally large group of attractive women and the few guys waiting to spend the money! ...Learn how to run a door!

Reviews.Title: “If you are over 25 DO NOT STAY HERE>”
Reviews.Author: Rateit2
Reviews.Content: This hotel longs to be hip, and maybe the rooftop bar is- but the rooms are not. Very musty, moldy smell in the room- great initial impression. They want rooms to be very modern, but just seems very cheap- bed is almost on the floor- why? I don't know someone's idea of modern. Windows seem single paned since you can hear every truck go by at every hour. Oh and the best part - after the 20 somethings get done at the roof top bar around 2 am , they come back to their rooms, and party. Walls seem they are 1/4 inch thick- I heard everything from both rooms on both sides. Next morning when I awoke at 6 am with only 2 hours sleep, I made my own noise, and let my alarm go off at the top of the volume. No respect for me, no respect for you. I will NEVER stay in this fascade of a hotel again. It states it is for business travelers, but unless you are travelling for a drinking convention - don't bother. OH and btw, their free wi fi is free because it DOESN'T work!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Simple, Crisp, Ambient Lighting, Waterbeds Pods on rooftop bar/pool”
Reviews.Author: FarnhamMoe
Reviews.Content: Crisp Clean room, Good pancakes and coffee in the restaurant for breaky and tip top steak for din dins.. neat art deco art in the lift lobby

Reviews.Title: “Weeknight stay was great for the price. Can't vouch for the weekends.”
Reviews.Author: allens11
Reviews.Content: I had really low expectations for The Standard after reading the reviews posted on TripAdvisor. The reason we ended up booking our stay here was (in order of importance): (1) price ($140 a night for a medium room), (2) location (we needed to be downtown), and (3) we wanted to try something besides the Westin Bonaventure which was over $230 a night for the same days. You should take everything I say with a grain of salt given that we stayed here from Sunday through Wednesday and therefore missed most of the alleged weekend pretentiousness/noise and attitude. We had no problem checking in or with any of the other amenities. By amenities, I mean that we ate dinner and breakfast at the restaurant downstairs (food was good, service was fine), went up to the rooftop bar on Tuesday night (no wait because you get a wristband for staying at the hotel), used the gym (small and depressing) and used the valet parking at the hotel every day. Each of these services were provided in a timely and appropriately polite manner. My biggest complaint is that on Sunday, the day of our arrival, the floor that we stayed on was littered with plates and cups from room service earlier in the day and the plates and cups were not removed until around 11 pm that night even though a number of hotel staff (maids included) passed the littered areas. Plates and cups may not sound that gross but there were half eaten omelettes, oatmeal and fruit left on the floor to attract god knows what kinds of pestilence. If this small incident is any indication of how service on the weekends is, I probably would not stay at The Standard. However, our stay for the rest of the weeknights went without incident and, in fact, we made bets about how long it would take before the room service plates on Monday morning would be removed (we left our room at 8:30 am and they were removed by the time we returned at 11 am -- an overall improvement from our experience the previous day). The rooms are decorated and reminiscent of college dorms. The furniture is plastic and the bed is on a platform on the floor. We both agreed that despite the underwhelming decor, the rooms were very clean. Our parting words are as follows: if you need a place to stay in downtown LA during the weeknights and can get a good price, stay at The Standard. Otherwise, you might want to go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Read this about The Standard”
Reviews.Author: tiatheburmesecat
Reviews.Content: If you think you are somebody, but you're really not - you should stay here. This is absolutely a hive for people like you. Twelve floors of pretentious people who enjoy repeatedly touching themselves - pretty much because no body else will... here are some of the highlights you have to look forward to... 1. Upon pulling up to the valet you will be greeted by some of LA's finest people who park cars for a living. They will probably be rude and definitely question if you are meant to be valeting with them. Clearly unless your car is an European import, you may not be welcomed by them, and they certainly will not be welcoming of the $2 tip which these people are totally not worthy of. 2. You will check in, with your confirmation number (as printed on your email) and your reservation will not be in their system. Despite your confirmation email, prepayment, and prepared hard copy - they will somehow be either unable to spell your four letter name, or unable to in fact locate your booking. 3. After a minor delay, potentially 15 minutes, your booking will be located. 4. Proceed to the elevator and proceed to your suite. Upon opening of the elevator doors you will be greeted with the pleasant aroma's of a mixture of dried vomit, and bong smoke. 5. Enjoy your suite, over priced, but expansive none the less. Don't worry about the desperate need of a facelift. This kind of decor is popular amongst the "wanna be" community. 6. Please enjoy the breakfast on the ground floor. "The Restaurant". The menu options are limited, however within the hour you should see your server, and you may even have a drink. By the 90 minute mark you may have some food. You're not in a rush anyway, and you certainly have nothing better to do - despite the fact you could have flown to Seattle in this time and probably finished your breakfast by then anyways. 7. Interested in some evening activities? Try the roof top bar! If you are lucky enough to be there on a weekend you will probably only have to wait 40 minutes to be told by the bar tender "don't even talk to me". You may get a drink, but let's face it, who is thirsty on a Saturday night anyways? 8. Question the length of time in which your service takes and you will need to kindly make yourself available for several profanities which the bar tender will pleasantly throw your way. Who needs to conduct a civil conversation anyway? 9. If your bar tab is over $200 you will be auto charged a gratuity. Try and question this, and the manager "T" will kindly inform you of how many years service his bar tenders have put in - and clearly despite your current state of soberness you are clearly wrong - and whatever you say clearly isn't worth listening to anyways. 10. Proceed to document your thoughts on Trip Advisor - on the Standard's free (yet painfully slow) wireless internet service wishing that your holiday could somehow be cut short - and you could return to your pleasant life as far away as possible from these Neanderthals.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel seeks authorization on your form of payment of $150.00 per night of your stay”
Reviews.Author: COskibunny
Reviews.Content: The Standard, Downtown LA, had to rate as one the worst hotel experiences I can remember. I booked my room via their website and then received a smoking optional room. When I requested a change I was told that my rate did not allow a better room. I informed them that I booked on their website and they did not state the room would be smoking optional so I was moved. The room I received was acceptable but there was no soap, no tissue and only one towel. Perhaps the biggest issue of all aside from never being able to enjoy the pool etc because they would rather charge people to come in than to allow guests to use, was that they charged my credit card a $150.00 a night for hotel charges. Most of the websites state they will charge you this fee they certainly do not disclose it is by the night of your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: aaawilson08
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a Nike event. The hotel is really nice with a cool atmosphere. Not sure how much it costs so I can't comment on the affordability. The view from the roof top bar is amazing and the location is really good.

Reviews.Title: “Pool security, Eric, is reason 1 not to stay here.”
Reviews.Author: PLRamirez
Reviews.Content: Tall, blonde, well-built and no people skills. It's obvious that this guy wishes he worked at a Beverly HIlls or West Hollywood club but did not make the cut. Aggressive beyond belief, treated us like we wandered in off the street. Our family had 6 rooms, 16 people and spent close to $3,000 this weekend and this guy confronts us about using too many towels at the pool? Then, when we ask for his manager, refuses to call him and says "go downstairs". I would NEVER recommend this hotel. Yes, the bar is fun at night, but skip this place unless you like abuse and to be treated as if the staff is doing you a favor. This place gets an "F"! P.S. Restaurant service was extremely slow but the staff there was at least, polite.

Reviews.Title: “HUGE”
Reviews.Author: mikeguimond
Reviews.Content: The place is so great, with huge luxury-minimalistic-boutique-type rooms, a window parting the shower from the bedroom, really an amazing place; the rooftop has a pool and DJ spinning, truely THE metrosexual place to be ;)

Reviews.Title: “Great service and decor in downtown LA!”
Reviews.Author: sfbayKJK
Reviews.Content: I was in LA for a business meeting and thus needed to stay in downtown. I made a reservation on The Standard's website. When I arrived the front desk didn't have my reservation. After showing him my confirmation print-out, the front desk manager apologized immediately, asked me what the rate was that I booked, reduced it by 10% and upgraded my room. What great service! As for the rooms, they were simple, modern and fun. The room had a built-in desk along the wall with windows, a great bathroom and clean surroundings. The rooftop bar is absolutely amazing. It can be a bit of a scene, but it's definately worth a drop-in. The views are spectactular.

Reviews.Title: “Where the action might be”
Reviews.Author: Crash89
Reviews.Content: Quirky and whimsicle would be two words that come to mind about this place, others would be hip, slick and cool. The lobby is very cool, the roof top bar and pool area is cool, the room with the shower that has glass walls looking into the rest of the room is cool. This hotel chain is built to be hip and trendy and it works. The action at the pool is hot and when it turns into a night club it's crazy! The room wasn't the most comfortable or wonderfully decorated but it all works well togather and the bathroom is a good size. Service here is prompt and pleasant. I would stay here again if I wanted to be downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Employees at this hotel don't have manners”
Reviews.Author: Critic035
Reviews.Content: Went to rooftop Met client for drinks on elevator escorted by bouncerlike 6'3" picking his afro wildly scratching head how disgusting Fire him! Small shop lobby people unmannered! Front desk does more mingling with eachother than tend guest! Exercise room No Security Hallways smells! Parking entrance has stairs No assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Worse hotel stay and service ever and that's the truth”
Reviews.Author: latooc1979
Reviews.Content: I chose the Standard to celebrate my 30th birthday with my husband and a few friends. From the time we entered the doors, the service was very poor. Check in time was 3pm and we arrived at 4:30 pm to find that our room still wasn't ready. We were told it would be ready within the hour and they would call us. We waited around for over an hour and never got a call, eventhough the room was ready. Then, we called for a few plates, and silverware and we were rudely told that it wasn't the hotel's responsibility to provide those things to us. Wow!! My friend who stayed in a separate room had to call to get her mini bar key 3 times. The lady who checked us in was not even trying to be nice or gracious in any way. She was mean and didn't even try to be nice. I would never go out of my way to write a bad review unless I feel that my experience was really bad and it was. The rooftop was nice, but that alone is not worth it to me. If you are looking for a nice "party" hotel, make your way down to San Diego and try the Ivy hotel instead. Much nicer, cleaner hotel and more fun too. They do the same rooftop club thing and it's much nicer in every way. The Standard's rooms and hallways are dingy, smelly and decorated very poorly. If you choose to stay as a guest, even after reading this, make sure you take every little thing with you that you may need since this hotel won't provide you with anything other than soap and lotion.

Reviews.Title: “Standard is SUBstandard”
Reviews.Author: nancy160
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a complete disappointment. The interiors were dark and had an unclean feel to them. The room was cheaply furnished in plastic furniture. The attitude in general of the hotel staff to guests was unhelpful to the point of being rude. You felt as if you were somehow imposing upon their time. I have stayed at many hotels in large cities and I have never experienced a hotel as unfriendly to their guests as this.

Reviews.Title: “Save, clean, arty and lovely”
Reviews.Author: marjoo
Reviews.Content: When i told my friends (who are from LA) that I was staying at The Standard Hotel Downtown LA for a week, they wondered why on earth I would stay down town and not in, let's say, Hollywood... according to them, downtown isn't save at all. I have to say, I've never felt so save in a hotel as I felt in the standard downtown. There's a really nice vibe as soon as you walk in. The front desk people are very helpful and really nice! My girlfriend and I booked a Large room and as we opened the door it took our breath away! Definatly one of the most beautiful rooms I've ever stayed in. It isn't large.. no.. IT'S HUGE! The ceilings are very high up and the arty decoration and everything in the room is some serious eye candy :) The minibar is very creatively filled aswell! It contained everything you could ever think of... and more! Even a lomo camera! I'm 23 though I'm not much of a party animal and yes, this hotel was full of party animals in the weekends who were loud and somewhat rude (especially since they kept us up all night by being loud, and when we wanted to go for a swim/the gym early in the morning they'd bang on the door, being all hysterical) but they were gone after just 1 night and everything else they had in the hotel absolutely made up for it. The gym is amazing too... You just HAVE to check out the toilet in the gym! You walk into somethin that looks like a little boys room, with The Hulk wallpaper and a green mirror. Eyecany, Retro and AMAZING. I loved it! :) My girlfriend and I would go up to the roof in the morning since nobody would be there and we'd go for a long swim. Nothing better than to have to whole pool to yourselves in between all the sky scrapers...We've had the best swim ever! Also - the location isn't too bad either! We'd get the underground to Hollywood.. It's only a few stops away and a metro ticket is only $1.50 ! We're definatly going back to the Standard Hotel Downtown LA sometime soon! HAD A BLAST! +++ Oh and PS: To all you businesspeople out there who sleep in one room with their businesspartners and then complain there's a glass wall in the bathroom. You could have noticed that when booking the hotel! Go get a holiday in or something!

Reviews.Title: “Know before booking...”
Reviews.Author: bettermark14
Reviews.Content: There is nothing “standard” about this hotel except for the price they try to charge as a wannabe-boutique. If you’re traveler accustomed to a certain level of service, comfort, and cleanliness in a hotel, the Standard is not for you. The hotel itself is a renovated OLD office building in downtown LA. The walls, carpeting and bathrooms have a dirty quality to them and hallways and rooms smell like stale smoke. The bed and TV sit on the floor like you’ve entered into someone’s studio apartment and the glassed shower is a fail. They woefully missed the trendy and minimalistic bull’s-eye and successfully hit lazy and tacky dead on! The rooftop bar provides a fun, lively atmosphere with a DJ as well as great areas to lounge and take in the view and lovely LA evening. This should be the only reason to stay at the Standard (hotel guests receive passes to skip the lines to get up to the bar) although there wasn’t much of a line on either Fri or Sat night. Stay here if you plan to party up on the roof then stumble back to your room to pass out and not realize the below average accommodations that surround you and the noises that might otherwise keep up awake (buses on the street, other loud drunk hotel guests, and the occasional 5AM construction).

Reviews.Title: “Hip but Functional”
Reviews.Author: Lottie001
Reviews.Content: The Standard wants you to talk about it. It wants you to talk about the platform beds, the pencils that say "poke me" and "shave me" - right down to its upside down sign. In its effort to be hip, The Standard is fuctionally simple. The rooms are everything but standard - the walls are white, and maybe the stripes from the curtains will pour out in paint onto the wall, white makes the room look more open than a regular room with pedestrian art on the walls. Rather than having a desk, some chairs and the unnecessary small table; a desk spans the length of one wall, which is functional - if you are traveling on business, you can spread out the company laptop, et al; if you are traveling for pleasure, you can spread out your maps, et al. Also anything but standard are the bathrooms. My room had a large bathroom, with the shower built directly into the floor - no tub, no door, just a curtain to pull to separate it from the toilet and sink - otherwise the bathroom shares one flat, flush floor. It can be slippery. More interesting is the fact the wall between the bedroom and bathroom was 1/2 glass - so if you are traveling on your first romantic weekend with someone, you may want to consider the possibility of seeing each other on the potty. Some rooms have a bathtub in the middle of the bedroom area. The restaurant has a small menu, but varied - lamb, salmon, hamburgers. The food is good enough wherein you may stop in just for the restaurant. Also, room service is quick. There is a club is on the roof, which may be a cool place to spend an evening, but if you are staying on a high floor you'll hear the bands playing from your room. The Standard is downtown so a great place to stay if you need to be downtown.

Reviews.Title: “All the romance of an empty refrigerator.”
Reviews.Author: Cruizinquick
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for that "old frat house" experience, this is the hotel for you. Had my first room on floor three, but after being awakened at midnight by a rock band in the meeting room below, had to move. FIrst comment from staff was wanting to know if they should send some security! So after some time, they firgured it out that the meeting staff had booked a dance band, then offered to move me to a room on the 9th floor. Only sounded like a muffled radio from there. If you're over 18, you might want to look elsewhere. The rooms are ergonomically horrible, with about every thing from the bed to the sink, challenged to relate to the human body. While the designer might have thought they were making "hip" rooms, they have all the charm and comfort of the inside of an old white refrigerator. Cold and uncomfortable. The staff is indifferent. They could really care less. Motel 6 is a better choice than this, or maybe the box the white refrigerator came in!

Reviews.Title: “Party Time”
Reviews.Author: h2onab
Reviews.Content: The Standard Hotel, Los Angeles uses the shell of a former bank headquarters to try hipness that does not work. The rooms are minimalist-perhaps because the focus seems to be on the rooftop bar, and the DJ pulsating lobby. There are security guards everywhere. Particularly on weekends when thirsty young Angelenos seek drink, loud music, and a peer group to party with. ID's and wristbands are mandatory. I may be too old for this playground. But the platform bed that trips you up when the lights are out, the shower/bathtub that is the focal point of each room, and the thin walls that share the vibes and exclamations from your neighbors suggest that this place is not for me. The high points are the helpful staff, and a decent breakfast in the hotel restaurant. I can't decide if they are trying to be a serious hotel that caters to a diverse customer base, or a weekend playground for party goers. In either event, I prefer a hotel where I can get a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OCCouple2004
Reviews.Content: The Standard in downtown LA was awesome. From the minute we pulled in the valet, we had great service and a great time. This hotel is uber cool, very minimal- be sure to visit the rooftop bar- very acessable when staying at the hotel, had no problem getting drinks or finding a place to sit. When on the bar order a grilled cheese!! You wont be sorry! If you looking for a convient location in downtown, this is a great option!

Reviews.Title: “The Oh-So LA experience”
Reviews.Author: OCragazza
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed overnight at the hotel and really enjoyed our stay. If you want a true LA experience (many TV shows and movies have been filmed in this hotel) and are looking for something different and unique, then this hotel is the perfect hotel for you! First off, the Standard is not for everyone. I don't recommend the hotel for elderly couples, families travelling with children of any age or "conservative" people. We stayed in the Medium room, which I thought was affordable (at $155/night) given the area. The hotel is decorated in a vintage/retro/modern manner - very cheeky with platform beds and toiletries that look like they were from the 70's. The room was also packed with the most unique and abundant assortment of snacks and goodies from the typical drinks, candies and cookies to a bottle of Mr. Bubbles (though I wasn't sure why since the room didn't have a tub, only a shower?), condoms, candles, maps, umbrella and CD's (just to name a few). The most unique feature of the room was that the shower was made of glass, so you can be seen taking a shower from the bedroom in plain view. It was great for my husband, but I don't know if I would want to stay in the same room with my parents (if you know what I mean...!). The room was clean and intentionally sparesely furnished. For music lovers, don't forget your iPod! Since we stayed there on a weekend, we got free entrance to the Rooftop club on the top. We didn't have a chance to go during our stay since we were there for business reasons, but we've been up there in the past and it's definitely a MUST SEE for visitors and locals. We've eaten at the restaurant in the first floor many times before and the food there is consistently good. I wish they brought back the fish and chips though as the menu had changed slightly since the last time I ate there. For those who are visiting or new to LA, the hotel is located in a somewhat good location as there's a lot of things to visit within walking distance - such as MOCA and the Disney Hall. Little Tokyo, Chinatown, Staples Center, Convention Center and Dodger's Stadium are within a short driving distance. Since it is downtown LA, the night life isn't as obvious, but there are a lot of good restaurants to eat within walking distance and if you have a car (which is always recommended if you visit LA since everything is so spread out), Pasadena would be the closest recommended city in my opinion. Just keep in mind that it's $15 if you park overnight. The only reason why I didn't rate this hotel full stars was because despite the shower being big enough to fit 2 people (or more), the water pressure wasn't very good and the temperature control was sensitive (either too hot or too cold). Nevertheless, if we ever have the opportunity to stay up in LA again, we would definitely stay at the Standard again.

Reviews.Title: “Very solid”
Reviews.Author: HankF99
Reviews.Content: GREAT bed and bedding. GREAT shower. GREAT location. OK so the place is a little, eccentric. Once you look beyond their urge to be trendy and edgy you have one really great hotel. I think I paid $215 per night, a really good value if you have to stay in downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Experience”
Reviews.Author: bmfree
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Standard for a large conference that was held in LA with several co-workers. It was one of ten different hotels offered and I chose it because of its unique reputation. I had read a lot of reviews so I was fully aware of the of the potential drawbacks, but I booked it anyway because how often will a girl from a small town in the south get into an LA nightclub with a velvet rope? With that being said, I was pleasantly surprised by the hotel. The room was very clean and large, the bed was comfortable and for the most part I did not have any problem with noise. The bathroom was large and well appointed. The halls were not super clean and one evening I can back to find a drunk, naked man in the hall right outside my door, but besides that, I still enjoyed my time there. The rooftop bar was really neat and we all felt very chic, but I can not say the same thing for the crowd. It was the worst looking group of individuals I've ever seen, but it was great people watching. I can't tell you how many times I was flashed by girls with dresses that were too tight and too short for them, there was lots of laughs to be had there. Overall, I would not recommend this hotel to someone traveling on business that has to be up early to work or who requires a lot of sleep, or to those traveling with children, but if you are a young or young at heart adult, go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Fun and funky”
Reviews.Author: discoclare
Reviews.Content: Decided I had to write a review on here after seeing some of the mixed ones already posted. I loved the Standard, it has quite a young, funky feel to it. It's pretty modern and minimalist - I noticed some of the other posters didn't like this but I think by the time you've got to the stage of booking you should know that it's a modern kind of place. Both the roof bar and the lobby bar were great. The rooms were huge (obviously compared to UK standards but I thought also compared to other US hotels I've stayed at). Don't go expecting a traditional hotel and hopefully you will be pleased. The location is just OK - I was attending a conference, it's more for business travellers. For touristy stuff I would stay somewhere else - I stayed in West Hollywood for my vacation days. I believe there is another Standard in either West Hollywood or Hollywood. The only other critism I would have was that staff at reception were a bit sullen and, because the reception area is near the bar, it can be difficult to have a discussion at reception over the loud music!

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: Op2myst
Reviews.Content: This was the most uncomfortable hotel I've ever stayed in. ALL of the beds are on a platform only a few inches off the floor. The matresses are old and the furniture in the room is plastic or laminate. My kids college dorms are furnished nicer that these rooms. There are NO pictures on the wall and in the rooms, the TV is also a few inches off the floor. The desk chair is plastic as are the coffee tables. I stayed in a suite and the couch was also very low to the ground. The clock is far away from the bed and not convenient if you need an alarm clock. There was no glasses or cups in the room for water. The shelf for the sink was about a foot and a half down from the sink, making it very uncomfortable to hold your toiletries or put on make up. There is cheep polyester knit hanging as a curtain instead of a closet door. There was no shower door or curtain in the shower and no wall between the bathroom and the rest of the room. The staff and service of the hotel was pretty non-existent. There are no valets to help with your luggage. The price is way too high for what you get. I was terribly dissapointed by the hotel and will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location/cosmopolitan feel”
Reviews.Author: WenCo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is as the name suggests situated in Downtown LA. The location is two blocks from the Blue Line metro station that connects to all lines so is ideal for those wishing to get around by public transport. It is only a few blocks from the Walt Disney Concert Hall which is superb, in fact the whole artists hill area is worth a visit with time to spend taking in the features. By day the hotel functions as a professional business hotel but by night it becomes a hip nightspot with the rooftop pool and bar, surrounded by waterbed pods and lounging sofas, attracting a trendy crowd. Excellent choice of drinks and good service. The rooms are spacious and modern with glass cubicle bathrooms which are entirely open to those sharing the room! A feel good stay for a city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: lwhitneyb
Reviews.Content: When I pulled into the hotel to Valet my car, I waited for 5 minutes for the valet to come over to my vehicle. When I finally exited the car to approach him, he was chatting with another hotel staff member about a sport event. When I went to interrupt I was told to hold on a minute. I took the bags out of my car and waited for an ADDITIONAL ten minutes while the chatting continued until he turned and said, just leave it, I'll park it in a while. When I asked if I needed a claim check, he said "No, just your room number." I was uncomfortable with this (and rightly so, I would learn later) especially since when I exited the hotel 30 minutes later my car was still there with the door wide open. That evening I scheduled a wake up call with the front desk for 7:30a, as I had a shoot down the street at 8am. I was dismayed when the call came 25 minutes late. When I asked why it was late, the response I was given was "Oh, is it, oops..." I subsequently rushed to get out of the door on time, called the valet to pull the car around and went to check out. When I got to the front desk I returned the keys and gave my information and went to head outside when I realized... I had been checked out of the wrong room and charged incorrectly. When I returned to the desk, the annoyed clerk (like his error was my fault... I gave him my name AND room number) serviced everyone else, then came back to me, taking an additional 20 minutes to correct his errors. Without apology. When I went to valet I noticed my car was not there, even though at this point it was almost a half hour since I called. He informed me that no one told him to bring the car around (although I had called the desk and requested it). Then after 10 minutes of running around he realizes that the valet yesterday never marked my keys and they didn't know which car was mine... Another 15 minute debacle... Which means I had to head up to the desk for the THIRD time to pay for the incompetent valet.

Reviews.Title: “Dorm Room anyone?”
Reviews.Author: bds
Reviews.Content: A complete disappointment. If you are under 30 and use drugs, this place is for you. An upscale dorm room for sure. The front desk has NO sense of urgency or care. The front desk often had NO ONE behind it. I was there during the earthquake and the service and security was a joke. When asking if one should use the elevator after the earthquake the front desk replied" if the door is open, I would try it" they were completely annoyed by phone calls and laughed when we told them that we had never experienced as such.Instead of lunch breaks, I think the staff parties with the crowd up at the pool and then attempts to go back to work!! The hallways smell like wet dog, vomit and stale beer. 3 out of 4 mornings my wake up call never happened and the front desk told me that this happens often. Bartenders were annoyed if you were "in their bar" and not pounding down drinks.AGAIN, if you have a hard body, enjoy daily recreational drugs and loud music this place might be for you. I have to admit, I was simply humored!!! Regards, One time stay only!! Colorado Resident Business and Leisure Traveler

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place- Horrible Service!!”
Reviews.Author: Karma08
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms for 2 nights for my friends Birthday party. The rooms and pool were wonderful. I loved the decore of the whole place. However our experience was ruined by the DJ Saturday night. Not only was the music dull and hard to dance to but most of the night no one was on the dance floor. When one of my friends went to ask him if he took requests he was extremly rude to her talking to her like she was dumb and told her that he doesn't take request. It would have been fine to simply tell her that- but he was so rude to her she was upset the rest of the night. She went home shortly after. Another friend didn't know of her experience and went over to ask the same thing. Being that we were there to have fun and dance. She had the same reaction from the DJ. I was appllad by this experience. I will not be returning to the night scene at the Standard Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated!!!”
Reviews.Author: Samolocal
Reviews.Content: Tired, tired, tired. Rooms desperately need to be refurbished.: get rid of Ozzie Nelson's tv, add at least one comfortable chair. Bathroom is completely nonfunctional (I don't need to see my companion sit on the john). The Rooftop Bar Crowd is decidedly "c" list, front desk unfriendly and sloppy. All this topped off with a generous serving of 'tude from all the help. And the place isn't even a bargain any more.

Reviews.Title: “The Standard never disappoints”
Reviews.Author: Darko14
Reviews.Content: I have been to the Standard downtown LA at least 5 times and I have never been disappointed. The staff is always amazing. They are friendly and helpful. I have brought many different friends here and you don't have to travel far to have a good time. The rooftop bar is a great place and is always a scene. It's definitely a place for people who are looking for a good time and a great experience. I don't think it is the type of place for families or business travelers, but that is why it is awesome. I would rather have late night parties over a crying baby any day. I also lover the small touches that make this hotel truly unique. This is the only place i will stay when I am in LA.

Reviews.Title: “I'd Rather Stay Anywhere Else”
Reviews.Author: disgruntled74
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Standard for three months on business and can therefore say that I have experienced everything the Standard has to offer, can't be bothered to offer, or offers begrudgingly. The front desk looks for ways to be unhelpful, housekeeping is at best incompetent and apathetic, the room service staff is polite but annoying, the parking attendants are missing, the security staff is obnoxious and the bartenders and waitresses on the roof think they're working at a Dick's Last Resort. If you have stayed at Hampton or Holiday Inn before you have had a more enjoyable experience than the one you'll have at the Standard. The employees at the Standard do not realize that they are working in a service industry. I could list all of my grievances, which range from failing to replace light bulbs, double-billing my credit card, lying about laundry services available, failing to provide maid services on several occasions and just not restocking the minibar. It seemed that they were trying to give me reasons to not spend more money at the hotel. I'll refrain from writing a novel and just keep it short by repeating that no one at the hotel realizes they work in a service industry. It was hopeless to complain to a front desk staff that sometimes offered a smile but never gave a sign of "anyone being home". If you really want to go to the sad rooftop scene that was probably interesting a few years ago, I recommend staying at the Checkers or the Bonaventure and walking over.

Reviews.Title: “finally got to stay”
Reviews.Author: dotcom150
Reviews.Content: The rooftop bar is my favorite place to party in LA. I've been there quite a few times and I finally got to stay at the hotel last weekend. When I was on their website booking the room, I found a free upgrade deal at [--] and got to stay in a really nice room for the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “The Roof The Roof The Roof is on Fire!”
Reviews.Author: hi3655
Reviews.Content: Okay are you young? Are you young at heart? Then check into the Standard. I stayed for five days and enjoyed every moment. The rooms are very simple with comfortable platform beds, iPod boom boxes and roomy bathrooms. Nothing fancy, this isnot to be confused with the Four Seasons. In fact some could say the rooms are closer to Mot el Six, only cleaner, funky and retro in a good way. The staff was friendly and helpful. Room service was also good. I do not suggest staying on the upper floors as the noise from the bar might disturb you. Also avoid the rooms near the elevators for the same reason. The real reason a lot of people come to the Standard though is for easy access to the rooftop bar after dark. The scene is a little too young for me and be careful because there are hookers working the crowd. Rule of thumb with the ladies there: If it seems too good to be true. It probably is. The big red waterbed love pods can see lots of naughty action and you are more likely to be reprimanded for smoking than having sex in one. There are also several very cool little spots for breakfast or lunch( The Daily Grill across the street was great as was the Standard's cafe downstairs.) But be aware Downtown is dead at night with the exception of a few bars and restaurants. The Library Bar across the street was hopping. The hotel pool seems to be a favorite of local business people too. In one Love Pod a woman sat in her bikini top and thong . She ate lunch while on her blackberry. When she finished her lunch she climbed out, put on her blouse and jacket slipped into her skirt and shoes, grabbed her briefcase and left. I love L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Very funky!”
Reviews.Author: grushnik
Reviews.Content: Very funky hotel. Excellent rooftop bar, excellent check-in and room service. The rooms are excellent and very stylish. Expensive hotel but certainly justified due to the excellent rooms. The location can be a little quiet downtown but the rooftop bar makes up for it! The drinks are watered down compared to Europe but otherwise no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “OK Place”
Reviews.Author: DetroitSpinDoc
Reviews.Content: I thought The Standard was OK. The staff was a little "too cool" for my taste and the rooms were a little too urban chic, which meant comfort was not a top priority. The rooftop bar was great, the location downtonw was good for my business trip. I'd likely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous & funky”
Reviews.Author: Expat_Girl25
Reviews.Content: I stayed in The Standard with my boyfriend for 2 nights at the end of a long holiday. LA was a stopover for us to help kill the jet lag so we were looking for somewhere comfortable & fun, The Standard was just that. The plus points for me were: # The funky decor # The cleanliness of the room # The helpfulness of the staff (one member of staff secured us a reservation at an excellent table in a very busy restaurant) # The little touches, like iHome alarm clock which you can plug your iPod into # The overall comfort of the room # The room service - breakfast was beautiful # The extremely well stocked mini bar! The downsides: # We found the hotel restaurant to be a little over priced # The hotel is miles away from the tourist attractions, we spent a fortune in taxis getting to Hollywood & Beverly Hills I thought the whole experience at The Standard was excellent, it just stood out from other hotels I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Hip downtown vibe from room key to the curtains”
Reviews.Author: VertigoSeoul
Reviews.Content: I was visiting from the East Village in NYC with my GF, and the Standard fit us like a glove with shag carpet lining. From the red key that says "slip it in" to the voyeuristic glass shower wall, we really enjoyed the vibe and the retro stylin' of our hip digs. They even had Mr. Bubble in the minibar! We actually changed rooms to a room with a soaking tub for 2. Room service breakfast was on time and tasted great. Good: Apple sausage with pancakes and berries. Valet and baggage guys were friendly and cool. Free wireless internet and Ipod player in the room. The restaurant was above-average and is open 24 hours. We unfortunately were visiting during the northwestern rainstorm of the year, so the rooftop bar was pretty wet and windy, and closed soon after we popped our heads in and came back downstairs. Looks like a fantastic place to party and jump in the pool on a hot LA night. disappointing. The downside: The front desk girl was aloof and could barely stop talking long enough to give us our room keys. The platform on the rug gets a lot of wear and tear from spilled drinks and god knows what else... The white down cover had a ton of stains on it. We didn't see this until the morning when the comforter was untucked from the bed. nasty. We'll stay again, but will check the sheets next time... How I booked it: Searched around, and got the best rate by calling. Booked month in advance directly with the hotel. Called and they sent me a reservation email. $245

Reviews.Title: “The Standard way below Standard”
Reviews.Author: Chilepepper01
Reviews.Content: The Standard on Flower & 6th is way below “standard.” I understand “hip” but this is very tragically over rated. On New Year’s Eve we booked a large room. For $300 for one night, one would expect at least a lounge chair to sit in, maybe a flat screen TV, and maybe a wastebasket in the bathroom. We were greeted by a large cockroach that had been smashed on the mini blinds and left there, along with a live one in the bathroom.(room 510), I bet it's still there. Even IKEA standard would have been make this more comfortable. This was New Year’s Eve. The bar was closed to all guests. There was NO guarantee to guests. It hotel felt that it could make more money by selling tickets to their New Year’s party. No guests were allowed unless they purchased $100 tickets prior to that night. Dinner was tragic. For appetizers, we ordered the ahi tartare. Ahi must have been out of season as the tartare boasted little ahi. The calamari in falafel breading was very good. The medium rare New York strips we ordered were medium well. The waiter was very apologetic, but did not offer to take them back. In all, if you want to enjoy skybar, by all means go, try it once. Party at the bar, but the Omni is just down the street. Note, public parking across from the hotel is only $20.00. Hotel valet parking which is shared by public parking at the hotel is $28.00 plus a tip to very, very poor valets that have vocabulary that includes, “What up, yo!”

Reviews.Title: “Go for the Rooftop Bar, but stay somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: BigJMoney
Reviews.Content: My friend and I both booked one of the "large" rooms there. When I entered my room, the previous guest left me a little "surprise" in the toilet in the form of some type of rectal explosion. My friend was given keys that didn't work for his room and had to go back to the check in desk to get new keys. With new keys in hand, the door finally opened to find someone else's luggage still in the room and the room a mess. I couldn't believe they would allow checking into a dirty room (for me) and a room where the previous guest still had not vacated (for my friend.) To their defense, they did give both of us new rooms, but no discounts or anything of the sort. The $28/night valet charge seemed a little excessive too. The rooftop bar was great on Saturday night, but do yourself a favor and stay at the Westin down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Not ideal for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: Zmel110
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because of a coworker's recommendation. I went down to LA for business and I have to say this hotel was not as hot as it was advertised to be. The rooftop bar was everything I had heard about and more but the hotel itself was a different story. The hallways and the rooms are not the cleanest in the world. Furniture is supposed to be hip, but it is low quality and feels cheap. It feels like a recent college graduate's ikea filled bedroom. It is not dirty, but not as clean as some of the mainstream hotels either. The blanket was old and ugly. The worst thing was the noise coming from the street. I seem to be very unlucky with noise but this hotel definitely has a problem with noise and when i called them they acknowledged the problem. They did mention they had plans to do something about that in the coming year. I did check out the rooftop bar that evening and it did feel good to skip the line to get my wristband,when others were begging to get in :)

Reviews.Title: “as expected”
Reviews.Author: travellusty
Reviews.Content: Check-in was smooth though early check-in was not possible this Saturday morning. Room was available promptly at 3 pm. Had a wonderful lunch at the rooftop bar; service a little slow but food tasty, if a little ill presented for the windy rooftop conditions (salad lettuce blowing everywhere.) couch-like loungers very cozy for two or more, loved the Astroturf, outdoor fireplace a nice touch as well. Nice to be able to eat outside in December but this is a place beckoning for summer evening drinks. We got a gigantic room (corner) on the 9th floor. (staff told us that the floor right beneath the rooftop pool can be rather loud at night and suggested that if we minded that to stay on a lower floor) room was decorated nicely, appropriate to the rest of the hotel’s aesthetic (white, yellow, grey). While it was indeed gigantic for a city hotel, the room’s walls felt rather stark for the size. Linens were clean and adequate the bed was mediocre. Everything appeared clean but the interior side of the shower curtain had 3 different types of hair on it before either of us got in and a remnant of unused soap remained on the sunken tub’s ledge. Shower pressure stunk. Entire hotel smells like smoke – even our “non-smoking” room and hallways – but this is a party hotel the place smells like beer, sex and cigarettes because that’s what a lot of their customers are there for. We were there on the day of the UCLA/USC game and a few rooms down from us was some kind of afternoon party that was loud and drunk. Who cares - they were just having a good time. Lots of mid-twenties guests this day. We ate dinner at the restaurant. Food was alright, described better than it turned out to be. Bread was tasty and warmed as was the calamari. Vibe was very upscale, hipster diner-ish; though cheekily designed and low-light. Menu was different than what is online. Service was indifferent; pushy and hurried though only was at half capacity. I asked for two items from the lunch menu (I’m pregnant and had my heart set on the onion soup and onion/goat cheese tart!) and was told by the waiter, who didn't even bother to check with the chefs, that the request couldn’t be accommodated even though those items were available for dinner through room service. (Is this is a shared kitchen?) Waiter seemed to feel his only job was to deliver food not a decent experience. As we were leaving, we said something about the ridiculous amount of coffee grains in our coffee, even showing the guy and as he walked away he said “well, that’s what happens when it’s made fresh.” (?) We pre-ordered our breakfast the night before; it was delivered exactly on time, hot and served with a smile. The prices on the breakfast struck us as unusually low for a hotel, ditto the meager service charge of $1.50. (e.g. – French toast at $7 and 3 Eggs, home fries or salad, 4 pieces of bacon (of ham, sausage), toast of your choosing, juice, and a pot of coffee/tea filled with 3 full cups all for $12!) They forgo the maple syrup and remedied it within 2 minutes of our calling to request it. We requested a late check-out an hour before we were supposed to depart with no problem. (They moved it to 1 pm.) Check-out went smooth and valet was quick to get our car. By and large, it was exactly what we expected. Great front desk service, sexy and thoughtfully designed room, mixed bag of food, and downtown LA. (Agreeably, much less pretension than the Standard on Sunset.)

Reviews.Title: “in love”
Reviews.Author: dawdler1
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at The Standard awhile back and it was, to say the least, mind blowing and/or life changing. Our room was a-maz-ing. The biggest soaking tub I have ever experienced (and I consider myself to be a tub aficionado), super comfy beds, lots of open space, great amenities... We ordered room service several times and were helped by the same super-friendly guy each time. No big deal was made of my request for a no cheese pizza. (I know it seems like a small request, but you'd be surprised at the comments I have received in the past...) Didn't even make it up to the rooftop pool and bar that other reviewers based their entire vacation around. I'm sure it was equally amazing. We did, however, enjoy a bottle of wine in the lobby while we played pool, and on that particular night had the entire lobby to ourselves. Rad. The yellow restaurant was good, awesome decor. The service was really good. I was a little surprised that there was really no vegan option on the menu for breakfast, I had stupidly assumed that there would at least be something... but the staff was super rad and worked with me to create some sort of yummy soy-granola-fruit concoction. The foosball table (that you can tell has seen more than its fair share of rough games) out by where you wait for the valet was, oddly enough, something that I remember most fondly of our trip. It's never too early to kick ass at foosball, even if it's just for the short amount of time spent waiting for the car. I am a firm believer in the "little things" that make a hotel stay fun and comfortable, and this was definitely one of them. There are some poor reviews of the staff on here, but I didn't encounter any indifference or incompetence at all. But in the same token, I am nice, not overly needy, and have a great deal of hotel experience myself and know how to treat people with common courtesy. Everyone who I interacted with was gracious and amazing. This was by far one of my best vacations, and yes there is lots to do in LA and the surrounding areas, but it made all the difference in the world having such a comfortable and welcoming place to come home to. The Standard is my new favorite hotel and I will absolutely stay here again and continue to recommend it to everyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “The Standard”
Reviews.Author: SFAnonymous
Reviews.Content: I checked into the Standard after a very bad night at another downtown LA hotel. I needed sleep bad and had a very important court appearance the next day. The Standard fit me perfectly. The staff was very helpful and pleasant and the room service was excellent. The bed was ever so comfortable, the room crisp and clean and my shower time very pleasant. I liked the minimal yet playful aesthetic. I was having such a great time. Everything was, ah, so perfect, until some crazed freak pulled a fire alarm at 4:30 am to jar his wife out of a room. But even with that early morning shock, the Standard was a fine hotel and I actually got a good sleep and had a good day in court. Thank you to all at the Standard! I am definitely going back.

Reviews.Title: “this place rocks”
Reviews.Author: televasquez
Reviews.Content: The standard is amazing. this hotel is completely wacky. if you dont think you will like it you wont- its not the embassy suites. yeah they are rude, the prices are outrageous, and the rooms are like really small- but there isnt anything else like it. I dont think the elevator has changed since 1955- classic.

Reviews.Title: “Definately worth the visit”
Reviews.Author: cat_miaoow
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really cool. Apart from the location which is in the middle of poor mans land filled with homeless people, it is worth the visit. Even if it's just to lie on the water beds, eat in their fabulous diner, play pool, or just have a quick swim. It's definitely worth it. The toilets in the lobby are interesting as you walk through a womans opens legs. The room decor is also cool, we go a massive tub in our room it was really fun. Definitely go there but you might want to hire a car as you can't just take the bus from there, it is about 30 min drive from Hollywood!

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: eniale10
Reviews.Content: While I was expecting a cool hotel with great amenities, I was very disappointed. A group was in town for a work meeting and we opted for the standard-- due to the hype around it. The hotel was DIRTY.... from the hallways to the room itself. While the room tried to be modern, it was overshadowed by the lack of cleanliness. In addition, I expected to get a lotion or shower cap in the bathroom. NO LUCK.... just a shampoo/conditioner. I will not return to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A definite for party goers or singles, not a place for families!!!”
Reviews.Author: leeloveridge
Reviews.Content: The place is different to all the other hotels that i have been too, i was there for 5 nights on a business trip and think that i went to the rooftop bar every night for a drink, definitely the best part of the hotel, if you are out to have a good time then it is cool. I only ate once in the restuarant and would have to say that the food was also good, it just happened to be that friends i knew in LA took me out for dinner. The staff were very helpful and polite. All in all a good hotel with a difference!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dont do it!”
Reviews.Author: sillybilly21
Reviews.Content: Yes, the Standard is very nice, classy, and beautifully decorated. But, too bad the rooms reek of cigarettes and marijuana. And I'm not sure the maids are getting paid there because there was trash, old room service food lying around the hallways, which remained there for my entire stay. Customer service... TERRIBLE! They did not provide any kind of help, had negative attitudes, and did not acknowledge the crowd of people in need of their assistance. They say the the rooftop bar is open to the public. It's a lie! The entire place is a rip-off. But if you like to spend a lot of money where the entire staff treats you like crap. Be their guest.

Reviews.Title: “I loved being the oldest person there!”
Reviews.Author: peebuster
Reviews.Content: Staying at The Standard in Downtown LA was an event in itself, which is good because there is not a lot going on downtown LA. We took the train into downtown and easily got a cab to the Standard. We received a free upgrade to the largest hotel suite I have yet to stay in. It had a giant orange sectional couch and bathroom which featured a giant (5X5) sculpture of a human foot. I liked it. The staff was all friendly and very professional. Dare I say emo. The rooftop bar was a lot of fun, but the average age being about 22 sent me straight in for more botox injections upon my return from this vacation. The drinks were a bit expensive, and I believe my bar tab exceeded 490 dollars (draft beer!) but it was well worth every penny. And as an added kick, they were filming a movie featuring an exploding car right outside our window. At least I hope that was a movie.......and if it wasn't I hope no one was seriously injured.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting design elements, but not a hotel for the masses.”
Reviews.Author: stockjock
Reviews.Content: For purposes of demographics and introduction, I'm in my mid 40s and my guest was in her mid-30s. The hotel is very hip, with interesting colors, shapes and textures throughout the room. The hotel and its rooms are actually quite different and I applaud the owners for doing something other than the usual cookie cutter approach that is typically seen. Now the downside. The hotel is one big loud party for drunken 20-somethings. The top floors smell of smoke, beer and stale cleaning towels. Lower floors are better and our room on the 8th floor was very clean. Many of our neighbors were kids in their twenties and they were up late partying and were very noisy. I hailed a cab in front of the hotel and as I walked to it, a couple of kids tried to outrun me to the cab. When I told them I had hailed it (and was a half block ahead of them), they called me profanities and threatened to fight me. That gives you some insight as to the mentality (or lack thereof) of the hotel's clientiele. Service was poor. I had to ask for extra towels and a bathrobe 4 times. When calling to ask questions, I was put on hold for very long waits (10+ minutes) and disconnected several times. The bed is a platform bed and you sleep pretty much on the floor. I have a platform and prefer to sleep a bit higher up, but that's a preference thing I suppose. The shower is clear glass on all sides and anyone in the room will watch you shower. My lady friend didn't care for it. It didn't bother me much, but if you're shy, this could be a problem for you, as you will be unquestionably putting on a show for your roommates. Again, it's an interesting hotel. Something different to be sure. But if you're traveling on business, going for a vacation with the family, or easily annoyed by loud, drunken partiers, I'd probably skip it. I don't regret staying at the Downtown L.A. Standard, but I doubt that I'd do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and cool.”
Reviews.Author: leftwing73
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Standard for 4 nights when I was traveling for a computer nerd conference. I found the place to be refreshingly different and fun, but not exquisitely luxurious. I wasn;t sure what to expect, Goofy things like a old console organ in the lobby, the bizarre art gallery on the second floor and the funky decor in the lobby bar really made this place sgtand out. This was not The Marriott. The service was good, but I'm not a real demanding guy. My laptop broke on the plane and I needed a screwdriver. At midnight i asked the effeminate front desk guy for a screwdriver and he acted like he'd never heard of one before, but he was helpful, and about a half-hour later the maintenance guy knocked on my door with my screwdriver. Asking for off-the-wall stuff in the middle of the night and getting without much effort it is good service if you ask me. The agency that booked my room screwed up and had me check out a day early, but the front desk guy came thorugh again and got me another night. The rooms were sparsely and uniquely decorated, which is the point, but the beds were comfortable and the glass-walled shower was making me wish my wife was traveling with me. :) Wish it had wireless, but the free high-speed wired internet is nice. Didn't have a noise problem until Thursday night when there was a band downstairs, I was 3 floors up and was feeling every bass note. The rooftop bar is the coolest thing aboiut the hotel. The co-ed bathroom where you have to guess which way is the men's side is quite an adventure, and trying to figure out how to work the magic hidden sink is frustrating after a few beers. The view is awesome, and the "talent" up there is astounding. It was like a modeling convention. Drinks are expensive and the beer selection isn't great, but it's an experience. I'd stay there again, but not with my kids. It doesn;t really have a family-friendly atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Pluses & Minuses”
Reviews.Author: chibimaru
Reviews.Content: I booked the Standard Downtown because it was one of the hotels listed with my conference at the LA Convention Center in April. I had heard of the Standard at some point, but didn't know much about the reputation until after I had already booked it. Basically, the best things about the Standard Downtown are the 1st floor restaurant and the rooftop pool & bar. The restaurant food is quite good and the portions are very generous. The menu is not that extensive, but I would say acceptable for a hotel restaurant. The drinks are very good; I highly recommend the mojitos. If you are planning to go to the rooftop after dinner, get some drinks in the restaurant first since they are a lot better. The wait staff is *very* friendly and not at all pretentious (which I noticed was a complaint from some earlier review). The rooftop bar: there is a small dancefloor in the corner, but the DJ is actually next to the bar which is set apart from the dancefloor. There is a nice 360 degree view of downtown LA, but because the hotel isn't the tallest building, the view is just "above average" (i.e., not great, not bad). You do get an interesting view of the main LA Public Library which is beautiful. Drinks are average--the quality is hit/miss--depending on how busy they are. Friday and Saturday nights are *extremely* busy. I believe there is a $20 cover for the rooftop bar, but if you are a hotel guest, you & 1 additional person can enter for free. As a hotel guest, going to the roof on Fri/Sat is a bit of a hassle because you need to go down to the parking lot where they distribute the wristbands and show your room card in order to get your wristbands. You have to get a separate band for Friday and Saturday. The good thing is that once the hotel workers see your room card, you do not have to wait in line. They are very good about pulling you to a separate area to give you your bands right away. The rooftop is open 7d/week, and it is definitely not as crowded Sun-Tues, but still fun. There are heating lamps upstairs & an outdoor fireplace so you won't be cold. The pool is heated and probably a lot of fun. There was a private event on the roof which shut down the pool the one day I wanted to go swimming, so check with the front desk before you go there. The rooms are nicely sized. There is a platform bed and a minimalist wall desk along the window side of the room. Most of the rooms have simply a glass wall separating the bathroom from the bedroom. If there is a double bed, there is a retractable showerside curtain along the glass wall for privacy. If you get a single bed, there is no privacy curtain. I had a wheelchair accessible room so there was actually a solid wall with a tall skinny window separating the bathroom from the bedroom. There is no wireless in the rooms, but an ethernet cable is available upon request when you check in. The walls are very thin, so I unfortunately heard quite a bit of amorous noise from the room next door. In terms of nearby dining, Zucca's is good; the Daily Grille across the street has a nice happy hour with drinks & appetizers. There are a lot of small eateries within 1 block, but they typically close fairly early. The Westin Bonaventure is 1 block away and there is a revolving restaurant on the top floor which offers a very mellow setting for dessert (huge portions) and drinks. Overall, it's a convenient hotel--definitely a place to go that's hip and social. I think it's a good place to stay for a meeting since you just have to go upstairs for PM entertainment. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Still a bargain, but noise/staff problems”
Reviews.Author: SFGuy35
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Standard Downtown numerous times in the last year (most recently in April 2007), and while I've often enjoyed it, things have slipped a bit. Cheap rates are often to be had on the hotel site ($119 seems to be the best), but beware: that price will likely put you on a lower floor, and both times I've stayed on the 3rd floor, the noise has been astounding. In August of 2006, a party in the next room featured top-of-lungs screaming and banging on the walls at 4am; repeated calls to the front desk were met with indifference and mockery. On the most recent visit, a party a few rooms down featured drunken carousing in the halls until 5am. I understand the Standard is not the Holiday Inn, but it's also not a frat house, and the staff don't seem to care if it becomes one. However, perhaps staying on an upper floor is the answer: when I've either paid for a better room or been upgraded (only once in probably 15 stays!) it has been extremely quiet, even on weekend nights. Maybe they throw all the partiers on the 3rd floor? Next time, I'll try requesting a higher floor. For the price, I still think it's one of the more interesting and practical hotels for the traveler interested in unique experiences and good modern design. Sure, the decor isn't the jaw-dropping surprise it was a few years ago, but the rooms are still very clean, the beds are comfortable, and a glassed-in shower is pretty cool. My experiences with room service and the restaurant have been mostly good (although trying to get breakfast at 6am before an early flight was practically impossible, due to missing wait staff and "computer problems"). The food is pretty good. Understand that the weekend bar/rooftop scene is part of LA nightlife and thus pretty pretentious, but you're staying in the hotel and it's free, so why not go enjoy a rooftop cocktail with the trying-to-be-beautiful? Yes, there's wristbands/cards/whatever, but it's not Omaha, and it wouldn't be as fun if it was. Anyway, there's so much more to do in LA you shouldn't be hanging at the hotel on a Saturday night. In general, I still applaud the hotel's existence, as a fine example of creative reuse of its former bank building, and as a pioneer in the reemergence of downtown LA. Plus, focusing on what current, young travellers really want and need (some quality snacks in the minibar, instead of crappy coffee and a dirty coffeemaker, for example) make it much more practical than comparitively priced hotels. So, I guess the biggest concern is the extreme level of noise, and the staff's lack of response to it. It's my hope that the indifference the staff has recently shown is not a sign that the Downtown Standard has started to slip in general. The hotel can still be lively and fun without degenerating to anarchy, and in my opinion, paying $120 for a room should guarantee a basic level of quiet, at least from 1 or 2am to 7 or 8am on weekend nights. For staff to laugh off complaints is just insulting.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed the Standard”
Reviews.Author: Limosine
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Standard in Downtown for our honeymoon and to catch an NBA game and go shopping in Santee Alley. Overall the experience was great. Was worried about the noise factor considering the other reviews, but didn't have any problems except a dog (terrier?) barking next door at 3am on our last night. The dog shut up after a verbal assault from my wife! I think it may have helped that we chose a non-smoking floor as smokers tend to party and drink more I believe. This meant we rarely heard other people while we were in our room. Bed was nice and big with new sheets and comforter. Was surprised to find some shampoo, conditioner and soap provided as well as bathrobes! Massive TV and Nichiguchi stereo was also nice. Didn't have much to do with the staff, but they were courteous. We checked out at 4-30am during which their computer system was down, so we weren't issued with a reciept or charge list. Hopefully nothing scary will be billed to my credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff, Horrible Food, Didn't Honor Reservations”
Reviews.Author: tktony777
Reviews.Content: So get this. We book two reservations on expedia. Paid. Confirmed. And have the printed itenrary. Get there, and they say, sorry, but we are sold out. "BUT I HAVE A CONFIRMATION NUMBER!!" The rude jerk tells me that the booking was not done at The Standard website. AND THEY ARE NOT RESPONSIBLE BECAUSE IT'S EXPEDIA'S FAULT. Then he tells me that it happens all the time. So now I'm getting mad and ask him " WELL IT HAPPENS ALL THE TIME, WHY WOULD YOU DO BUSINESS WITH EXPEDIA??" He rolls his eyes. So then I say, i understand mistakes happen but the least you can do is walk us to another hotel??....AND HE SAYS NO!!!!!!!!! NOT OUR PROBLEM. On top of that the food is horrible and expensive. I had heard horror stories about this place before but I guess i had to suffer myself. Good Luck.

Reviews.Title: “The Standard Sucks”
Reviews.Author: Mascott610
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awful...there are not enough words to describe how horrible this hotel is. I was in LA on business and had an early meeting the next day. I was only allowed 3 hours of sleep because of the partiers running and screaming down the hall until 4 a.m. The decor was another low point. Some call it trendy, but it's only trendy if you have absolutely no personality. And if you like a nice hot shower, you are in for a big treat... the shower was as big as some New York studios so don't bring your razors ladies! To sum up it up, a nice mix between prison mixed with 50s horror film.

Reviews.Title: “Security”
Reviews.Author: blade422c
Reviews.Content: The Standard Hotel was very impressive. The decorations for the hotel are beautiful. Our room was very clean and decorated very trendy and hip. The hotel staffs except the security guards/bouncers were very nice and professional. The security guards/bouncers need to take a refresher course in treating people like professionals. I'm quite positive that the majority of the individuals staying at the hotel are professionals in their line of work. With this in mind, treating the guests like if they were in high school or even college is not the right choice. I know that the security guards/bouncers are faced with the constant problem of drunken guests trying to do whatever they want in the hotel and some measures need to be taken. What I do not agree with is the fact that the security guards/bouncers are not treating people with true professionalism when they are addressed to and they are expecting every guest to be as drunk as the person who is not following the rules. They cannot treat every guest the same way. Every guest is different and has different needs. Overall the hotel was a good experience and I would recommend it to many of my friends who travel to downtown Los Angels for business.

Reviews.Title: “The Standard is very low”
Reviews.Author: claszyldy26
Reviews.Content: A few friends and I decided to stay at The Standard in downtown Los Angeles to celebrate a birthday. We booked The Standard hearing great things about it. However, when we arrived it took forever to get us checked into our room, and there was no line! The rooms are very minimilistic which isn't my style but that's o.k. The beds were very low to the ground with prison like blankets. There really was nothing special abou the room at all. And when we tried to get into our room at 2 a.m. our key card wouldn't work! Luckily our friend was already in there so she let us in, telling us that her card didn't work either and she had to have security let her in. When we went to check out in the morning the desk clerks were very snooty and when we told them our room keys didn't work he told us that if they came in contact with a cell phone they would demagnitize! That would have been nice to know when we checked in!! Then we would have kept them away from the cell phones! Ughh! I will never return there!

Reviews.Title: “I guess I am just an old hipster but ...”
Reviews.Author: Webdesignlab
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night and loved it. OK, it is a little marginal in it's appeal, bit since I like what they are clearly offering, I give it a thumbs up. It is a stylish hotel with staff that can be intimidating if you are not used to style bars or hotels. They are fine ... it's just policy to act cool. I think that it is a good thing .. others may see it as French style & off-hand. I would say to any British readers of this review that it is 'Jarvis Cocker meets business class'. The staff however were very responsive and were there to help. The bar was great, how can one not say that? It is roof top with towering office blocks around ...a cityscape that I found extremely energetic. The bar was well stocked and their wine list was impecable. Prices were hardly budget but I thought that the prices for the rrooms were so reasonable that It all levelled out in the end. The see-through bathrooms are an inteligent answer to a space versus style problem. The make the room look bigger and adds a sexy nuance. That is their function. They have a large curtain for privacy so there was no problem for me. Anyway watching my wife shower was an aphrodisiac. What is the downside to that? Location is very much business district, but the bar is very much party district. If you like hip, you will like this. Not a family place.

Reviews.Title: “Good party hotel”
Reviews.Author: JBandT
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Standard Friday Jan 12. We chose this hotel mainly for the ambience,and the lively rooftop bar. It was actually a pretty enjoyable stay. We had great tickets to the Lakers game down the street. The see through shower was a nice! It is definately a place to stay if you want to party. The rooftop bar was a pretty happenin place, even though it was a really cold night. We decided to try the lobby restaurant/bar instead. This was actually pretty good as well. The one drawback was a lack of a concierge. Room service breakfast was decent, but not great. Overall, nice place to stay for the price, scenery, and location, if you need to stay Downtown.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Auburn, CA - Or in a hotel room somewhere
