Reviews.Title: “What else were the other reviewer's expecting?”
Reviews.Author: Brian31313131
Reviews.Content: For me, I travel a lot… A LOT… I appreciate the unique rooms the minimalist style and the simple and comfortable beds and lighting. The staff has always been great to me and I have never had problems with snobbery that others have been complaining about. Do not expect an ordinary hotel and if you don’t like the style, you shouldn’t knock it. This hotel was just not designed for YOU and DEFINITY NOT the place for the family. This hotel is not for everyone, but what were some of these people thinking when they made their reservation? The pictures on the website will clearly tell you what the hotel is all about! I will continue to stay here while in LA because you cannot beat the rates, location, comfort (for me), and the great food in the lobby (again, reasonably priced). Great for a sales guy like me that enjoys the little things.

Reviews.Title: “Sooo Surprised the LOW STANDARD”
Reviews.Author: mophalen
Reviews.Content: My friends and I all decided to stay here for a bday weekend 20+ people from LA and SF. I booked a "Suite" which while I will say the space big, there was nothing "Sweet" about it. The bed was uncomfortable, poor linen and towl quality, bathroom door fell off the hinges, modern decor cheap and tacky, used IKEA at best. The bathroom was disgusting, and overall the room was just not clean nor was it comfortable. WE BOOKED out of the hotel the next morning! By the way, the whole rooftop bar access is sooooo ridiculous. They give you wristbands at check-in, which if you dont have on, they wont let you up, even if you are a guest! I am glad we partied at the Figueroa, should have stayed at the WESTIN! Waste of $400!

Reviews.Title: “So-so at The Standard”
Reviews.Author: karinf74
Reviews.Content: Loved the free Internet access and the well-equipped 24-hour gym. Since I had to travel throughout the city, the hotel wasn't any more or less convenient than any other. And, traveling on a work budget, the price was reasonable -- $160 for a huge room. The service, though, was hit or miss: Desk service was far from prompt, items weren't readily replenished (glasses in the room, towels in the gym, etc.), and while the valet was anxious to park my car, no one could bother to help me with my luggage. The room service menu read as more appetizing than it tasted. And as far as the hipness factor goes -- the decor is already becoming a little dated.

Reviews.Title: “Is Hospitality Dead in Downtown LA?”
Reviews.Author: mattsonnicole
Reviews.Content: In shopping for a chic LA hotel, The Standard's website stood out. I loved the simplicity of the room types and was sold by their web-marketing. Unfortunately, my expectations were too high. While The Standard has a great physical product in their lobby and roof top bar, I would suggest visiting for a cocktail, but stay elsewhere overnight. The rooms (we stayed in a Medium) are nothing more than a mattress on the floor and a desk chair. Not comfortable, and none of the little touches that many trendy boutique hotels offer to make you feel welcome. I've had better accomodations "couch surfing" in my college days. This is a sad example of when trendiness gets in the way of the purpose of a hotel--to provide hospitality. My husband remarked that it felt like a dystopian novel (a la '1984'). To top it off, my friend wanted to take a picture of the phones in the lobby. The cords are all different lengths, and my friend is one of the few who could appreciate the art in the design. When she went to take the photo, the desk manager stopped her saying she needed permission to take a photo in the lobby. Funny, because the night before we got about a dozen shots on the electric organ they have by the elevators. I have never felt less welcome in a hotel. If you loved the website, stop in to see their design, but don't stay!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away if you have any taste or want any service.”
Reviews.Author: jazdrew
Reviews.Content: I got in the elevator and went to my floor. When the door opened I was overcome by the smell of stale cigarette smoke and beer. The entire floor smelled like a high school student's room after homecoming. You should know that I'm a partier and I'm not easily bothered by some of the externalties of a party environment but this was awful. I went to dinner at the hotel's restaurant and had an amazingly horrendous experience. We ordered our food never to see the waiter again until he came to clear our table. No one's food was very good and my steak was terrible but I ate it since I never saw him again and didn't want to deal with a scene. When he was clearing the table I told him my steak was very bad. I didn't expect much since I ate most of it. Mabye I expected someting like, "I'm sorry to hear that sir. I can give you a free desert." I would have settled for "I'm sorry.". The bill was $400 for 4 people so I think a free desert is pretty reasonable. The waiter said, "That's too bad." Huh? What kind of waiter says that? Anyway, he left and I told my friends that I was going to give the him a chance to save his tip. Finally, when he returned I asked him if he was at all curious what was wrong with my steak or how anyone else's meal was. The waiter immediately copped an atitude with me and said, "What do you want me to do?!?!? I have other tables and don't have time to deal with you." He made me suggest a method of resolution which I finally did after being pushed to the point of anger. The waiter never came back and the manager came out telling me that I ate most of my steak and there's nothing she can do about it. I told her I didn't expect a free steak and informed her of the waiter's attitude. She told me that he said he had done everything he could with you people. That's when I flew off the handle and ended up in a heated argument with the manager. When I asked the waiter to join the conversation he flatly said "no!" and walked away. It was unbelievalbe. Anyway, I'm the type of customer that tips 15% if the service is bad and 25% for anything above avereage. I left the waiter $.01. This was, hands down, the worst service I've ever had in my life. The next day we were forced to eat breakfast at the same spot since there was no other place open at the time within walking distance. Our breakfast (bagles and oatmeal) took 30 minutes to arrive and the staff was just as rude as the night before. My point is that if you are over 25 yrs old or so you should not stay here. The place is a flop house and is intended for partying only. The staff acts like they're doing you a favor by giving you an ounce of their attention. I would have gotten better service at a Best Western. I cannot overstate how bad this hotel is. By the end of my 24 hr stay the room, dinner, drinks at the roof baf and breakfast ended up costing me and my girlfriend approx. $700. Come hell or high water, do not stay at this hotel unless you're so high you don't mind siting with your $8 beer that took 20 minutes to get to you.

Reviews.Title: “A great (somewhat pretentious) hotel for a weekend away...”
Reviews.Author: jenjaxn
Reviews.Content: We got a kick out of staying at The Standard. Our room was awesome. It had a platform bed and a glass shower so you can watch your significant other shower from the bedroom (rawr!). They have a fabulous restaurant downstairs. We had the most delicious gourmet burgers and cocktails. There was internet access...so that was awesome. It's pretty much a requisite wherever we go. The room service was off the hook. We had a fabulous breakfast in our room each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Crappiest Service EVER”
Reviews.Author: khor01
Reviews.Content: Stayed Thursday through Sunday in August, mainly for easy access to the rooftop bar. This place is WAAAY overrated, as many others have said. The Standard has no concept of customer service. None of the staff engender warm fuzzy feelings of being welcomed and wanted as a guest at this place. Example of CRAPPY SERVICE: My colleague and I forgot our toothbrushes so we asked for some at the front desk... nothing. So I called again... nothing. I called 3 more times... nothing. Next day, I return at night, and finally, there are two toothbrushes in the bathroom. Worst part is, each time I called, the staff said they'd send them right away. Liars!. I would stay at the Wilshire Grand or some other hotel nearby for half the price (through hotwire or priceline), and then just wait in line and pay the $20 cover if you are desperate to get up to the rooftop bar.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous breakfasts; great location”
Reviews.Author: Eblana
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a conference group, and was not sharing my room. As a single occupant, I adored the see-through bathroom area (I could watch TV whilst showering, this was so much fun!). The room was fairly plain, but with a killer view, and it was fun to watch the offices opposite, coming alive in the early a.m. (my jet-lag got me up very early...). The staff were perfectly polite and I had no expereince of rude or off-hand service. In fact the waiting staff in the snack-bar/breakfast room were so helpful and friendly that I felt I knew them personally by the end of my stay. The breakfasts (every day I had a different, and delicious, maple-syrup themed confection) were outstanding, and well-priced, and my one foray up to the roof-top 'club' (on the Saturday night) was really fun, even if I did feel a bit old (I'm mid-30s) - the projection of films onto nearby buildings was cute, and the music was good. My bed was very comfortable and whilst I never worked out how to use the phone, that may have been a result of jet-lag. The location (close to the beautiful Public Library) was very atmospheric; and Broadway was in easy reach. I would stay there again - great value for money (even though I wasn't paying, on this occasion).

Reviews.Title: “so-so hotel”
Reviews.Author: carpinkly
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in late July as part of a wedding -- the room felt cheap. And the see-through shower was ridiculous. Some of our friends who were sharing rooms as friends were very uncomfortable at the exposure. The rooms were unimpressive -- clearly it was an office building before becoming a hotel and it has not lost that antiseptic feel. Service was generally quite slow though also friendly-- it's clear they don't employ enough staff. Maybe that's because they seem determined to employ hip-looking young people who look like models and maybe cost more money. Service during the day at the rooftop bar was nonexistent and the bartenders were rude when people asked for a waitress. The hotel is trying a little too hard to seem "alternative". For example, there was no button on our phone to call room service, although there was a button for "hell" and one for "alibi". Before coming to Los Angeles, I learned that a gigantic outdoor rave was being held near the hotel. I called the staff and inquired if this would present a noise problem and was assured they'd never had any complaints. The noise kept my wife up all night. We are not ancient -- we are 30 years old -- but listening to raving until 4 am was a little much. I left some items in the room at check out and my messages to "hospitality" were not returned. But overall, for about $150 a night, it's hard to complain. Hotel is fine for the price. And the food was quite good. Good restaurant and room service and excellent mojitos though they appear to use some sort of mix.

Reviews.Title: “overated and trying to be 'the scene'”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a wedding over the 4th of July weekend. The service was terrible to non-existent. We waited in both check in and check out 1 hour for the Bell service to bring up the luggage. We had a rehearsal dinner to get to and my wife had to go down and take the luggage cart up herself in order for us to make the wedding event (I was in the shower so I couldn't get it). The pool is a tired effort to be hip and cool. In the evenings and Sundays the upper deck is shut down for their parties in which you have to go through absurd securtiy to get onto that floor. We had two small children with us who wanted to use this pool and couldn't. This is despite two phone conversations with the staff before our arrival verifying their child friendly policies. Beyond that, our rooms were dirty. We even found a dirty sock (not ours) under the lip of our bed. Rooms only get cleaned on request, which we had to do. The hallways smelled. My daugter, and I quote said ,"It smells like a potty" in the hallways. This hotel is one of the worst I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “people are giving this place a bad wrap! i liked it, except...”
Reviews.Author: rrrjjjmmm
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at The Standard Downtown for 2 nights (although booked for 4). We liked it, rooms were simple but fine. I like the way they give you a CD player. At the end of it, we really liked this hotel. And the waiters working down in the restaurant were lovely and friendly when you got talking to them. We went up to the rooftop bar and they were holding a "pool party". It was incredibly pretentious and revolting so we moved on. The next night it was much nicer and more civilised. We decided to move. Having booked at the standard before ever having come to LA, we didn't know where we were booking. The location was terrible for a couple of girls looking to shop and go out on the town. Downtown was a bit grubby and we found we were feeling quite threatened by the amount of heckling and cat calls we received walking down the street. Crazy. We moved to The Standard West Hollywood (got a good rate online - see other review). It was great there too. We we told them we wanted to check out the next day, the guy at the front desk seemed to take it personally and gave a bit of attitude, however, I'm fairly blunt and when he did the whole "you should've researched more before you booked" I gave him a bit of a "don't get narky with me mister" chat and all was settled. He said that we wouldn't be able to get a room at Standard WH for less than $250 a night (I went online to prove him wrong and booked us in at $150 per night). Other than this, everything was great. Would recommend, if someone was specifically looking to holiday downtown (don't know why!). Otherwise, my recommendation would be The Standard West Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Only for those under 25”
Reviews.Author: aaas
Reviews.Content: If you are over 25 forget it....the shower is dangerous unless you ask for a handicapped room....only one chair....

Reviews.Title: “MIght be fun just once”
Reviews.Author: BoarderX
Reviews.Content: First stayed at the Standard in 2004. As promised, it was cool and hip from lobby to room to rooftop pool/bar/club. Not the most comfortable, but stylish and fun. Two years later, not much has changed -- and that's not a good thing. What was cool and hip is now tired and mundane. A property whose main attraction is modern style should strive to stay interesting, imaginative, and relevant. Without the "wow" factor, the hotel's shortcomings and shortcuts on the basics start to stand out more. No wireless Internet (ethernet connection is possible, although I couldn't get tech support to help make it work), and the phone could only work on speakerphone. Some superficial cleaning problems. Parking is easy and relatively inexpensive for a downtown location, and the restaurant offers a good breakfast. Fitness center is modest but very adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: emiao
Reviews.Content: It's suppose to be hip but it really seemed to be faux-hip. So stay here if you think you're going to see the hip-side of LA...frankly, I think downtown LA is the underbelly of hip, but then again, it could be reverse-chic and the truly hip go to Downtown. Who knows? Face-lifted from the old Superior Oil office building, the hotel is well located for business meetings. The rooms are very large and wonderfully appointed in a minimalist way, if your taste runs in that direction. I stayed for one-night, midweek in early April. No one helps you find your way to the room, which isn't a big deal for me. But upon arriving at my room, I found a used glass sitting by the door. I didn't pick it up nor did I call housekeeping to take it away. Instead, I wanted to see whether the hotel staff would clear it on its own...the glass was still there when I left for dinner, was still there when I returned from dinner, and was still there when I left in the morning. Given the service level at the hotel (there was no one manning the reception desk when I arrived and when checking out, the receptionist was on the phone, focused on an impending photo shoot to be held in one of the rooms), my guess is that the glass is still there. Since I won't be staying at the hotel again, I won't be able to check whether the glass is still there when I return to LA for a business trip at the end of the month. Image is everything at the hotel. It's style over substance, but then again, perhaps, since I'm a "suit", I didn't get a level of service that may be reserved for the truly hip. The roof top bar is a nice place to have a drink and observe what appears to be either the truly hip or pretenders to the truly hip. You should be your own judge on that matter.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is good except the security”
Reviews.Author: bilz
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of negative reviews about this hotel but I had no problems at all. The furnishings are very trendy and new-age, comfortable beds, high speed internet is complementary, and despite being smoking rooms, they do not smell smoky at all. The only time I smelled a hint of smoke is if I opened the windows, I'm guessing the air permeating through the curtains brought a slight smell out. Also, if you walk out of your room anytime after noon, the halls are filled with smoke. One problem is if you're hungry, there is no convenience stores in the area and it's a hassle to get in your car and drive anyplace. If you valet your car, you have to wait for him to find it, if you self-park, you're charged a full day rate EVERY time you come and go. The mini bar is very expensive and in my experience, I saw a mini bar charge on my card that I did not make. I called to find out what the specific charges were but it was taking a long time and it was only $5 so I gave up. My main problem with this place is the security. The front desk help is nice, as are the waiters, waitresses, and bartenders, but the guys doing security, as well as the young woman who tries to act as the hostess, are the bottom of the barrel as far as customer service is concerned. If you're a hotel guest, you won't have much trouble getting into the upstairs bar, but you'll be treated rudely by the snobby hostess and the hispanic security guard downstairs nonetheless. If you're not a hotel guest, you probably won't get in at all, even if the bar is empty. The security and the hostess feel that a long line will make the bar seem more attractive, and they feel like important people for making $6.75 to stand there. Once you get past them, you can have a nice night. Overall, it'll be a 5 star place if and when they ever do some quality control and take out the trash working up front.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy but Quite Unconfortable Accomodation - Be Aware of What You Are Buying”
Reviews.Author: gdilieto
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I booked three nights at The Standard Downtown hotel during our vacation to LA on last Thanksgiving holidays. We picked this hotel because we knew it as a trendy place to stay in LA with one of the hottest bar in town, right the kind of place you may want to stay at when visiting LA. It took us one hour after checking in to take the decision we would move to a different hotel the very next morning. It does not take much to explain the reason of our decision: the hotel may have been trendy but was providing us with quite an uncomfortable accomodation. The room was minimalist, we knew that, with no frills, essential furniture and amenities, and that was not a big issue indeed. What drove our decision was the bathroom. The bathroom had no bathtub where we could have a bath and relax and it had a huge open window overlooking right the bedroom preventing having any minimum privacy when using it. The other major attraction of this hotel was the rooftop bar. Very nice indeed, but do not expect to have special treatment just because you are guest of the hotel. We had to queu and check in just like all other patrons coming from outside. It would not have changed much if we had stayed at a different hotel and come by at night. To sum up, we were looking at The Standard Downtown hotel as a trendy place to stay in LA but we found out that it did not meet the minimum level of comfort we were looking for and eventually we decided to leave. In closure, we actually do not disrecommend this hotel but we definetely recommend other travellers considering this option to be fully aware of what they are buying - a trendy but quite uncomfortable accomodation - to avoid being disappointed from the choice.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Plastic, Overpriced, Junk...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dirty, Loud, Smelly, Boring...Fake. Everything is cheap and plastic, and not worth the price...I highly recommend not going there...

Reviews.Title: “the review”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi there: I just stayed at the standard from jan 20-25th. The hotel was clean and the room was properly presented. THe hotel supplies a free wire to connect your laptop to the room. DO NOT use the terminals in the lobby. I watched some people check their email, and "wow" they charge $.69 minute and it is like nascar on the time, not one person paid less than $15 bucks to check email!!! What a joke. Also, there is no mini-bar menu with prices. Go to the local market and stock up. Here is the funny thing. I live in NYC and recently held a townhouse in neweport beach and totally realize why there is only one NYC. ONe of the reviews stated about the hotel security. It is pretty funny, but remember this is L.A or "plastic city." They have a security guy at the elevator telling people that they only allow 2 people up and check your bags for liquor. "EXCUSE ME....this is a hotel, not a day care center." It's L.A and they try hard to be cool with velvet ropes and all, but it frustrates the people who actually are paying.....the staff should wake up, and not be rude. I laugh it off, becasue remember that "we can afford" to stay there, they have to work there, that is the frustration. The desk staff was nice, the room service and meals were very good. Banana split was solid. The valet guys are good too, a little pricey to drop your ride, but NYC is the same. I like the hotel, but the wana-be roof-top scene is pretty weak compared to a NY night, and it shuts at 1pm......in NYC we start to go out at 1am.....hahaha

Reviews.Title: “Know what you are choosing and then love it!”
Reviews.Author: bsawg
Reviews.Content: I don't know why anyone would stay here if they aren't fans of over-the-top modern design, because obviously that is what you are in for! We actively seek out the trendy and outrageous and therefore *loved* this hotel. The price is excellent and the location was quite good. The room was beautiful (we stayed in a Large) and relaxing, the bed and pillows great. The Roof Bar is a completely unique location and experience and we had a lovely time meeting some local friends there around 6 pm - lots of room to sit and great edamame. We peeked our heads up at midnight (thought we should at least use the bracelets!) and it was busy and scene-ish (the night before New Year's Eve). We did like that their elitism in keeping the numbers low on who gets in means that there are places to sit and walk around even when the dance floor is packed. In any case, it was a lovely place (the drinks are *crazy* expensive, even for a New Yorker!!). We will definitely stay at The Standard again. If you find this sort of silly, outrageous, trendiness to be cloying, this isn't the place for you. Don't book here if you don't enjoy playing at being trendy for a couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “Anything but standard”
Reviews.Author: ashley0115
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely geared toward the younger crowd. I'm sure if I were much younger my rating would be higher. It was not for the business traveler, family, or anyone over 25. The staff is not friendly. It is decorated in what could be considered 70s chic, but it was ultimately just uncomfortable. The beds are on platforms on the floor. The colors are drab, gray and white. It takes an act of Congress to get to the rooftop bar. It was very disconcerting to think what may have happened in my room with prior guests! I, personally, would never stay here again and probably would not stay at any of the other Standard properties based solely on this experience.

Reviews.Title: “"Standard" says it all -- this hotel is NOTHING special”
Reviews.Author: llwcl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business because it was very close to the meeting I had the next morning. I'd imagine if you are in your 20's and hip and trendy is a top priority this place is great fun. But if you are not and value service and amenities -- dont stay here. I am 8 and 1/2 months pregnant, when I checked in with the hotel's velt no one offered to help with my bags -- a first. So I schlepped my bags in (no doorman to get the door either) and checked in. Check in was fine. My room was large -- but neednt be given the minimalist layout. I had a soap, shampoo and conditoner. No lotion, no cups by the wash basin and no bathrup. The room, although a non-smoking room, smelled mildly of smoke, but not bad. The walls were somewhat thin and I could easily hear other doors opening and closing and the bing of the elevator. I ordered room service breakfast the next day. The guy who delivered it acted as if I inconviennced him by placing my order and was not friendly at all. the breakfast was pretty good though. Upon checkout the computer was down and they said they would fax my bill within two hours. It never came. I was simply not impressed. It was clean, but very utilitarian. If you prefer the Four Seasons, Ritz, or even a nice Omni type hotel....dont stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, but that's all.”
Reviews.Author: Winddancer1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel due to a friend's recommendation. I read all the bad reviews so I was prepared. The best things going for this hotel are....the rooftop bar and pool. Very fun! Nice atmosphere. The downstairs restaurant isn't too overpriced, but the food is only so-so. The rooms have the best stocked mini bars I have ever scene. The worst part.....is everything else. The maid service was terrible. They didn't clean the blood smears off of the bathroom door from who knows when it got there. That's just nasty. Your typical complementary bathroom items were not there. Only Shampoo and Conditioner which they didn't even stock right, I had to call room service for them. The maids even took away my soap and didn't replace it. The blankets on the bed are itchy! There is no garbage pail in the bathroom. The hallways are pretty nasty. Especially the 12th floor that smells like urine, probably from people losing patience for the tiny rooftop bathrooms. My co-worker was handicapped with a broken foot. This hotel is not well suited to the handicapped. It's a hassle to get to the rooftop bar. Also there are no doormen to help with your luggage and the lift for wheelchairs was broken. I do not recommend this place. I've stayed at the Biltmore just around the corner and that is WAY better.

Reviews.Title: “horrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I will never go back to this place again!! This was supposed to be a birthday celebration for me and it turned into a disaster!! Apparently if you have a bad back and walk funny, the judgemental door people at the bar assume you are drunk and will not let you it. Not like it isn't bad enough to be in pain on your birthday, but you are singled out because of a physical problem. After asking management for help, they refused any assistence because that one person working the door has full power. Nobody else in this place is allowed to use their own judgement or brains. To top the night off, the valet would not let me have my car because they heard I was drunk, but nobody was willing to call the police to give me a breathalizer. Meanwhile, I sat and watched other guests that were obviously wasted get their car back with ease and race out of the parking lot. I finally had to threaten to call the police, because they were holding the car against my will, to get my car back. I have never been treated this poorly in my entire life and would hate to see anyone else have their night ruined because of inconsiderate people that are going nowhere in life.

Reviews.Title: “The roof top bar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beautiful view.....nice atmosphere Beware of the tip being added in by server....she gave herself a tip..we were a group of six and were surprised that she closed out the card and when we received the copy to sign she had already given herself a very generous tip... Be sure to ask about the give yourself a tip clause.....

Reviews.Title: “Pre-Wedding Celebration @ The Standard!”
Reviews.Author: MCHOTSIE
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I are getting married on 10.1.05 and we decided to blow off some "wedding planning" steam at The Standard last weekend. We invited our entire wedding party as well as a few other close friends. About 16 people out of our party of 18 stayed the night. My fiance and I were the only ones that had been to The Standard before, so everyone else was pretty excited about it. We booked an X-Large room (the $185 one) and to our complete surprise, we ended up getting a free upgrade to their Wow room (the $325 one). This worked out great since this huge room allowed us to have a lil cocktail party with our guests in our room before we headed up to the rooftop. Once on the rooftop, we instantly found a great spot to chill. Everyone had their own lil couch area with heatlamps, tables, ashtrays, and a waitress! The view is breathtaking up there and our friends got a kick outta the vibrating waterbed pods on the pool deck. We spent 4 wonderful hours on the rooftop - everyone had a blast! By 1:30am, we were starving. Those chicken/ beef satay skewers, brushetta, and plaintain chips w/ guacamole appetizers just didn't cut it. A few people scurried off to their rooms, but the rest of us headed down to the 24 hour diner off of the main lobby area. We were seated right away and the food hit the spot. I got a grilled cheddar sandwich with bacon and tomato inside with shoestring fries - it was fabulous! Others got a cheeseburger, chicken club sandwich, fish n chips, omelette, and chocolate souffle cake. As you can see, they offer a wide variety of dishes and all of them were quite fulfilling at 2am. My fiance and I got to bed around 4:30am - we ended up taking a bubble bath in our gigantic bathtub. I'm not kidding, it could have easily fit 4 people. Before going to bed, we put our breakfast order on our front door and when it arrived at 10am, we were so glad we ordered it. The fruit plate was fantastic, the chicken apple sausage was mouthwatering, and the eggs and pancakes were perfectly cooked. We were so glad we chose The Standard for our pre-wedding celebration. All of our guests had such a great time...one of them even said that he thinks we should start a tradition and all come to The Standard every year!

Reviews.Title: “Standard, but not usual...thank god!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Standard downtown LA for a two night visit in November and was pleasently surprised. The rooms are a bit different in thier layout, decor and functionality, I definetely enjoyed the simplistic and modern approach of thier trend. By far the best in room burgers and fries I have ever had (true for the Standard Sunset I found recently as well), and the in room bar is second to none for choices after a day of flying especially for such a great deal on the room. The lounge area in the lobby is a quaint yet open space to unwind with a sake, a round of pool or listening to the smooth tunes from the DJ they have there. As for the club on the roof.......very LA wanna be producer non-sense. Fun to people watch with a drink, and the movie they play on the wall of another building was cool, but overall not my scene. And a scene is exactally what it is. However since hotel guests do not have to pay to get in, or wait, it dosent hurt to play the LA thing if just for an hour. Overall, great hotel if you are feeling like a departure from the USUAL beige, boring chain hotel. Definetely not a place for families, kids, or anyone wanting a quiet stay(the hotel got a bit roundy the Friday night I was there). The Standard on Sunset is better I think for it's location and stuff, but the Downtown location is a lot nicer!

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: LBR9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Standard downtown on a Friday and Saturday evening. Service was bad from the moment we arrived. We pulled into the valet area, were told just to leave our car "there". "There" was smack in the middle of the driveway, blocking the entrance and backing up traffic onto 6th Street. No assistance was given with our luggage (which has to be carried up stairs, past the outside bar and restaurant area, navigate through the lobby (which was already beginning to fill up) and finally to the reception desk. We were checked in by a very rude woman with the social skills of a gnat. No information whatsoever was given about the hotel, for example - - how access to the rooftop bar. Once we were up in our X-large room (which by the way was a smoking room - - we had requested non-smoking on our online reservation), we did a once over. Definitely nothing outstanding. The bathroom has ZERO amenities - - not even a trash can. There is a faint trace of grime over everything. We went down for dinner. Initially, service was bad - - we waited for about 20 minutes before anybody acknowledged us. After that however, service in the restaurant was very good and surprisingly the food - - fantastic. The next morning our toilet (which we hadn't used yet) started gurgling, making noises, then filling up. We called downstairs and we grateful that housekeeping responded quickly. (For a moment, we thought we had entered the twilight zone and were staying at a hotel with no staff members). Overall, the hotel decor is very kitch rather than sleek, modern, and classy. The staff - - still looking for their 15 minutes of fame, have obviously not found it and are bitter about having to work in the "service" industry.

Reviews.Title: “The Downtown Standard still rocks”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the standard are contemporary and totally original. How cool to get a shower bigger than my whole bathroom at home... The roof deck is a great place to hang out, even in the daytime when there's hardly anyone there. I love swimming in the pool surrounded by office towers - making everyone who looks out their window jealous!

Reviews.Title: “Get treated like B list, at an A list place”
Reviews.Author: crewser
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were married the weekend of June 10th in downtown L.A. We stayed (along with 20 of our guests) at The Standard in downtown. It is an ultra hip hotel that places style way ahead of service. From the front desk personnel to the bus boys and manager of the rooftop bar, they treat you like you are beneath them. Maybe if we were Mr. & Mrs. Smith we would have been treated better, but we are just regular hotel goers. The views from the rooftop bar are worth checking out, but unless they send all of their employees to a seminar on how to treat the customer, stay away. James in the group sales department was an exception to the norm at The Standard, he was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Bad bad bad, in the negative, non-cool sense of the word”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: BAD. just plain BAD. uber snobby. attitude with bad service and no good features or amenities to warrant the attitude and price tag. distastefully and scantily-clad club-goers ruin the atmosphere for the hotel patrons. dingy rooms with a lack of great views, even from the penthouse suite. i wouldn't stay in this place again even if someone paid me to. in fact, i am so furious about the fact that i had to pay $1000+ for a penthouse suite and didn't even get the basic courtesy a hotel offers its budget room patrons that i was thinking about calling up a friend who works in PR in LA to get the word out about this dumpy place. in fact, i may just do that, right after i post this vehement non-recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “"Run Run Run away from this Place"”
Reviews.Author: NMTravelerr
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel,just bar with rooms. The staff (with the exception of the busboy and maid service)at this hotel is the least attentive group of KIDS I have ever dealt with. Most of the time they just argue with you instead of providing service, that is if you could get their attention. During our stay we had a WOW room for $325 a night. Our TV did not work and it took 3 phone calls and a trip to the front desk to get it fixed. A strange thing happened...the water was brown for the first day. We had several friends with us in other rooms and they had the same. Also don't expect because you are a guest that you will get to use the facilites. The roof bar and pool as well as the outside bar was closed 2 of the 3 days because of private parties. Answer we got from the front desk when telling them of our disappointment was "You pay for the Room not the Facilities". All but one meal required that we sit for 20 minutes before anyone even acknowledged us. Service in the restaurant & bar (pool bar) was very slow and seemed unconcerned, even though the food was good. The decor is cool and fun, a nice change from most hotels. Otherwise nothing more than chic facades and a heavy dose of LA attitude. .

Reviews.Title: “Waste of time - awful place”
Reviews.Author: dottie dog
Reviews.Content: The Standard looks like it was decorated at kmart -- all plastic and not really clean. It was noisy, really odd and missing essentials that business travelers need. The hotel staff in general portray an attitude that they are better than their guests. Wake up call was 20 minutes late without an apology. The ironing board was a desk top (hard to iron the suit), the bathroom was just hard to deal with (no kleenex, not sparkling clean tile, no place to put your toothbrush). The bedroom was decorated in inexpensive grey carpet and walls were blemished. The all around step to the bed (without box spring and low to the ground) was easy to trip on (as I did at least twice). I quickly checked out after one night and moved to a more suitable hotel for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Below Standards”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a horrible experience at The Standard downtown hotel. If you are planning to party all night and come back to your room drunk... then this is the hotel for you. If you are sober and can see the dirty linens and sheets then you'll understand why I would never stay there again. If you really want to go to the bar upstairs then go stay at the Westin and walk over to The standard and have a drink. Not much to see except for a bunch of LA wanna bees.

Reviews.Title: “Great design, great deal, but can be noisy on upper floors”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The design of these rooms is ingenious, although, as others have pointed out, the glass-enclosed bathrooms make privacy an issue if you're sharing with someone. Every aspect of the design is economical and modern. The $95 rooms are on the lower floors and are exactly the same as the more expensive ones on the upper floors. The disadvantage is that they're not non-smoking rooms, but I didn't smell any smoke. The real advantage is that you don't hear the noise from the very popular and chic roof-top bar and pool; you do hear the noise on the upper floors. Also, the soundproofing between rooms is poor, so that I heard every idiotic word of the telephone conversation in the room next to me. The staff, contrary to what other reviewers have said, is very helpful and polite, and the restaurant is very good and not overpriced. Room service is good, too. I happen to like downtown Los Angeles; so, if you're interested in seeing the new Disney Concert Hall, the Museum of Contemporary Art, the beautiful public library, or the stunning Cathedral of Our Lady of the Angels, this is a great place to stay. You don't even need a car, as the subway is only a block away, and the sites mentioned here are within easy walking distance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “High concept on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Chicken_Talk
Reviews.Content: You know that moment -- late night on a business trip, shoulder sore from the computer bag. Pass through a hip lobby adorned with half-dressed young rock star and bohemian look-alikes, or are they for real? Mumble incoherently to smartly attired and helpful but inexperienced desk clerks, friendly and chatty in return as long as you are. But we have that in my hometown too. Stuff the card key in the slot with faint hope of what lies inside but expecting the worst. After some fumbling, a switch that turns on some lights and. . . . Yes, yes, yes! I said aloud. Yes. They get it. Why the jubilation? The place is thoughtfully designed and arranged. From the multiple dataports offering free high speed Internet, high quality CD player/alarm/radio with aux ins and outs, largish TV on a rolling cart, long desk area overlooking the window, and covered wastebasket (I think that's what it is) built into the bathroom counter, to the iron and board, wine glasses, robe, extra pillows, and soap already out and awaiting you in the shower. Rather than the usual tourist pablum they left three glossy trendy magazines that make for good reading. Nowhere outside of Italy have I seen such a good job of turning what is basically a budget hotel in an old building into a showcase of wit and style. The minibar is a sight to behold, and the prices are (for a minibar) reasonable. Not just the usual crackerjacks, red bull, and condoms. . . but thougtful extras: a map, sunblock, scented candle, a loungy CD, and my favorite -- pokeman vitamins! Public areas follow suit. The rooftop lounge / pool / bar is what makes the Standard famous, and true to form it was a zoo. We're talking five security guards, unbearably stylish visitors from Japan, a DJ and elbow-to-elbow crowds dancing, a drunk visitor escorted out the door, all this in the wee hours Monday morning. The room service menu is creative (24 hour a day miso soup), inexpensive, and runs all night long. And some of the design touches are laugh-out-loud funny without losing either elegance or a sort of innocent sincerity. Example? Room numbers outside each door are printed on "Hello, my name is. . . " cards. They seal each roll of toilet paper with a sticker showing, well, you have to see it. Why not five stars? This place is clearly not for everyone. Most rooms are small. If you are over forty like me you had better enjoy youth culture. There is almost no reason to stay in downtown LA except for business because it is boring by day and shuts down early. You had better be intimate with your roommate -- the glassed-in shower/toilet has no shield curtain from the main room. And no matter how high oncept it is still an old budget hotel. Fortunately, it is priced to match. It is a good value even at full rack rate. With this much cleverness there are always a few mistakes. There was no radio reception on the mini stereo, and no buzzer option, so it was useless as an alarm clock. The only point of the bubble bath in the minibar is to remind you that your room has no tub. $25 parking is steep in a city like LA with garages to spare. When I arrived they had allowed panhandlers to overrun the valet waiting area. All considered, I plan to return again and again. I can't promise you will like it, but I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel/Hate the staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The only reason I'm giving this hotel an average review is because the STAFF SUCKS!!! They act like they are doing you a favor by helping you out. Upon check-in I was given major attitude and asked questions that went unanswered and ignored as if they didn't hear me. Maybe it's my age? I mean I'm 24, prob the same age as all the guys working there so maybe they were trying to be cool or something. ANyhow the room itself is awesome and SEXY! If they could only get a better staff this would be one of my all time fav hotels.

Reviews.Title: “mixed bag-- loved it, a little, hated it, a little”
Reviews.Author: quantum_jane
Reviews.Content: The hotel's downtown location (if you want to be downtown), decor, and bedding and shower, and service were all terrific. So was the room service menu. I spent one night at the hotel, and the price for me was very reasonable-- $110, and at this price, I feel I got a fair deal. At a higher price, I would not recommend this hotel. As others have mentioned previously, the soundproofing in the building is pretty weak. I was awoken at 3 A.M. by some rowdy people in the room next to me, sounded like about 3 guys laughing and talking pretty loudly in their own room, and it was loud enough through the room walls that even with heavy duty earplugs I couldn't sleep through it., until after knocking on the wall and yelling through it to ask them to keep it quiet, half an hour later they shut up. It seems to me problematic that 3 guys having animated conversation in their next room could wake me up... that is seriously flawed soundproofing. It was enough of a problem to make me think twice about staying here again, although at the price of 110 or lower, I might just roll my dice and hope for quieter neighbors. If you've already booked, don't worry, it was a fine experience overall. Although the showers, as mentioned, are room length and the glass walls means anyone in the bedroom can look in at you... so if you're crashing with someone who doesn't normally see you naked, well, good luck. :)

Reviews.Title: “Extremely bizarre...yet intriguing”
Reviews.Author: Kamikea
Reviews.Content: I knew something was a litttle strange as we approached the hotel. The lit -up hotel sign, The Standard, was upside down. As we walked past the golden elevators and gold marble walls I thought ,perhaps that this wasn't the hotel people had told us about. As we turned the corner, we were greeted with shag rugs, ultra- retro furniture and a larger than life mobile hanging from the ceiling. There is a diner located on the first floor that was a cross between Mel's Diner from Alice, and my nana's kitchen. We opted to sit outdoors instead. There is a patio with palms, heat lamps and a fire-pit. It was pretty cool. The food was great and well presented. We had an appetizer that consisted of fried plaintains and fresh guacamole which was very tasty, a thai beef salad and a chocolate volcano cake to die for. The martinis were a steep in price, $12 for some white cranberry juice and vodka, but everything else was reasonable. The rooftop bar was extremely cool. There were sofas and ultra-modern furniture all around, a pool, and waterbeds shaped like red pods that could could climb into and hang out on. There was even a showing of Napoleon Dynamite on the wall of an opposite building. We did not stay at the hotel. I'm sure the rooms are just as unique.Overall, I thought it was a fun place to hang out and worth visiting.

Reviews.Title: “....it was hot!...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: YOUR energy makes this experience. The Standard just contains your every need of making the (dream) night....!! Not one ill thing to say. Our stay happend to be on Sunday. So my theory was not developed for wanting to be in the 'scene' on Fri nite. I agree some guests wanted to act too cool for skhool, but someone's got to give- & then u've just opened the gateway! Laughed, learned, & was entertained. The environment is incredible, unlike any other hotel. Where else do find Mr Bubbles? Employees were extremely personable & it felt like the real home away fom home..... -and all this talk about $$$.? sorry, but sometimes the best things in life are not free.

Reviews.Title: “So hip I couldn't see my pelvis”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There are people who try too hard to be cool. You know who I’m talking about; the drunk guy in the bar over in one corner in the green lounge lizard suit, hitting on disgusted girls and spilling his drink all over the counter. The Standard is the lounge lizard suited guy of LA hotels. It tries to be cool, “hip” and “like, dude…” The décor is funky 60’s kitsch, the directions sign in the lobby is interspersed with third rate stream of consciousness whining, and the staff is distant, cranky and cold, too “cool” to help you. It’s a good idea; a “theme” hotel for upper class art scene and club hopping types. But what was supposed to be a young sophisticated urban hipster’s paradise mostly came across to me as pretentious, smarmy and mean. It reminded me of the guy who says his fancy looking Mac makes him a better artist. Lots of mechanical problems with the room, slow, unpleasant service, sky high prices, yuppie posturing. That about sums it up. I suppose half my problem was that I’m over 30 and am just not cool enough to “get” the place, but somehow I doubt it. That’s what the three wise guys said to the Emperor about his new clothes. If you can forget about the neighborhood, stay at the Mayfair. They are much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “We thought it was great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It depends on what you are looking for, but if you are on holiday and you are looking for a funky hotel decently priced, this is the place. We stayed there for one night in August, as part of our west coast trip. I am surprised to hear about all these bad reviews, because everyone in my family (from 20 to 55 years old) thought it was not a night at a hotel but a great experience. We wanted to avoid the typical high end but poorly styled hotel, but we also didn't want to pay a fortune for a night. We all thought the decoration in general was funky, and we loved the fact that it was different to 90% of the hotels out there. We also really liked the roof bar, regardless of the music and the people (which we thought were fine), we loved the view. Having a drink surrounded by the illuminated skyscrapers of LA at night, was just great. In addition, we thought it was very good value for money. We found a rate in their site that at $125 entitled you to be upgraded to the next best available room, and we got a really cool room of a higher category than what we had paid for. The staff was not always very friendly and that's why I don't give them a 5, however, overall I thought that staying at the Standard Downtown was a great experience and I do recommend it, I'll certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you are 20 or making naughty movies.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to LA on business and thought I'd give it a try-I'm a travel manager for a consulting firm and our people are all over the W Chain. This place was clever - but at the end of the night - platform bed, crummy sheets and cheap towels don't warrant the price. If however - you need to make naughty movies - the glass shower is good and the low bed is good for passing out after drinking too much at that way hip nightspot full of hotties!

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother - tragic and definitely below 'Standard'”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaDuchess
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment. Having stayed all over the West Coast in all sorts of cool joints (I'm a travel researcher), I was looking forward to the "hip" Standard. However, "hip" apparently means "poor service and bad attitude". Driving around the block trying the find the unmarked entrance did not make me feel hip. Nor did struggling with my luggage up the stairs (no porters, no ramps - why??). Nor did leaving my car with the valet who said "don't worry, I'll take care of your car", then finding out that I'd been charged US$27.50 for the privilege without being notified (and I found out that they had my car parked in an outdoor public-looking carpark. Underground parking there was only US$8, but there was a sign saying it wasn't for hotel guests!) Nor did finding other unidentified charges on my credit card at a later date (I sent enquiries with no response). And let's not mention the room. It wasn't minimalist, nor stylish, nor Zen. It reminded me of those converted barracks hotels you find in the former Eastern Bloc. Mattress on the floor. A plastic chair. A plastic basin in the bathroom. As mentioned in other reviews, the shower has a glass wall only, so you can see in there from the room. Other hotels have done this with much more style - with blinds or similar available so that it's a little more "sexy peekaboo" and a little less Eastern Bloc. We chose to stick pages of the PostIt Note-like breakfast menus over important bits on the glass. The big problem was that there was only a thin curtain between the shower (and therefore the room) and the toilet - and there's nothing cool about hearing the toilet being used so clearly! Room service was so-so and very expensive - with a large service charge already tacked on. I only paid for it because, to improve my mood about the room, I had a bit to drink and there is NOWHERE nearby that's open, even on a Saturday night! Visited the apparently hotspot bar up top, after going through several security guards, etc. There was a queue of people outside begging to be let in so I was certainly curious. It was rainy so was understandably lacking ambience (being an outdoor poolside bar) but even so - skip it. No famous faces, a lot of semi-beautiful people craning to check each other out, but no industry types, seemed a bit bridge and tunnel. Not worth US$10 per drink anyway. The cheapest rate - for the classily named "Cheap" room - is US$99 not including tax. Plan a couple of weeks ahead and you can get a better or comparable rate at a better hotel in a better part of town. This place was really lacking class and style. It is the Emperor's New Clothes to a tee - all hype but no actual follow-through at all. I've never left a negative feedback on a hotel before, but I wanted to warn people. There's plenty of other places to stay - go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Never even made it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I made reservations at the downtown standard but needed to cancel them. When I called the hotel I spoke to someone in the reservations department who told me he had taken care of canceling my stay. Well guess what, of course he didn't, and now I have been charged for one night. Not only that but I was treated like a liar when I called to complain. Be sure to get a "cancellation number" if you change plans with these people because they are incompetent and rude and could care less about their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Sub-Standard”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although it presents itself as the uber-chic downtown destination in LA - the Standard is neither chic, nor is it very comfortable. Our room was basic, very basic - the pseudo-modern/minimalist attempt at design basically references any dorm room decorated with furniture from the latest IKEA sale. The bed was uncomfortable, the room cold. To add to the dorm-like feel the hotel has roving bands of RA-like guards that threatened to kick me and my four guests (who were forced to "be on the list" to get into the elevator to come to my room) out of the room because we were "talking too loudly after 10 PM." This seemed very strange since the roof party was rocking well into the morning. I later found out from other guests that basically everyone on our floor got the unwanted intrusion that evening. On the way out I waited 40 minutes for my car that I paid 25 bucks to park. Let me stress I am not some grandpa angry that kids were partying and being loud, I am in my twenties and complaining because the Standard is really sub-Standard.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Bad”
Reviews.Author: PeterChevyChase
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a WOW Suite at the Standard for two nights, and a smaller room for one nights. The WOW Suite was absolutely huge -- massive tub, nice tv, huge foot sculpture in the bathroom. The bed was fairly uncomfortable, but I thought the room was very quiet. The smaller room (in the front of the hotel) was fairly small, but exceptionally well laid-out. A bit noisier, but not more than any hotel. The health club is fairly small and basic, but the swimming pool in the roof is very scenic and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible - stay away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place SUCKKKKSSSS! The rooms are completely not soundproof - you can hear everything going on in the hallways and elevators. The windows are not double paned and there is ample street noise. The food is nasty, the staff is not friendly, blah blah blah need I go on?

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with The Standard”
Reviews.Author: Angelinaduck
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the reviews of the hotel, I also was concerned about staying there. When we checked in, a woman next to us was upset about something to do with a noisy neighbour and was asking to see the manager. This encounter put me on the alert for any little flaw at all, yet the hotel exceeded my standards (no pun intended) in almost every way. The staff was generally quite friendly (yes, a few of them think they're too cool to be nice, but that happens anywhere) and service was prompt. Valet parking is expensive but you can go in and out as much as you want and the guys can get your car upstairs in about a minute, which is nice. The beds are unbelievably comfortable, the tiniest details are attended to (even the labels on the telephone are playful), and the housekeeping standards are impressive. The drinks in the bar upstairs are pricey but very good and pack a punch. And the waterbeds are excellent for sleeping off the tequila in the blazing sun. My only concerns about the hotel are that I imagine it can get a bit crazy on weekends - I was there during the week and the rooftop bar had lineups outside on the street - and that the restaurant doesn't have a great selection of food. Otherwise, we were impressed and will be back in the future.
